story:
Short Summary

we are trying to do something that most developers don't do, we are making games that we ask what the community wants every step of the way. sure it adds time to development with the small team we have now but if we can get the funding we need then we can get better hardware and finally open our office and work full time on our projects.

  • We started in 2012 by developing a small retro Fps that runs on the old    version of darkBASIC we called it jailbreak, (it was taken down temporarily from our official servers to rebuild it in our new reaper engine) 
  • we are currently at work in three projects 1LIFEonline (MMO), Jailbreak2.0 (Classical FPS/ like ut or cs1.6) and our post apocalypse survival MO Roleplaying game(Red Rock)
  • our main goal is not the money and it’s to give the community games that they want and that they deserve
  • our target system will be PC Linux and Mac but hope to consoles in the future if the community wants it

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds it’s as simple as that.

  • We need to pay for licences and our hosting space.
  • We hope to open our first office soon. We have th seller lined up and they are willing to lease it to us if we can get the funds needed.
  • We needed to pay the bills. at the rate we use our systems for the project we run through power and internet quickly.
  • We have a small bit left from other funding sources but that is being exhausted quickly with fees and rentals, we simply can’t keep up with the demand at the rate we have funds coming in now.
  • We are willing to disclose any purchase chart and budget form to you on demand. to show that we are spending the money the way it should be spent

Now you may ask "what’s in it for me to donate?"

Well here’s what’s in it for you

TONS of glorious perks

Ranging from lifetime discounts on games to massive free collector’s edition of every release

We appreciate every bit of help not just by giving money but by spreading the word and pitching your ideas. So we reward every little bit we will do a referral and credit system so each friend you refer will count towards credit to get our perks. Hopefully that will be up by Sept.

Thank you for reading

story:
**SCENARIOS ARE UP FOR DOWNLOAD!**

Thanks to a very generous contribution of an anonymous party on behalf of the memory of Mark McFadden, the Lizard King, both scenarios are up for download now!


DELTA GREEN: The Last Equation


GODLIKE: The Invasion of Jericho Bay


**NEW ADDITION March 26, 2011**

Hey guys. Posting some answers raised elsewhere.


1) I’d love to use Kickstarter instead of IndieGoGo. They don’t do Canada yet.

2) Both scenarios are written and ready to go.

3) Everyone who contributes (whether or not we fill the total) will receive ONE of the adventures on PDF (their choice). This will take place in July after the deadline.

3) If we fill the Ransom, both will be released to the public for free download when the total is filled (which could be much sooner than July).

So, benefits for pitching in early — you get both scenarios (of course, people will pirate and give them away, but I choose to see the glass as half full). Second, you get them much earlier than July if the Ransom fills.

**NEW ADDITION March 20, 2011**

Fund this project and I'll release the first scenario from the next DELTA GREEN book up on PDF for free as well. The Last Equation is a complete Delta Green adventure ready to play for 2 to 5 agents. The fund total is still $1,000. If it hits that total, I'll release both Jericho Bay and Delta Green: The Last Equation in PDF for free, forever. 

About Dennis Detwiller

Hi, I'm Dennis Detwiller, creator of Delta Green, GODLIKE, Wild Talents and more. I'm an indie publisher who hopes to create great works and get them out into the world without breaking the bank. I spend evenings and weekends creating things I love, and then do my best to find a way to get them out. IndieGoGo seems like a great place to start! Help me out, would ya?


What We Need & What You Get

GODLIKE: The Invasion of Jericho Bay is a complete, ready to go 32 page introductory adventure to the GODLIKE universe. In terms of cost, it cost me about $1,000 bucks of time and effort to create it. 


If we fill the total, the PDF will be released to everyone forever, for free. It will be emailed to everyone, as well as being permanently available on Detwiller Design.

In the scenario, the players take the role of Talents pulled from the cauldron of battle in Okinawa and sent through a mysterious Bubble which has engulfed a portion of the island. On the other side of the Bubble they find that war is less easily fought when it's on their home soil.

story:
Our Story

Hello!


My name is Erick Harding and I created a card game called Legacy!


i was tired of games being over simplified and not very creative. i mean simple is good, however my mind craves something where i have to really think and explore possibilities  to come up with new and interesting things.


i really like to make people think differently.


The game itself was converted from a Role playing game i made when i was younger, and converted it over the years to a card game.


I also wanted a game where players could make money off of. i myself make money from home, and i think gamers should be able to do that as well even casual gamers.  so i am going to have 1000 dollar gift cards as tournament prizes. sorry no cash for tax reasons.


but there will be quite a lot of different cards you can get.. such as best buy, Fred Meyer, Safeway and many others. 


The Impact


I am raising money to fund the of my card game at www.legacytcg.com.


i am hoping to create a new type of card game , adventurous and creative, i want this card game to FEEL like a role playing game.


If my goal is not met the card game will still launch, but it will take quite a bit longer, as have no real job.


i have a sleeping disorder which prevents me from working a normal job, so i have to work from home. this work is unsteady at best, so i have to pretty much sell everything i own in order to pay for  programmers, artists, etc.


this Funding will help me in ways you cannot imagine.


What We Need & What You Get

What We Need & What You Get



What we need is 15,000 dollars for a Working game and legendary art. 


The prototype is almost finished and we can begin Alpha and Beta testing soon.


once this prototype is complete we can build from this and increase the mechanics of the game, get more artists, more voice actors, more everything. 


i intend to release this game on the Iphone/ipad and other devices as well as on PC and mac.


Should my goal not be reached the money will still go to the programmer to get as far as we can and i will scrape and sell what i can to try and meet the rest of the money.


well now for the fun part. the Perks!


The initial introductory set of this game has around 300 cards.  around 160 cards are going to be released upon Launch of the website.


several of those cards are completely unattainable by anyone other than investors.


i have set aside some Swag for people who are kind enough to donate for this cause.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just spread the word :) post it on Facebook, twitter, have fun with it. im trying to make a game that not only is fun, but that you can make money off of at home. so just spread the word please.

story:
Before we begin let's address some common questions!

Wasn't this project successfully funded on another crowdfunding site?

Yes it was! We at Black Locust Games reached out to Indiegogo to learn more about their Indemand program. Indemand allows creators to continue raising money and build our fanbase for as long as we like with no fundraising target and no deadline limits. Basically, Indemand with Indiegogo can be leveraged as a pre-order system for successfully crowdfunded campaigns.

Okay, so this is a money grab then?

Not hardly. By definition a money grab is an undignified or unprincipled acquisition of a large sum of money with little effort. Black Locust Games has been in business since 2013 and this is only our second release in that time. Our first campaign funded and delivered on time you can read more about it here. In addition, The Opulent has taken us over 18 months to create from design to where it is now. Having only 2 releases in 3 years has displayed that we are certainly not in a rush to crank out just any game and that each game we do produce, comes with our best foot forward. 

 Finally, The Opulent funded just enough for a very small run (1000 units) 75% of those copies are accounted for in our primary campaign. The remaining amount is not enough to meet the demands of a distribution partner so The Opulent will not be made available in game stores nationwide. We are okay with this as we enjoy growing our fan base organically and establishing direct relationships with our fans. 

So does that mean no stretch goals since the project was funded?

Yes, no additional stretch goals can be obtained at this time since the game is well under production at this time with the funds raised from the campaign. However, all stretch goals that were unlocked during our primary campaign will be included with all pledged copies here!

Why is there a limit on the pledge levels?

We already put in an order for the amount of copies that we could safely print and ship with the funds from the primary campaign. All copies available on this campaign are what we will have left from the initial print run (less 10% for damages, replacements, conventions, etc.). Once these are gone we will be considered SOLD OUT unless future demand warrants a 2nd printing.

 Now Black Locust Games is proud to present...

Designed by Casey Willett at Black Locust Games


Roll for Crit Review


On Board Games Preview




Gameosity review


Bowers Game Corner Review

Check out the Boardgamegeek.com The Opulent game entry page here or join in the discussion on one of The Opulent forums!

Like Black Locust Games on Facebook!


Follow Black Locust Games on Twitter!







Actually, click here.

The rule book is not final.  Some campaign scenarios may change. 


Casey Willett - Game Designer of Regnum Angelica and The Opulent. Co-Founder of Black Locust Games.

Aaron Yung - Graphic Designer / Artist / Photographer for Regnum Angelica and The Opulent.  Also the Video Editor for The Opulent video.  Co-Founder of Black Locust Games.

Black Locust Games in Nashville, TN was founded in 2012 by Casey and Aaron.  They launched their first game, Regnum Angelica on Kickstarter in January 2014.  The game funded, it was manufactured, and shipped to the backers within the promised time frame specified on the campaign.  Since then, they have been working on two new releases, one being The Opulent, and another called Nawakwa.  They are a two-person team with the ability to design games all the way from the mechanics, to the graphic design / illustration.  They also created their own website, all the videos, and even their mobile convention booth and signage made out of wood (photo below).  They take pride in what they have accomplished as a two-person team, but of course, BLG could not be what it is today without the help and support of their fans and families though, especially their wives! 


Risks & Challenges



The Opulent is a finished, polished game with all the digital print files in route to the printers since the project is funded.

We have figured out the costs and have worked it, so that we can offer you the cheapest price yet still make it a viable venture, and keep the components high in quality. Black Locust Games is a small team of 4, and we want to be smart in our planning and expectations. We want to be transparent in our communications to you, the backers. We want you to share our project victories with The Opulent as well as be aware of any obstacles that the project is facing. We are ALWAYS open to any suggestions and feedback as this project would not be possible without you.  With that being said, we are working with a great manufacturing company that has shipped successful crowdfunding projects in the past and we have full confidence that we can deliver the game to you in time. In any case, we will be happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all. Since the game is 99% complete (not including stretch goals), we don't regard this as too likely.

story:
Vous trouverez une version française en bas de page.



MP&Co: Monster, Pretty Girls and Company



  For our very first campaign, we offer you to finance the edition of three pretty chicks. 

  Eva, Lucy and Jess are available in three versions: naked, in swimsuit and fully dressed. Why 3 versions? Well…  Why not?

  Sculptors and hobbyist customizers would be interested in naked or anatomical version, whereas pretty nice curves’ lovers would enjoy the bodysuit one…  As for the dressed ones, they’d make perfect recruit for any zombies, aliens or monsters huntresses’ team… Even bad boys huntresses’ team...

  We’re offering you different plegdes to buy one, some or all of these versions.
Cast and massive production would be made by the best resin caster in France: Historex, this is a great guarantee!!

  To spice up this first campaign we also offer you to join in a small tombola. One or some tickets would be assigned to every pledger and you could win a painted version (by a Golden Demon Winner)!

   Finally, if this campaign reaches its goal, we’d have some surprises in store for you and could make new pretty huntresses and of course matching monsters.

  The campaign will last 1 month. Then copies will be casted and sent no later than September. There will be no delay ! Unless of course a meteorite falls on Historex's workshop or zombies attack your postman.



The dangerous Jess was sculpted by Stéphane Camosseto.

Nude version (missing the ponytail on this photo) :


Bodysuit version:


Dressed version:


The pretty Lucy was sculpted by Benoît Cauchies.
Nude version:


Bodysuit version:


Dressed version:
(Note : the cat is not sold with Eva. It is just there to decorate the base. You can purchase this cat in the shop Minisocles)


The gorgeous Eva was sculpted by Christian Hardy (anatomy) and Stéphane Camosseto (clothes and weapons).
Nude version:


Bodysuit version:


Dressed version:



With your help, we'll be able to keep on editing miniatures.
Naturally we'll offer you a gift. For each pledge you'll receive a Golem Ticket.

Once the objective of the campaign (2250 euros) will be reached we will conduct a draw and the winner will be offered the beautiful Jess painted by Sébastien Lavigne (Golden Demon winner).
A second and then a third draw will be made if you unlock the stretch goals!




Once the campaign has reached to the"Founded!" status we will start to unlock more goodies and miniatures.
If we reach to:
  • 3000 euros : we will unlock a painted dressed Lucy for the tombola (so there will not be one winner .... but two!)
  • 4000 euros : we will unlock a new miniature.
  • 5000 euros: we will unlock a painted Eva for the tombola (so there will not be two winners .... but three!)
  • ......

Unfortunately shipping charges are not included in the pledges.

Thank you add them to your payment :

Pledge "Just one!":

  • 3 euros for France, Europe and the rest of the world


Pledges "3 chic chicks!" and "all of them!" :

  • 3 euros for France (lettre Max cartonnée)
  • 6 euros for Europe (tracking parcel)
  • 7 euros for the rest of the world (tracking parcel)


If you have any questions do not hesitate to contact us. We assure you an answer within 48h.
Still make sure to read the informations attached to the campaign.
Maybe you'll find the answer there. Otherwise contact us!



Version française

  


  Pour notre toute première campagne, nous vous proposons de financer l’édition de trois jolies pépées.

  Eva, Lucy et Jess sont déclinées en trois versions : nue, en maillot de bain et habillée. Pourquoi 3 versions?...et bien pourquoi pas ?

  Les versions nues, ou anatomies, intéresseront les sculpteurs et convertisseurs amateurs, tandis que les versions en maillot feront la joie des amateurs de jolies courbes féminines…quant aux versions habillées elles feront de parfaites recrues pour toute équipe de chasseuses de zombies, aliens, monstres...ou méchants garçons.

   Nous vous proposons plusieurs plegdes afin d’acquérir une, plusieurs ou la totalité de ces versions. Le moulage et la production en série seront effectués par le meilleur mouleur résine en France : Historex, ce qui représente un gage de qualité.

  Pour apporter un peu de piquant à cette première campagne nous vous proposons également une petite tombola. Chaque pledger se verra attribuer un ou plusieurs tickets et pourra remporter une version peinte par un artiste du pinceau (Golden démon winner).

   Enfin, si la campagne atteint son objectif, nous vous réservons quelques surprises et produirons de nouvelles jolies chasseuses et bien sûr les affreux monstres qui vont avec. La campagne dure 1 mois. A l'issue, les tirages seront effectués par notre mouleur et envoyés au plus tard dans le courant du mois de septembre. Nous vous garantissons qu'il n'y aura pas de retard!!! A moins bien sûr qu'une météorite ne tombe sur les ateliers d'Historex ou que des zombies attaquent votre facteur!


Jess a été sculptée par Stéphane Camosseto.

Version nue (note: il manque la queue de cheval sur ces photos) :


Version plage:


Version habillée:



La charmante Lucy a été sculptée par Benoît Cauchies.
Version nue:


Version plage:


Version habillée:
(Note: Le chat n'est pas vendu avec Eva. Il est juste là pour agrémenter le socle . Vous pouvez trouver cette boule de poils sur le très bon site Minisocles)


La pulpeuse Eva a été sculptée Christian Hardy (anatomie) et Stéphane Camosseto (vêtements et accessoires).
Version nue :


Version plage :


Version habillée :





En nous aidant, vous nous offrez la possibilité de continuer à éditer des figurines. Il est normal qu'en retour nous vous fassions un cadeau. Pour chaque pledge nous vous donnons des tickets de tombola.


Dès que l'objectif de la campagne (2250 euros) sera atteint nous procéderons à un tirage au sort et le gagnant se verra offrir la magnifique Jess peinte par Sébastien Lavigne (lauréat de plusieurs Golden Demon).
Un second puis un troisième tirage au sort seront effectués si vous débloquez les stretch goals.





Si la campagne atteint son objectif (2250 euros), nous vous proposerons de nouveaux lots pour la tombola et de nouvelles sculptures.

Pour cela, il faudra atteindre:
  • 3000 euros : nous ajouterons la version peinte de Lucy et son chat pour la tombola (du coup il n'y aura pas un, mais bien deux gagnants!!)
  • 4000 euros : nous débloquerons une nouvelle figurine.
  • 5000 euros: nous ajouterons la version peinte d'Eva habillée pour la tombola (du coup il n'y aura pas un , ni deux, mais bien trois gagnants!!)
  • ........

Malheureusement les frais de port ne sont pas inclus dans les pledges.
Merci donc de les ajouter lors de votre paiement:


Pledge "Just one!":

  • 3 euros pour la France, l'Europe et le reste du monde
Pledge "3 chic chicks!" et  "all of them!":
    • 3 euros pour la France France (lettre Max cartonnée)
    • 6 euros pour l'Europe (paquet suivi)
    • 7 euros pour le reste du monde (paquet suivi)
    Si vous avez des questions n'hésitez pas à nous contacter! Nous ne pourrons pas vous répondre dans la minute mais nous vous garantissons une réponse dans les 48 heures.

    Prenez quand même le temps de lire les informations qui se trouvent dans la description de la campagne…il est probable que votre réponse s'y trouve déjà. Dans le cas contraire contactez-nous, nous vous répondrons avec plaisir!


    Un Grand merci à Charlotte "PadawAnn Cha" pour le prêt de sa très jolie voix.
    Merci à Franck pour le logo et Pascal pour les dessins.

    Merci aux sculpteurs (Stéphane, Benoît et Christian) et aux peintres (Sébastien, David, Julien et Didier)
    Et enfin merci à David (Earlinger) et Florian pour les petits conseils ;)
story_txt:
Vous trouverez une version française en bas de page.
MP&Co: Monster, Pretty Girls and Company

  For our very first campaign, we offer
you to finance the edition of three pretty chicks. 


  Eva, Lucy and Jess are available in
three versions: naked, in swimsuit and fully dressed. Why 3 versions? Well…  Why not?
  Sculptors and hobbyist customizers
would be interested in naked or anatomical version, whereas pretty nice curves’
lovers would enjoy the bodysuit one… 
As for the dressed ones, they’d make perfect recruit for any zombies,
aliens or monsters huntresses’ team… Even bad boys huntresses’ team...
  We’re offering you
different plegdes to buy one, some or all of these
versions. Cast and massive production would be made by the best resin caster in
France: Historex, this is a great
guarantee!!


  To spice up this first campaign we also offer
you to join in a small tombola. One or some tickets would be assigned to every
pledger and you could win a painted version (by a Golden Demon Winner)!
   Finally, if this campaign reaches its goal,
we’d have some surprises in store for you and could make new pretty huntresses
and of course matching monsters.
  The campaign will last 1 month. Then copies will be casted and sent no later than September. There will be no delay ! Unless of course a meteorite falls on Historex's workshop or zombies attack your postman.




The dangerous Jess was sculpted by Stéphane Camosseto.
Nude version (missing the ponytail on this photo) :


Bodysuit version:

Dressed version:






The pretty Lucy was sculpted by Benoît Cauchies.
Nude version:


Bodysuit version:




Dressed version:(Note : the cat is not sold with Eva. It is just there to decorate the base. You can purchase this cat in the shop Minisocles)






The gorgeous Eva was sculpted by Christian Hardy (anatomy) and Stéphane Camosseto (clothes and weapons).

Nude version:




Bodysuit version:






Dressed version:










With your help, we'll be able to keep on editing miniatures.Naturally we'll offer you a gift. For each pledge you'll receive a Golem Ticket.



Once the objective of the campaign (2250 euros) will be reached we will conduct a draw and the winner will be offered the beautiful Jess painted by Sébastien Lavigne (Golden Demon winner).A second and then a third draw will be made if you unlock the stretch goals!





Once the campaign has reached to the"Founded!" status we will start to unlock more goodies and miniatures. If we reach to:

3000 euros : we will unlock a painted dressed Lucy for the tombola (so there will not be one winner .... but two!)


4000 euros : we will unlock a new miniature.


5000 euros: we will unlock a painted Eva for the tombola (so there will not be two winners .... but three!)

......





Unfortunately shipping charges are not included in the pledges.

Thank you add them to your payment :
Pledge "Just one!":
3 euros for France, Europe and the rest of the world
Pledges "3 chic chicks!" and "all of them!" :

3 euros for France (lettre Max cartonnée)

6 euros for Europe (tracking parcel)

7 euros for the rest of the world  (tracking parcel)





If you have any questions do not hesitate to contact us. We assure you an answer within 48h.
Still make sure to read the informations attached to the campaign. 
Maybe you'll find the answer there. Otherwise contact us!



Version française
  



  Pour notre toute
première campagne, nous vous proposons de financer l’édition de trois jolies
pépées. 
  Eva, Lucy et Jess
sont déclinées en trois versions : nue, en maillot de bain et habillée.
Pourquoi 3 versions?...et bien pourquoi pas ?
  Les versions nues,
ou anatomies, intéresseront les sculpteurs et convertisseurs amateurs, tandis
que les versions en maillot feront la joie des amateurs de jolies courbes
féminines…quant aux versions habillées elles feront de parfaites recrues pour
toute équipe de chasseuses de zombies, aliens, monstres...ou méchants garçons.
   Nous vous proposons
plusieurs plegdes afin d’acquérir une, plusieurs ou la totalité de ces
versions. Le moulage et la production en série seront effectués par le meilleur
mouleur résine en France : Historex, ce qui représente un gage de qualité.

  Pour apporter un
peu de piquant à cette première campagne nous vous proposons également une
petite tombola. Chaque pledger se verra attribuer un ou plusieurs tickets et
pourra remporter une version peinte par un artiste du pinceau (Golden démon
winner).

   Enfin, si la campagne atteint son objectif, nous vous réservons quelques surprises et produirons de nouvelles jolies chasseuses et bien sûr les affreux monstres qui vont avec. La campagne dure 1 mois. A l'issue, les tirages seront effectués par notre mouleur et envoyés au plus tard dans le courant du mois de septembre. Nous vous garantissons qu'il n'y aura pas de retard!!! A moins bien sûr qu'une météorite ne tombe sur les ateliers d'Historex ou que des zombies attaquent votre facteur!




Jess a été sculptée par Stéphane Camosseto. Version nue (note: il manque la queue de cheval sur ces photos) :


Version plage:

Version habillée:





La charmante Lucy a été sculptée par Benoît Cauchies.
Version nue:

Version plage:


Version habillée:
(Note: Le chat n'est pas vendu avec Eva. Il est juste là pour agrémenter le socle . Vous pouvez trouver cette boule de poils sur le très bon site Minisocles)






La pulpeuse Eva a été sculptée Christian Hardy (anatomie) et Stéphane Camosseto (vêtements et accessoires).

Version nue :



Version plage :






Version habillée :











En nous aidant, vous nous offrez la possibilité de continuer à éditer des figurines. Il est normal qu'en retour nous vous fassions un cadeau. Pour chaque pledge nous vous donnons des tickets de tombola.





Dès que l'objectif de la campagne (2250 euros) sera atteint nous procéderons à un tirage au sort et le gagnant se verra offrir la magnifique Jess peinte par Sébastien Lavigne (lauréat de plusieurs Golden Demon).Un second puis un troisième tirage au sort seront effectués si vous débloquez les stretch goals.









Si la campagne atteint son objectif (2250 euros), nous vous proposerons de nouveaux lots pour la tombola et de nouvelles sculptures.Pour cela, il faudra atteindre:


3000 euros : nous ajouterons la version peinte de Lucy et son chat pour la tombola (du coup il n'y aura pas un, mais bien deux gagnants!!)


4000 euros : nous débloquerons une nouvelle figurine.


5000 euros: nous ajouterons la version peinte d'Eva habillée pour la tombola (du coup il n'y aura pas un , ni deux, mais bien trois gagnants!!)


........




Malheureusement les frais de port ne sont pas inclus dans les pledges.Merci donc de les ajouter lors de votre paiement:

Pledge "Just one!":
3 euros pour la France, l'Europe et le reste du monde
Pledge "3 chic chicks!" et  "all of them!":

3 euros pour la France France (lettre Max cartonnée)
6 euros pour l'Europe (paquet suivi)

7 euros pour le reste du monde (paquet suivi)





Si vous avez des questions n'hésitez pas à nous contacter! Nous ne pourrons pas vous répondre dans la minute mais nous vous garantissons une réponse dans les 48 heures. Prenez quand même le temps de lire les informations qui se trouvent dans la description de la campagne…il est probable que votre réponse s'y trouve déjà. Dans le cas contraire contactez-nous, nous vous répondrons avec plaisir!





Un Grand merci à Charlotte "PadawAnn Cha" pour le prêt de sa très jolie voix.

Merci à Franck pour le logo et Pascal pour les dessins.Merci aux sculpteurs (Stéphane, Benoît et Christian) et aux peintres (Sébastien, David, Julien et Didier)
Et enfin merci à David (Earlinger) et Florian pour les petits conseils ;)

story:
Arcade Distillery is proud to offer limited physical releases on PlayStation Vita for its upcoming games, War Theatre and Mecho Wars: Desert Ashes.
 


With Vita card production ending early in 2019, these will be among the last games manufactured in the west, and limited to a print run of just 2,000 copies each.

War Theatre

War has come to Kasalli. As endless conflict rages, seven mercenaries seek a mystical weapon that promises mastery of any battlefield.

War Theatre expands our classic turn-based strategy gameplay with RPG elements and deeper customization features. Take command of seven unique Hero units, each with a specialization to change the course of every battle. As you play, your Hero will unlock new skills and attacks, providing even greater strategic options.

Each Hero features their own single-player campaign, as they pursue ancient power to achieve their personal goals. The bleak continent of Kasalli holds many secrets, and War Theatre will considerably expand upon the setting established in Plague Road.

 

 
 

Mecho Wars: Desert Ashes

In the aftermath of a great flood, a vengeful leader threatens to conquer the world with the aid of a once lost technology and only a small but determined army stands in their path.

Mecho Wars: Desert Ashes is the definitive release of the 2009 strategy classic, Mecho Wars. Fully remastered in high definition, it features new hand painted art, new visual effects, an expanded single-player campaign and six previously unreleased multiplayer maps.

Mecho Wars: Desert Ashes utilizes an easy to learn turn-based combat system, balancing air, sea and land units. Further customize your play with perks unlocked by completing challenges and compete with others locally or online.

story:
Follow us on Twitter: @GoldRushTheGame

Follow us on Facebook: Facebook.com/GoldRushTheGame

Official Website: GoldRush-TheGame.com

Risks and challenges

We are a young, but experienced team. With the IndieGoGo community’s help, we will deliver a game you’ve never seen before. This game will be released as a quality product, but with your help, we can improve it and maybe even expand our team. Spare hands are always needed in this industry. So, long story short, there is no big risk, unless one day, our office will collapse underground, and we will all die a painful death. Ekhm… as you can see, it’s not likely - we honestly hope so.

story:
My Story Put your thinking hat on and discover a new world of possibilities!

Honestly, the inspiration behind Gigi & Lily is an inquisitive 4-year-old girl with an infectious smile, whom happens to be my niece. Likewise, both my niece and Gigi share the same name as well as a love of learning.

Inspired, I set out to create a kid friendly character that would encourage children to place their thinking hats on each day. Thus, helping them to think differently about the world around them while learning.

Using critical thinking skills Gigi and her special thinking hat Lily will teach kids how to count, read and solve simple math problems by thinking about their environment differently.  Learning is fun when you put on your thinking hat each day!

"DREAM BIG AND SMILE DAILY!"

Before I continue I would like to introduce my self. To begin, my name is Dale Robert Kilgore, Jr and I am a digital artist with a BFA in digital arts form Bowling Green State University (BGSU). "Go Falcons!"

Additionally, I also happen to be the chief artist, animator and programmer for the Gigi & Lily learning app. Honestly, I could be considered a one-man studio, sort of like a jack-of-all-trades! Presently, I have two iPhone apps within the iTunes store, which can be viewed here. Also, I am the artist, animator and programmer for both apps. 

In sum, I have a passion for story telling and game design. In fact my chief goal is to create captivating games that entertain and enlighten players of all ages.

Gigi & Lily's super-duper number adventure.  

Gigi has a big problem. She has lost her number buddies and needs to collect them. Join Gigi and her super-duper thinking hat Lily as they learn how to count to ten while exploring the world around them.

In this Interactive iPad app users manipulate as well as count objects on screen in order to capture hidden numbers. Once captured each number must be placed inside a special number jar. 

Gigi and her number buddies!

For example, players may be asked to swipe a web causing a spider to revel it’s self. With the spider on screen players are asked to count it’s legs aloud, with the aid of a friendly narrator. When the narrator and player have finished counting a hidden number becomes visible. This continues with various objects on screen until all ten number buddies are found. 

Gigi & Lily’s Super Duper Tree House. This is where their learning adventures begin.


App Design 

Briefly, the images below are mock screen shots and are the best representation of the interface design for the iPad application. However the design may change somewhat as I explore and test other designs throughout the production process. 

Additionally, all elements on screen will react to the users touch. Simply put if it is visible on screen than players can manipulate it. To illustrate, users will be required to perform various actions throughout the game such as swiping, dragging, and tapping objects on screen. The goal is to create an interactive world that players can manipulate as they learn.      

In addition players will be given positive reinforcement as they progress throughout the game. This reinforcement will be given with a special list of animated words that appear on screen as well as phrases said by the in-game narrator. 

Main navigation System 

Honestly, while working on this project I have had the pleasure of working with a talented musician as well as a gifted voice actress.

The official theme song for Gigi & Lily was designed to capture the characters inquisitive and playful personality. This was captured perfectly by the artist ShiftyPop! 

Music by: ShiftyPop!


Additionally players of the app will be aided in their adventure by the narration of the talented voice actress Adoxographist. Her kid friendly voice is a perfect fit for this learning app. 

Narration by: Adoxographist 



You can have a big impact. 

Put your thinking hat on and discover a world of learning with limitless boundaries and potential. Admittedly, while we often take the simple act of thinking for granted it’s significance should not be lost upon us.

For example, early humans mastery of fire and Thomas Edison’s creation of the first commercially useful light bulb, took us out of the darkness and ushered in a new world full of possibilities.

What caused such discoveries to come to fruition? Well, much like Gigi & Lily early humans and Thomas Edison had to put on their thinking hats before their discoveries. Simply put they had to prepare themselves to think about the world around them differently.

You can help usher in a brave new world by creating the next generation of big thinkers. By encouraging children to put on their thinking hats they may also learn how to thinking differently about our world. Honestly, I believe that the way in which we think about the world around us reverberates throughout our daily lives. You can help change the world that we live in one thinking hat at a time. 

Honestly, game development can be somewhat costly. Actually, cost can skyrocket rather quickly! This is in large part because of various elements like, equipment cost, developer fees, software costs as well as labor costs.

In fact, this is why I am seeking additional production funds. Presently I have already invested thousands of dollars on equipment upgrades, like software as well as a new computer powerful enough to render out the complex animations needed to develop the game.  

Unfortunately, purchasing the much-needed computer and software diminished my production budget greatly. Consequently, I am unable to pay for other production costs such as, developer fees, labor costs associated with hiring musicians, voice actors and an additional programmer. Also hardware costs for things like storage devices and additional computing power are presently out of my reach.  

In sum the money requested will go directly towards these costs. Sadly without these funds production of the Gigi & Lily Learning App will soon come to a halt. Presently, production has slowed down significantly as I attempt to work around the budget short fall. 


(Lastly, in the event that the funding goal is not reached production will continue and I will work hard to ensure that all backers receive their proper rewards. I am committed to finishing this project!) 

Join the super- duper-thinking club!

You can have your self or a special child recognized as a proud member of the Big and Jr. Thinkers Hall of Fame. Custom in game rewards will leave a lasting memory for a special child and yourself.  Check out the Cool Rewards below! 

Includes:

 1). One free download of Gigi & Lily Interactive iPad App!

 2). Special Digital Thank you Letter from the series creator!

Includes:

 1). One free Mp3 File of the original theme song of Gigi & Lily preformed by talented artist ShiftyPop! 

Music by: ShiftyPop!

2). Two exclusive Gigi & Lily themed iPad wallpaper designs featuring a child's name or yours. (Note designs will be reveled at a special time during the development of the application. 


Includes:

1). Share the Gigi & Lily app with one special friend!

2).  Included is your child’s or a special child’s Introduction into the Jr. Thinkers Hall Of Fame. (Introduction includes a name placed on an animated digital plaque displayed in side the game!) Below is an example of what the bronze plaque will look like. The plaque animation will include a shimmering and sparkling effect. 

Your special plaque will be featured in a special section of the game entitled the Jr. Thinkers Hall Of Fame or The Big Thinkers Hall Of Fame. The Jr. Thinkers Hall Of Fame will include the name of children. Conversely, the Big Thinkers Hall Of Fame will be for adults. 

(Note designs for the in game Hall Of Fame sections will be reveled at a special time during the development of the application. (See submission rules below.) 


Includes:

1). Hear your child’s, or special child’s name, as well as yours said in-game! 

Included is one Audio clip of your child’s name or another child as well as your name said by the in-game narrator. Audio clip will be attached to digital name plaque.  


Below is an example of what the silver plaque will look like. The plaque animation will include a shimmering and sparkling effect. 

Below is a sample of the talented voice actress Adoxographist, who will be saying your name and special messages inside the game! 

Narration by: Adoxographist 

Includes:

1). Hear and see your personal message in-game! Included is one audio file with a personal message attached to any in-game name plaque of your choice. 

2). Also you will receive a special recognition as a producer during the in-game credits as well as on your name plaque. 

Below is an example of what the Gold plaque will look like. The plaque animation will include a shimmering and sparkling effect. 

3).  Included is a rare digital production book!

Get an ultra rare behind the scenes glimpse of the making of the Gigi & Lily iPad app! 

The exclusive digital production book captures many of the elements that go into creating a world-class app! Your exclusive production book will include items such as concept art, as well as production stills with the chief artist’s notes.

Also, the technical aspects of the art design like the modeling, texturing and rigging of the featured game characters will be covered in detail. In sum with your special production book you will experience what it feels like to be a Game designer! 

General Submission rules

No Submission may contain any material that is abusive, vulgar, threatening, harassing, libelous, defamatory, obscene, invades a person’s privacy, violates any law, any intellectual property or other property or other rights, or is known to be false.

Furthermore no submission can contain bullying, harassing, obscene or pornographic, sexually oriented or explicit themes. The promotion of hate, personal injury, death, damage or destruction to property is not allowed as well.

Any submission violating any of the guidelines will not be allowed. 

Name & Audio Submissions

Name & Audio submissions share the same rules as those listed in the General submission section. Also, while all name requests following submission rules will be honored there is limited space on in-game plagues. 

Consequently, when submitting a name we respectfully ask that you keep them at a reasonable length. We consider a reasonable length to be between 1 to 25 characters with spaces. 

Even so, if problems occur because of the length of a name that you submitted we will work with you in order to find a solution. 


Which platform will the Gigi & Lily learning app be released on?

Presently, Gigi & Lily will be released for the iOS platform, more specifically the iPad.

How long will it take to complete the app?

Truthfully, a safe estimation for competition of the application is approximately 10 months. This estimation accounts for production, and testing phases as well as any unforeseen production delays or creative changes. The typical completion time for my previous iOS games has been between 8 to 10 months.

How can I follow the production process?

Weekly production updates will be posted each Friday morning through the official twitter, and Facebook, pages for Gigi & Lily. Updates will include a production photo and or artwork as well as a brief summary of key production goals that have been achieved for the week.

How and when do I get my perks?

As soon as the campaign ends all backers will be contacted though email and thanked for their contribution. Additionally, a detail explanation will be provided as to how perks will be given out. Also backers will be provided with a production timetable as well as details on how they can follow the production process from start to completion.

Typically all perks will be given out on launch day and will be in the form of a code that can be redeemed through the iTunes store. Also other digital rewards will be sent through email or be redeemable through a special site to be named at a later date.  

(Lastly, please feel free to ask any question in the commentaries, as they will be answered promptly.) 

Help tell the world about Gigi & Lily! 

Unable to provided a financial contribution? I understand and there’s another way you can contribute.  

Gigi & Lily needs you to put on your thinking hat and spread the word about our campaign. You can help by simply using the Indiegogo share tools above.

In order to use this powerful tool simply like our Facebook fan page, follow us on twitter, or follow our campaign. This can be easily done at the top of this campaign page.  

Thank you for your support and remember to put your thinking hat on before the start of each day!

Gigi & Lily official website.

proud member of the Big and Jr. Thinkers Hall of Fame. Custom in game rewards
will leave a lasting memory for a special child and yourself.  Check out the Cool Rewards below! Includes: 1). One free download of Gigi & Lily Interactive iPad App! 2). Special Digital Thank you Letter from the series creator!

Includes: 1). One free Mp3 File of the 
original theme song of Gigi & Lily preformed by talented artist ShiftyPop! Music by: ShiftyPop!2). Two exclusive Gigi & Lily themed iPad wallpaper designs featuring a child's name or yours. (Note designs will be reveled at a special time during the development of the application. Includes:

1). Share the Gigi & Lily app with one special friend!2).  Included is your child’s or a special child’s Introduction into the Jr.
Thinkers Hall Of Fame. (Introduction
includes a name placed on an animated digital plaque displayed in side the game!) Below is an example of what the bronze plaque will look like. The plaque animation will 
include a shimmering and sparkling effect. 

Your special plaque will be featured in a special section of the
game entitled the Jr. Thinkers Hall Of Fame or The Big Thinkers Hall Of
Fame. The Jr. Thinkers Hall Of Fame will include the name of children. Conversely, the Big Thinkers Hall Of Fame will be for adults. (Note designs for the in game Hall Of Fame sections will be reveled at a special time during the development of the application. (See submission rules below.) Includes:1). Hear your child’s,
or special child’s name, as well as yours said in-game! Included is one Audio clip of your child’s name or another child as well as your name said by the in-game narrator. Audio clip will be attached to digital name plaque.  
Below is an example of what the silver plaque will look like. The plaque animation will 
include a shimmering and sparkling effect. Below is a sample of the talented voice actress Adoxographist, who will be saying your name and special messages inside the game! Narration by: Adoxographist Includes:1). Hear and see your
personal message in-game! Included is one audio file with a personal message attached to any in-game name plaque of
your choice. 2). Also you will
receive a
special recognition as a producer during the in-game credits as
well as on your name plaque. 
Below is an example of what the Gold plaque will look like. The plaque animation will include a shimmering and sparkling effect. 3).  Included
is a rare digital production book!
Get an ultra rare behind the scenes
glimpse of the making of the Gigi & Lily iPad app! The exclusive digital
production book captures many of the elements that go into creating a
world-class app! Your exclusive production book will
include items such as concept art, as well
as production stills with the chief artist’s notes.Also, the technical aspects
of the art design like the modeling, texturing and rigging of the featured game
characters will be covered in detail. In sum with
your special production book you will experience what it feels like to be a
Game designer! General Submission rulesNo
Submission may contain any material that is abusive, vulgar, threatening,
harassing, libelous, defamatory, obscene, invades a person’s privacy, violates
any law, any intellectual property or other property or other rights, or is
known to be false.

Furthermore
no submission can contain bullying, harassing, obscene or pornographic,
sexually oriented or explicit themes. The promotion of hate, personal injury,
death, damage or destruction to property is not allowed as well.
Any
submission violating any of the guidelines will not be allowed. Name & Audio Submissions

Name
& Audio submissions share the same rules as those listed in the General
submission section. Also, while all name requests following submission rules
will be honored there is limited space on in-game plagues. Consequently, when
submitting a name we respectfully ask that you keep them at a reasonable
length. We consider a reasonable length to be between 1 to 25 characters with spaces. Even so, if problems occur because of the length of a name that you submitted
we will work with you in order to find a solution. 
Which platform will the Gigi & Lily learning app be released
on?Presently, Gigi & Lily will be released for the iOS
platform, more specifically the iPad.
How long will it take to complete the app?
Truthfully, a safe estimation for competition of the application
is approximately 10 months. This estimation accounts
for production, and testing phases as well as any unforeseen production delays
or creative changes. The typical completion time for my previous iOS games has
been between 8 to 10 months. 
How can I follow the production process?
Weekly production updates will be posted each Friday morning
through the official twitter, and Facebook, pages for Gigi & Lily. Updates
will include a production photo and or artwork as well as a brief summary of
key production goals that have been achieved for the week. 
How and when do I get my perks?
As soon as the campaign ends all backers will be contacted
though email and thanked for their contribution. Additionally, a detail explanation
will be provided as to how perks will be given out. Also backers will be
provided with a production timetable as well as details on how they can follow
the production process from start to completion. 
Typically all perks will be given out on launch day and will be
in the form of a code that can be redeemed through the iTunes store. Also other digital rewards will be sent through email or be
redeemable through a special site 
to be named at a
later date.  

(Lastly, please feel free to ask any question in the
commentaries, as they will be answered promptly.) 
Help tell the world about Gigi & Lily! 

Unable to provided a financial contribution? I
understand and there’s another way you can contribute.  
Gigi & Lily needs you to put on your thinking
hat and spread the word about our campaign. You can help by simply using the Indiegogo
share tools above. 
In order to use this powerful tool simply like our
Facebook fan page, follow us on twitter, or follow our campaign. This can be
easily done at the top of this campaign page.  Thank you for your support and remember to put your thinking hat on
before the start of each day!Gigi & Lily official website.

story:
WHY $750,000?

To set the bar you need to spend money, and we will settle for nothing less in order to give the Gaming Community what they deserve. We also want people to be able to experience this in every major city. 






                                           





General Info


The target market is a burgeoning mass of video game players, nerds like the GGhub ownership, developers, designers and programmers. The initial target market will be gamers from 18-49,  which comprises 53% of the overall gaming population.  The primary target market will be made up of men due to the fact that 58% of video game users are men but we also intend to exposing the Female demographic to gaming.

During the construction phase we will have about 3 months before we open, which will give us time to expand on our already successful online following.

Our following currently consists of a youtube channel with over 700,000+ views, a Facebook Group with 5,200+ followers, and a Twitch Streaming channel featuring GGHub Chelsea, the face of our franchise featured in the promo video above. It will also feature the tournaments we hold at GGhub, and the product demos as well. Our YouTube is purely dedicated to the creation of gaming related entertainment videos, put together by GGhub’s very own Evan Coad, who has a bachelors in Computer Sciences with an emphasis on Game Design. The Facebook group is a community for gamers in which trusted admins and GGhub employees will post funny and gaming related pictures, game releases etc. We eventually wish to turn the GGhub website into an online social gaming network to connect Gamers in a Facebookish way. Do you like to play Super Smash Bros or Mario Kart? Our site will hook you up with others who like to do the same. No company has tried to combine online networks with a physical location, and GGhub is poised to do just that.

Where do Nerds and Gamers go to hangout and socialize with their friends, that isn't a bar? The answer to that riddle is “Nowhere”. They would rather stay at home and play their favorite MMO and talk online to their close friends than go “party”.  GGhub will be the heaven for Gamers to meet with the closest friends but still enjoy what they love to do. Construction can begin within a week of being funded. Although we plan to have upwards to 30+ locations, our first location would be located in Denver, Colorado. The desire and passion for Gaming  in Denver is exploding. The need for a physical location to congregate and socialize with fellow gamers has never been more needed than right now. Online Gaming has somewhat isolated the casual/hardcore gamer alike, for the sheer reason that they want to enjoy whatever game they are playing with their friend, But the only realistic place to play the game would be at home. Due to the need of the high-end equipment, internet, and unlike the the older console games, only 1 person can play per machine. As of right now, nothing is being done about trying to bring everyone back together without sacrificing the games they love. GGhub’s 1st location will be on 16th street Mall in Denver, one of the most trafficked places in America, with over 3 million walk-bys a year. A local ISP loves the idea and is willing to give us 550 MB DLS (Download Speed normally over $4,500 a month) for $900 which makes this a very realistic idea. 

GGhub will use nothing but the best, and most cutting edge technology and accessories when it comes to gaming. Gamers expect the best, will pay big money for the best, and will settle for nothing less. “Razer” is a very good role model when it comes to what gamers want to see, and we plan to contact them for potential partnerships once construction is under way. GGhub wants to cater to all gamers. We plan to start with 50 computers in the first store, but also have 5 Xbox Ones, 5 Playstation 4s, and 5 Wii Us for our console gamers. We also will always be upgrading and evolving as the market changes. The Sony Morpheus Project and others like it foreshadow the future of gaming with virtual reality headsets. We plan to experiment and rent them for people to use in the store. GGHub raise the bar for LAN centers and gaming cafes nationwide. We will be exposing any gamer to the very latest in equipment, internet access and networking technology in a luxurious, sleek and instantly recognizable club-like atmosphere. A lounge area for gamers to gather and enjoy their snacks from our cafe, and maybe even get some hand -held gaming in. ESports is growing exponentially in both participants and viewership. GGHub is going to be the proving ground for aspiring pro gamers, and be THE place to come if you want to get involved with eSports.

story:
Following a tragic event, the recovering Kingdom of Grand Eden faces pressure caused by the expanding Amenthes Empire. Seeking to rule the world, they quickly learn of the King's hidden secret. With an all-out invasion, they plan to take the princess and the secret to limitless power. 

PS4 - Xbox One - PC
Currently a work in progress

  • Battle System: Experience a battle system that changes per character. Each character has a unique style that may not only change the appearance and information of the UI, but also completely change the game itself! The battle system has elements of a hack-n-slash and a shooter while feeling familiar to fans of Kingdom Hearts and the once titled Final Fantasy Versus 13 game. 
  • Highly detailed character development: You will obviously play as the main cast of protagonist throughout your journey of the world, however, they are not the only playable characters. In this game, you will have many chances to play as supporting cast and villains while learning about their pasts, goals, and personality. The goal is to make every character feel personal. 
  • Sidequests: While the traditional sidequests are here, I want to do something a little new with them. Added is the concept of episodes which will help to not only develop the characters involved but, provide a smaller story completely separate from the main story of the game! I plan for there to be many of these throughout the world! 
  • Beautiful nearly seamless environments: My goal is to capture the look of a real world. You will be confined to large areas in the world that will be massive and seamless. When airship travel is available you will be able to travel between continents. This is a massive world that is completely explorable! to add to this, there will be Points of Intrest which will take you on a scenic journey to amazing real-world inspired locations of wonder! 
  • Dynamic Events: Everything you do matters! Sidequests can trigger events in the world as well as simply exploring an area! During these events, you will face a variety of challenges ranging from monsters to enemy invasions!
  •  

 

 

 

 

Why is this Campaign so small? 

The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough funds to produce a powerful tech demo capable of showcasing what a moment of gameplay would be. The money will help me get various art assets that would make the game unique. Things like characters, vfx, foliage, etc will be purchased while I will build the entire demo from scratch. The cost of the full game is much greater and the demo produced here will help me build trust with you. I can do this! 

 

 
The reward for funding this early stage is huge and no, you will not need to fund the future campaign unless you want to! 
 
EDIT 8/2016: 
The rewards posted here might have changed! This is because of the time passed as well as the schedules of those who were willing to help. Those who have funded will automatically receive the rewards posted in the latest campaign. I'm sorry for this incident and I hope to have your continued support moving forward! 
 
$1: Every dollar counts and for your help, you will gain access to the Amaranthine Story mailing list and an exclusive Amaranthine Story Wallpaper upon the end of this campaign!
 

$10: By funding this tier your name will be featured during the game’s credits and you will be given a part in the history of Unelma. Your part in history can be funny, serious, gruesome, or boring and will be featured in the Grand Eden History Museum as well as the book - Amaranthine Story: Guide to Unelma and Lore!

 
$20: An early chance to see my game design skills on an engine I have used for 14 years. This perk gets you a copy of my demo game Eclipse Saga made with the RPG Maker engine. I hope to recreate this game for a future release and will be made in Unity after Amaranthine Story. This will be playable only on PC and will be distributed as a digital download.
 

$25: By funding this tier you will gain access to the very first beta test. This limited testing phase will give you the chance to play a small story written solely for this beta test. You will be the first to experience Unelma! 

 

$35: You will receive Amaranthine Story (Indiegogo Edition) the very moment the game is finished on your choice platform. This edition of the game features unique clothing, powerful weapons, secret skills, and one of a kind Items that will be special to this version of the game ONLY. This edition will only be available during the 2 Indiegogo Campaigns. 

 

 $50: You will receive a digital download of the complete Strategy Guide. The Strategy Guide features a complete walkthrough of the game's stories, mini-games, events, monsters, and so much more. A must have for anyone wanting to complete the game 100%

 
$60: By funding this tier you will receive the Strategy guide as a hard cover book along with all previous perks.
 
$75: By funding this tier, you will receive a special Amaranthine Story T-Shirt brought you by Sinthetic sanity. You will also receive all previous rewards.
 

$100: You will receive all previous perks that are available + The Mark of a Hero Necklace! Given to Matthias the very last time he saw his father alive, The Mark of a Hero Necklace was a gift from a young Sterling Astor to Theodore Gamble (Matthias' father) for saving his life. It is an important symbol and reminder to Matthias of his moral and goals. This Necklace is Stainless Steel! 

 

$125: You are a true believer!  By funding this tier, you will receive  a one of a kind Matthias and Juliet Embrace Figurine that will never be available again after this campaign. You will receive all the previous perks along with my personal thank you. Those who fund this tier will also learn more about the future of the series. (Limited to 10)

 

$200: For your amazing help in bringing this game to life, you will be made into an in-game NPC. This perk will require a front, and side view of your face. You will also receive all previous perks. (Limited to 10)

 

$300: By funding this tier, you will receive The Amaranthine Story Figure collection. 8 individual figures of the player party! You will also receive the Amaranthine Story game, strategy guide, exclusive wallpaper, Eclipse Saga Demo, and Placement in history. (Limited to 5)

 

$400: Become a playable Fighter in the Bin Darohm Battle Arena. Your character will also have special armor made to your liking. This offer will never become available again! (Limited to 1)

 

$500: 1 Figure chosen from any character or monster within the entire game, + The 8 Character Player Party, + A special edition of Amaranthine Story, and all lower tier rewards that are available and NOT one of a kind (This tier can not receive the $400 mark. The game is the equivalent to the $300 mark) (Limited to 1) 

$500 tier reward has been claimed!

 

    Risks & Challenges

    While a one person team seems a little impossible for the task I present to you, the only risk here is time. I know the game I want to deliver to you and the only risk is for me. Without your support, I will build this game using my own very limited funds. What I will create will be the base for what you will get in your hands. I have a very high standard and I settle for nothing less than what I find perfect. Want you get on a disk to be perfect. The challenge I see moving forward is timing and providing all the features. My plan of attack is simply to hire someone capable of the job to help out by providing the various systems seperately. My job will be to integrate them, debug, and move forward. With goals set and regular progress reports, we can keep to a schedule and ensure the game is released on the release date. 

     

      Demo Staff:
      ⦁ David Daniels| Original Concept, Director, Writer, Game Developer
      ⦁ Valentina Remnenar| Original Character Artist
      ⦁ Jessica Hurst| Character Modeler
      ⦁ Brian Noel| Musician, Composer

      Game Staff:
      ⦁ David Daniels| Director, Writer, Game Developer

      Special Thanks:
      ⦁ Jay Abbott| Original Character Modeler

       

      Platforms

       

       

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you are an artist, Modeler, Programmer, Musician, or can offer anything that can help this game become a reality, please contact me @ liondogstudios@gmail.com. Every bit of help is a big step towards making this a reality.

       

      What is your previous experience in Game Design?

      I've spent 14 years working in RPG Maker on various small releases. My most popular one was a game I made back in 2009 called Eclipse Saga (original release site is no longer online). It was based on a story I wrote from the inspiration of The Labyrinth and Dark Crystal. It is a game I am hoping to bring to mobile devices and possibly consoles after Amaranthine Story Chapter One. 

      How much experience do you have with Unreal Engine 4

      While you can track my progress via youtube, I started this campaign with about 1 year or so experience. Since then I've grown as a developer spending a lot of time learning how to create the various systems of an RPG. Today (2016) I have over 3 years experience with the Unreal Engine. 

      Did you mention a sequel to Amaranthine Story?

      The reason I've been writing this story for 10 years is because Amaranthine Story is the story of a universe. Each Chapter is a new world, and a new story connected through various events that will grow clearer as the overall story progresses. The story is epic, well thought out, and will experiment with various genres such as Fantasy, Romance, Comedy, and Horror. You can learn a tad more about the world of Unelma and some potential information towards the future of Amaranthine Story by funding the Amaranthine Story: Guide to Unelma and Lore tier. 

       

      FOLLOW EVERYTHING ON

      Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AmaranthineStory

      Twitter: https://twitter.com/Liondogstudios

      Pintrest: http://www.pinterest.com/liondogstudios/

      Instagram: http://instagram.com/liondogstudios

       

      Now on

My plan of attack is simply to hire someone capable of the job to help out by providing the various systems seperately. My job will be to integrate them, debug, and move forward. With goals set and regular progress reports, we can keep to a schedule and ensure the game is released on the release date. 
 



Demo Staff:⦁ David Daniels| Original Concept, Director, Writer, Game Developer⦁ Valentina Remnenar| Original Character Artist⦁ Jessica Hurst| Character Modeler⦁ Brian Noel| Musician, ComposerGame Staff:⦁ David Daniels| Director, Writer, Game DeveloperSpecial Thanks:⦁ Jay Abbott| Original Character Modeler
 
Platforms



 

 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are an artist, Modeler, Programmer, Musician, or can offer anything that can help this game become a reality, please contact me @ liondogstudios@gmail.com. Every bit of help is a big step towards making this a reality.
 What is your previous experience in Game Design?
I've spent 14 years working in RPG Maker on various small releases. My most popular one was a game I made back in 2009 called Eclipse Saga (original release site is no longer online). It was based on a story I wrote from the inspiration of The Labyrinth and Dark Crystal. It is a game I am hoping to bring to mobile devices and possibly consoles after Amaranthine Story Chapter One. 
How much experience do you have with Unreal Engine 4
While you can track my progress via youtube, I started this campaign with about 1 year or so experience. Since then I've grown as a developer spending a lot of time learning how to create the various systems of an RPG. Today (2016) I have over 3 years experience with the Unreal Engine. 
Did you mention a sequel to Amaranthine Story?
The reason I've been writing this story for 10 years is because Amaranthine Story is the story of a universe. Each Chapter is a new world, and a new story connected through various events that will grow clearer as the overall story progresses. The story is epic, well thought out, and will experiment with various genres such as Fantasy, Romance, Comedy, and Horror. You can learn a tad more about the world of Unelma and some potential information towards the future of Amaranthine Story by funding the Amaranthine Story: Guide to Unelma and Lore tier. 
 
FOLLOW EVERYTHING ON
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AmaranthineStory
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Liondogstudios
Pintrest: http://www.pinterest.com/liondogstudios/
Instagram: http://instagram.com/liondogstudios
 
Now on

story:
What is Maze, and what is the reason for this campaign?

Hello! This is Eli from TreeFall Studios! I am completely self funding this game, yet I need some funds to do a few non game related things such as upgrade equipment, that are vital to the game's success.  Also stretch goals have and will be added depending on funds, which can make the game even better. If you think this looks cool, but still ask why should I donate if the game will be completed either way? Here are just a few of the many good reasons:

  • It is basically like pre-ordering the game, there is a possibility that you will be scoring a download of the game up to a week before it even releases, cool right?  
  • You will get to take advantage of special perks only available to supporters of this campaign, if you are really into TreeFall and games, you will definitely receive some great rewards!
  • Although funding is not necessary, it will help in tremendous ways, the more funds received, the game can be extended with some pretty nifty new things that were not originally planned!
  • Although I have enough funds to be sustained while developing this game, funding would enhance and hasten our development. The PC I am currently working with is very old, more than 6 to 8 years old. It seems as if it is about to give out. Funds from this optional campaign will give me the ability to upgrade equipment quicker and make a better product. Less chance of losing progress:)

Maze is a First Person Puzzle/Adventure game in which you work your way through many different levels(mazes) to find the finish. You will collect coins, jump gaps, avoid spikes and environmental dangers, and dodge enemies in your attempt to find your way to the end of the maze.

*This game and it's elements are created originally and solely by Eli, not the entire TreeFall team. 

*This is game is planned to release in the United States, Mexico, Brazil, Canada, and possibly the PEGI regions of Europe.(If funding does not exceed 3,000 then Europe will be excluded) If you do not live in one of these intended regions, it is probably safer not to donate to get a copy of the game, as it may never make it into your region.

*All physical rewards are only shipped to areas within the United States, if you live outside of this area, please do not select a physical reward, as you will not receive it, thank you.

Story

Here is a brief look at the back-story surrounding the game:

    In the year 2050, half-way through the century, humans have become massively lazy as they have become so dependent on technology. Different races of robots have taken the main position in leading the world. The robots do not see the point of human existence, as there contribution to their way of life is so minimal. A few humans have been selected for a training program. The program is called codename: Maze. The robots have created a series of levels that range in difficulty and challenges in order to decide whether or not humans still have the intelligence and ability to complete these puzzles. If a human can make it through all of the mazes in the program, they will spare the human race and all will be well. If no human can pass the test, their existence will come into question.

The Length?!?!?!

Hi there. If you have played The Letter, here are some things you should not need to worry about:

  • The content. There are tons of mazes, between multiple worlds, bonus worlds, arcade modes, and possibly a multi-player mode. The mazes also present a fun challenge that can be quite enjoyable to play through again. You can also see how your friends fare with more difficult levels.
  • There is a save feature, it is greatly needed as there are many different mazes. Right now, the worlds are set up with 10 levels each. I currently have planned four different worlds, and then a bonus world. In the bonus world the levels are not tied to the story of the game, These will be creative miscellaneous levels that are very different than the rest of the levels, some levels might even shout out to other games! :D 
  • I do not know how long it will take to beat this game as of yet, as it is still in development, but it is a full fledged game, with a much longer length than The Letter. I am not totally sure if it will be the longest game out there for it's price point, but it is going to be a meaty experience, especially compared to what TreeFall has released in the past.

    Screenshots(Many shots taken from in-engine and levels in development)

    Some Old Fashioned Checkered Grass and Dirt Textures :D

    Example of a corner hallway in the ruins world, as you can see there are some coins shown, different plants and mushrooms!

    Here is a a shot of the second level, introducing jumping into the mazes. You might turn a corner and bam! Gotta do some platforming :P

    I think some of these little design touches are cute, I hope you agree!

    Here is a shot showing a multi-story maze. I added some help though, as you can see different color bricks indicate different stories. This is in the very beginning and offers three different stories to explore. You can also notice some spikes in the corner, be careful trying to jump that!

    Here is a shot showing a lot of the graveyard maze! This is level 4:D I did not want to show all of it...you might be able to solve it a little early haha! This level features different lighting, along with glowing objects that were different in daytime levels, and things like gravestones! Be careful not to get lost here!

    Not all mazes are square in their origin, some will be made of many different shapes, here is one I am working on, one of the first non-square mazes!

    Here is a quick shot of part of the first Hub-World. If you notice, each square pedestal area houses a different level. I will show a close up of what that looks like next.

    Here is a close up of where you would enter level one! It has a 3D model of the maze that floats and circles. The name of the maze also floats and circles above it! You have to complete Maze 1, in order to unlock Maze 2, and etc.

    There is a sneak peak at one of themes in one of the later worlds! Not much to show on that yet, some very cool things in the works though!

    Inspiration 

    I have been getting a ton of questions on MiiVerse about my previous game The Letter. One question that keeps popping up is, what inspired you to make this game? So here is my answer to that question for Maze. When I was a little kid, my best friend Mj and I used to draw mazes all the time. We would make different levels and make them harder and harder to try and stump each other. We would see who could make better mazes and who was the smartest by figuring them all out! It was a lot of fun, I remembered how much fun we had doing it, so I decided to make it into a full 3D video game! 

    Multiplayer Mode 

    Not totally sure if this will make it into the game, as it would take much more time to test, program and get working, but if funding exceeds $15,000, then I should be able to add a multiplayer mode! This is kinda like a stretch goal! In this mode, one player would play on the TV, while the other uses the GamePad screen! Each would be placed at different ends of the maze, (these would be custom multiplayer maps, not mazes from the main adventure mode), and each player would race to collect coins, and solve the mazes first. Depending on the map there would be environmental hazards, robot enemies, and traps! Play competitively, or cooperatively to solve these mazes with your friends! :D

    GamePad Features

    Currently the Wii U game has multiple uses in this game! One being Off-TV play, and the other being a real-time top down map shown of the each level! I am going to try and work even more features into the beastly controller as well! Rest assured you will feel the love with the Wii U GamePad.

    The Enemies

    Here is a quick look at one of the robot enemy models! He flies around with his little propeller, and has a little exhaust pipe on his backside to push him forward! Still in progress, but these guys will be after you in some of the mazes, making it difficult to progress safely! 

    A few closing thoughts.

    I hope you have enjoyed what you have seen on this campaign, and you decide to contribute! :) The game is pretty early in development, but the pr[ocess is going so smoothly that I decided to go ahead and share it with you. There are many cool perks for you to check out, and more updated videos will be launching soon to showcase more levels, features, enemies, and music! This is not our only new game announcement, we will be teasing another one soon, so stay tuned on our social media pages and MiiVerse for updates! I hope you like what you see so far! Thanks for taking the time out of your day to check out our game, I cannot thank you enough,
    Eli of TreeFall Studios.
