story:
NOTICE- The game is coming to Wii U, Android, Linux, iOS, PC and Mac as long as we reach our first goal! We will also add optional control to all systems so that everyone can play the game on any system! 

                              

 
Swipe Knight(working title) is a Metroidvania game controlled with the touchscreen.

The controls are as follows:

Swipe up to jump and swipe down to slide.
Swipe in the direction the hero is walking to attack.
Swipe in the opposite direction to turn around and walk in the other direction.
Swipe down while jumping to do a down thrust.
And more.

Players can also control the hero with the left analog stick in the same way as the swipes. 


The idea came from all these popular mobile games like cookie run and subway surf, they have a particular addictive feel to them.

I wanted to capture the addictive gameplay of those games and put it in a metroidvania style setting. The result is something truly unique.

You get the best of 2 worlds, the simple addictive gameplay elements of a casual game taken to a whole new level mixed with the excitement of exploring a vast world, finding new items, fighting huge bosses and more! 

It is worth pointing out is that the Wii U version will get a couple of special worlds, bosses that take full advantages of the 2 screens and Wii U’s other unique features. 

To put it blank, this game is going to be made for the Wii U with its unique hardware in mind, but it will still be possible to port most of the game to Android, iOS, PC, Mac and Linux even if it means those versions are going to miss out on some of the worlds and bosses that the Wii U version has, but we will do our best to get as much of the content in to all the versions.

The 2 screens will be used in many different ways, but without saying to much let's take a look at one dual screen concept that you will see in the game:

You can control the hero with either swipes or the left analog stick, so it only takes ONE hand to control ONE character. The Wii U gamepad have TWO analog sticks and one touchscreen, and the TV screen. So there will be parts where you are controlling 2 characters separated from each other at the same time, one on the gamepad and one on the TV screen!

We don’t want to give away any more of our 2 screen ideas, because we don’t want to see them end up in someone else’s game before we released ours, but hopefully we got you excited by now.


                  

Swipe Knight does not only have 1, but 2 stories. The main story which will be about 65% of the game is focusing on how the leader of a cult is trying to resurrect an evil demon who’s soul has been trapped inside a ghost ship. 

The other story which will be about 35% of the game. It  is found in the secret areas and will progress more as you find a new secret area of the game. So the game has a big emphasis on exploration and secrets to say the least!

     


Not only will you visit a desert, forest, hell themes, will you also visit worlds with more unique themes like:
Cyberpunk Zone
Boardgame World
30s Cartoon Alley
Survival-horror Mansion
Garden of Love
To name a few.

Most of the worlds in the trailer have been from the more common ones, and if you want to see the more wacky ones then come back here on a regular basis because we are going to post some of them here in the coming updates.

But it’s not just the looks of the worlds that will make them different from one and other, each world will have its own unique set of enemies, puzzles, obstacles and gimmicks.

                         

1.  When you take a hit you don’t just lose a health point and start to blink like in Mario for example. No, taking a hit means you’re sent back to the beginning of the screen. This creates the perfect balance between challenge and reward. 

The segments can be hard but there all fairly short, so having to replay one a couple of times won’t get frustrating and beating a hard segment you been stuck on for a while gives you a really rewarding feeling of accomplishment.

Watch the video to fully understand.


2.  Since this is a metroidvania game of course you are going to find new weapons and items. And instead of you going to a start menu and choose what weapon or item you want to use, the game will automatically do it for you. What the hero carry in his hand when he enter a screen is what that segment is going to be based around.

                             

That allows us to create segments that are completely built around the gimmick of a particular item or weapon. We are aiming for huge variety in gameplay. We also want to point out that if you enter a screen that is based around an item or weapon that you don’t have yet then the hero will just carry a sword.


                                   

Tommy Nordered 27 (Programmer / Designer)
Been making games for over 5 years and is a registered Wii U developer, approved by Nintendo to make games for Wii U.

Olle Laver 29(Director)
Works closely to Tommy with writing the story, come up with game mechanics and everything else.

Michael Marhal 33(Music composer)
Composer from Canada is making the music for the game.
Here are his youtube and soundcloud links:

http://www.youtube.com/user/michaelmarhal
https://soundcloud.com/michael-marhal


     

Tommy is the only one that is going to work full time on the game and he is planning to spend 16 months to make the game, and we also want 3 extra months just in case something unforeseen happens. That is a total of 19 months, and under this time he have to pay rent, food, his daughter’s school, and other bills.

We have come to the conclusion that the minimum for him and his family to survive under the time it takes to make the game is $1500 a month.

$1500 x 19 = $28500
Hardware costs $2500
$6000 T-shirts for backers and Indiegogo fees.

That is a total of $37000

 Here is our stretch goals.

                

                    

As stated earlier the game will have 2 separated stories (one main story 65% of the game and a secret story 35% of the game), and if we reach $44000 we will add a third story to the game which will be reachable when the player has beaten the first 2 stories.

If we reach all the way to $50000 we will add a second quest to the game like in Zelda 1 for NES, which means that when you beat the game you can play it again in a New Game Plus mode which is a rearranged version of the game.

  



Got an idea for a cool monster that you want to battle in the game once Swipe Knight comes out?
Better yet, would you like to have YOUR monster in the game and have it stated in the games Monster Log that YOU (full name or nickname) came up with the idea for this monster?

You got it! The game will include a Monster Log, and every time you beat a new monster will that monsters biography be unlocked in the Monster Log along with the name of who came up with the idea for the monster.

The game will also include a World log that will work like the monster log but for the games many worlds.

So if you got a cool idea for a monster or world and want bragging rights once the game comes out, this is your chance!

           

That’s right! It doesn’t matter if you donate $10 or $1000, everyone that helps make this game possible will be rewarded with being in the game. Remember that secret second story that this game has? Yeah, everyone that donates will play a role in that story. And that’s all were going to say about that for now.

Obviously the higher donation, the more outstanding will your inclusion in the game be.

If your ”Exclusive Game Inclusion” is Level 1 or 2 then send the name you wish to be displayed in the game (real name or nick name).

If your “Exclusive Game Inclusion” is Level 3 or above then send us a picture of yourself taken from the side.

If your ”Exclusive Game Inclusion” is Level 4 or above then also add quote that you wish to be displayed in the game along with your picture and name, just make sure the quote no longer than 20 words.

If your “Exclusive Game Inclusion” is Level 5 then also send us another picture of yourself, but this one should be taken from right in front.

The quote could be anything, for example “My name is Tony and I love dark chocolate” or “Dinosaurs are stupid, I am sure glad they are all extinct”. The only thing we won’t accept is anything hateful, racist, political, sexist, religious or anything down those lines.

Send everything to SwipeKnight@hotmail.com , and if you got any questions then send them there too.

Everyone that donates at least $15 will also have their name in the games credit screen along with a big THANK YOU.

Hopefully we presented enough awesomeness for you to feel that you want to be a part of Swipe Knight.

With our final words we want to say that for the coming 45 days we are going to try to always be available to communicate with people who are interested in Swipe Knight, and we will also focus on drawing new worlds, bosses and monsters to post here. So if you donated to have your enemy included in the game, chances are that you’ll see him in a coming update.

Once the Indiegogo campaign is over we get back to making the game as usual, but right now we are here for you guys. If you got any questions, suggestions or wishes on what you would like to see in coming updates please send them to SwipeKnight@hotmail.com

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you like what you see then please help us by posting the image below on your Facebook, Twitter or other social media and link it to this campaign.

It would be a tremendous help to us, and if everyone that have an interrest in Swipe Knight do it then we shouldn't be any problem to reach our goal.

Thank you.

PS). Many people have pointed out that Swipe Knight sounds similar to the recently released game Shovel Knight, so we are considering changing the name.DS


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE 1:

We have had many people contact us and wanting us to put the game on PC and Mobile as well because they don’t have a Wii U. So we have made the decision to also put the game on iOS, Android, Linux, PC and MAC!

This is NOT going to affect the Wii U version, we are still going to implement all the cool dual screen ideas, and we will do our best to port the game over to the other systems. If we end up with too much content that we can't port over to the other systems then we will make some exclusive content for them to make up for it.

                   

UPDATE 2:

Lot's of people have been asking to see the "30's cartoon alley" world. So here it is:

other at the same time, one on the gamepad and one on the TV screen!
We don’t want to give away any more of our 2
screen ideas, because we don’t want to see them end up in someone else’s game
before we released ours, but hopefully we got you excited by now.                  Swipe Knight does not only have 1, but 2
stories. The main story which will be about 65% of the game is focusing on how
the leader of a cult is trying to resurrect an evil demon who’s soul has been
trapped inside a ghost ship. The other story which will be about 35% of the
game. It  is found in the secret areas
and will progress more as you find a new secret area of the game. So the game
has a big emphasis on exploration and secrets to say the least!     Not only will you visit a desert, forest, hell
themes, will you also visit worlds with more unique themes like:
Cyberpunk Zone
Boardgame World
30s Cartoon Alley
Survival-horror Mansion
Garden of Love
To name a few.
Most of the worlds in the trailer have been from the more common ones, and if
you want to see the more wacky ones then come back here on a regular basis
because we are going to post some of them here in the coming updates.But it’s not just the looks of the worlds that will make them different from
one and other, each world will have its own unique set of enemies, puzzles,
obstacles and gimmicks.                         1. 
When
you take a hit you don’t just lose a health point and start to blink like in
Mario for example. No, taking a hit means you’re sent back to the beginning of
the screen. This creates the perfect balance between challenge and
reward.  
The segments can be hard but there all fairly short, so having to replay
one a couple of times won’t get frustrating and beating a hard segment you been
stuck on for a while gives you a really rewarding feeling of accomplishment.Watch the video to fully understand.2.  Since this is a metroidvania game of course you are going to find new weapons and items. And instead of you going
to a start menu and choose what weapon or item you want to use, the game will automatically do it for you. What the hero carry in his hand when he enter a
screen is what that segment is going to be based around.                              That allows us to create segments
that are completely built around the gimmick of a particular item or weapon. We are aiming for huge variety in gameplay. We also want to point out that if you
enter a screen that is based around an item or weapon that you don’t have yet
then the hero will just carry a sword.                                   Tommy Nordered 27 (Programmer /
Designer)
Been making games for over 5 years and is a registered Wii U developer, approved by Nintendo to make games
for Wii U.Olle Laver 29(Director)Works closely to Tommy with writing the story, come up with game mechanics and everything else.

Michael Marhal 33(Music composer)
Composer from Canada is making the music for the game.
Here are his youtube and soundcloud links:

http://www.youtube.com/user/michaelmarhalhttps://soundcloud.com/michael-marhal     Tommy is the only one that is going to work
full time on the game and he is planning to spend 16 months to make the game,
and we also want 3 extra months just in case something unforeseen happens. That
is a total of 19 months, and under this time he have to pay rent, food, his daughter’s school, and other bills.We have come to the conclusion that the minimum for him and his family to survive
under the time it takes to make the game is $1500 a month.
$1500 x 19 = $28500
Hardware costs $2500
$6000 T-shirts for backers and Indiegogo fees.
That is a total of $37000 Here is our stretch goals.                                    
As stated earlier the game will have 2
separated stories (one main story 65% of the game and a secret story 35% of the
game), and if we reach $44000 we will add a third story to the game which will
be reachable when the player has beaten the first 2 stories.
If we reach all the way to $50000 we will add a
second quest to the game like in Zelda 1 for NES, which means that when you
beat the game you can play it again in a New Game Plus mode which is a
rearranged version of the game.  Got an idea for a cool monster that you want to
battle in the game once Swipe Knight comes out? 
Better yet, would you like to have YOUR monster in the game and have it stated
in the games Monster Log that YOU (full name or nickname) came up with
the idea for this monster? You got it! The game will include a Monster Log, and every time you beat a new monster will
that monsters biography be unlocked in the Monster Log along with the name of
who came up with the idea for the monster.
The game will also include a World log that
will work like the monster log but for the games many worlds.
So if you got a cool idea for a monster or
world and want bragging rights once the game comes out, this is your chance!           That’s right! It doesn’t matter if you donate
$10 or $1000, everyone that helps make this game possible will be rewarded with
being in the game. Remember that secret second story that this game has? Yeah,
everyone that donates will play a role in that story. And that’s all were going
to say about that for now.
Obviously the higher donation, the more outstanding will
your inclusion in the game be.
If your ”Exclusive Game Inclusion” is Level 1
or 2 then send the name you wish to be displayed in the game (real name or nick
name).
If your “Exclusive Game Inclusion” is Level 3
or above then send us a picture of yourself taken from the side.
If your ”Exclusive Game Inclusion” is Level 4
or above then also add quote that you wish to be displayed in the game along
with your picture and name, just make sure the quote no longer than 20 words.
If your “Exclusive Game Inclusion” is Level 5 then also send us another picture of yourself, but this one should be
taken from right in front.
The quote could be anything, for example “My name
is Tony and I love dark chocolate” or “Dinosaurs are stupid, I am sure glad they are all extinct”. The only thing we won’t accept is anything hateful,
racist, political, sexist, religious or anything down those lines.
Send everything to SwipeKnight@hotmail.com , and if you got any questions then send them
there too.Everyone that donates at least $15 will also have their name in the games credit screen along with a big THANK YOU.
Hopefully we presented enough awesomeness for
you to feel that you want to be a part of Swipe Knight.
With our final words we want to say that for the
coming 45 days we are going to try to always be available to communicate with
people who are interested in Swipe Knight, and we will also focus on drawing new
worlds, bosses and monsters to post here. So if you donated to have your enemy
included in the game, chances are that you’ll see him in a coming update.
Once the Indiegogo campaign is over we get back
to making the game as usual, but right now we are here for you guys. If you got
any questions, suggestions or wishes on what you would like to see in coming
updates please send them to SwipeKnight@hotmail.com------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------If you like what you see then please help us by posting the image below on your Facebook, Twitter or other social media and link it to this campaign.It would be a tremendous help to us, and if everyone that have an interrest in Swipe Knight do it then we shouldn't be any problem to reach our goal.
Thank you.PS). Many people have pointed out that Swipe Knight sounds similar to the recently released game Shovel Knight, so we are considering changing the name.DS
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE 1:
We have had many people contact us and wanting us to
put the game on PC and Mobile as well because they don’t have a Wii U. So we
have made the decision to also put the game on iOS, Android, Linux, PC and MAC!
This is NOT going to affect the Wii U version, we are
still going to implement all the cool dual screen ideas, and we will do our
best to port the game over to the other systems. If we end up with too much
content that we can't port over to the other systems then we will make some
exclusive content for them to make up for it.                   UPDATE 2:Lot's of people have been asking to see the "30's cartoon alley" world. So here it is:

story:
Early Gameplay Demo is available now to play !
http://gamejolt.com/games/arcade/bad-ass-babes/49527/


Short Summary

This is a unique game that is sure to leave a lasting impression.

An Alien invasion sees the men of earth mutated into slaves and the women captured for an alien breeding program. A few strong, bad ass babes stand up and save the day.

What We Need & What You Get

 We have taken a unique approach to this campaign and have already started work on this game, I personally have been working for over a year already spending countless hours on the project and have already cast and shot various models for the game. The funding campaign will help me reimburse these models (and myself) and allow me to focus on the other aspects of the game. Funding will also assist in hiring other staff to assist in project.

All who pledge over $10 will get a free copy of the game. When funded and game is complete I will then be selling the game for approx $30 so best way to get the game cheap is to help fund and support the project in its infancy.

There are various perks for those that donate, there is opportunity for you to be featured in the game itself !

Risks & Challenges

The risks involved will be that the game takes longer than expected to make, however I am in no rush and willing to spend the required time to perfect the game. I want to make this game as great as possible.

I will keep all backers happy by releasing constant game demos showing progress as well as regular updates via Facebook page. You are all a part of this projects evolution.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone can donate, but that doesn't mean you can not still help.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

And that's all there is to it !

Join our Facebook poage : www.facebook.com/badassbabesgame

story:
The JCC Games is an olympic style event held annually for Jewish teens between the ages of 13 and 16. I have been looking forward to it for years.

The contributions that you make will help cover some of the fees (plane, uniforms, etc). I have already made the team. We start practicing in a couple of months. And I will leave with the team in August, if I can raise the funds.

story:
Carbon Based Gaming Radio

Carbon Based Gaming Radio is a new radio show by the production team that brought you Radio Nero with Milo Yiannopoulos. Carbon Based Gaming aims to take an introspective look at the news, issues, and culture surrounding videogames and technology. This show is going to be a forum for the kinds of discussions with our guests that you won’t find anywhere else by operating under the lens of investigative journalism. 

We hope to launch the show as soon as possible but we can’t do that without your support.


Special thanks to Slade Villena for the music!


UPDATE 5!



Hello my name is Robin Gething, co-host to Carbon Based Gaming Radio and I'd like to thank all of you for contributing so far to our Indiegogo campaign. 

We have got time to reach our first stretch goal $6,000 and give you 1 hour episodes. With that in mind, I'd like to offer, for a those willing to put 50 dollars to the cause, a reading of a short children's tale of your choice, recorded and sent to you to play to your kids, or just the favorite. You know which one.


Cheers,
-Robin


UPDATE 4!


Recently the Twittersphere was ablaze with controversy surrounding the #GamerGate community and inside plays on the part of Gawker Media. We're adding a special bonus episode for Digital Carbon members where we investigate this flashpoint with key streaming personalities of Hitbox and Youtube. We will also interview a special anonymous expert from the intelligence community who can give us a true understanding of how government and corporate subterfuge actually works. This is going to be a good one!

Mundane Matt | CONFIRMED


UPDATE 3!

Hatred

We are sooooooo close to being funded! Thank you guys!

We saved one of the biggest announcements for last, but here it is. The developers of the upcoming and already controversial title "Hatred" will be joining Carbon Based Gaming Radio to talk to us about their new game. This game will obviously be a hot button issue in the year to come and we're going to be one of the first people to speak to them about it. We can't wait for you guys to hear this interview.

So now might be a good time to secure those Digital Carbon Packs and ensure you get Producer's Cuts of these episodes as I'm sure there's going to be tons we can't fit in the regular episodes from this conversation.

Thanks for the support and let's keep on rolling!

UPDATE 2!

Mercedes Carrera

We can't express how happy and humbled we are with the success of the campaign so far, and we've already been working hard at producing a show that you guys will care about. So with that being said, we are very pleased to announce that adult film star Mercedes Carrera will be joining us for a future episode and will be discussing censorship and its role in art and videogames.

But that's not all. In addition to joining us for an episode of the show Mercedes has been kind enough to make an exclusive perk for the campaign possible. If you donate $50 you can select the new Mercedes Carrera Carbon Pack which gives you access to all the benefits of the Digital Carbon Pack, but in addition to that, you will also get a personalized set of thank you pictures and a thank you video from Mercedes herself!

Thank you to all our backers, supporters, and a special thanks to Mercedes!

UPDATE!

Happy Halloween guys and gals! We are so grateful to all of you that have donated to our campaign and we wanted to say thank you in a special way. So we decided to release a sneak peek of our new show for you! Here's an amazing conversation we had with Pulp Media Founder and former IGN Community Manager Sean Allen about the subtlety of censorship and its role in the gaming communities.
Enjoy!

Why We Need Bucks




Why We Need This Show

For the first series of episodes for Carbon Based Gaming we continue talking to personalities from all sides of #GamerGate and get their unique perspective on the controversy at hand. The aim of the show and these conversations in a general way is to achieve an angle of objective humanization and reality that is being lost in the echo chamber nature of Twitter and the Social Media ecosphere. We want these conversations to veer into refined taste territory and help young people to explore more complex concepts while picking apart the core of #GamerGate and other gaming issues. The episodes will quickly serve as an invaluable resource of intelligent conversations with developers, journalists, designers and more for gamers around the world.

The mainstream media seems to think that gamers aren’t capable of embracing larger social, political and ethical concepts and the success of this show would send a clear message : Gamers are smart. 


What Could Go Wrong

  • We could not get the cash and not be able to make a show, and that would be horrible.
  • We could get the cash and end up making a horrible show.
    (Just one, 5 out of 6 episodes will be great no matter what.)
  • We could get the cash and end up making a show so great that we become rich and famous and forget where we came from, and just kind of become jerks in a general way.

    How You Can Support Carbon Based Gaming Radio

    We understand not all of you can contribute to our campaign to create an amazing show but we'd like to give you some ways that you can help our campaign even if you don't have spare cash.

    • Social Media
      Tweet our campaign out there, Facebook it, Ello it, whatever you need to do, just share it!

    • Blog or Write About Us
      If you have a website, or you write for a site, blog, or another publication why don't you do a quick write-up of our campaign?

    • Youtube
      Are you a Youtuber? Why not tell folks on Youtube about our campaign?

    • Livestreams
      If you have a popular live stream, consider throwing us a shout out!

    Who Are We?

    Carbon Based Gaming Radio is brought to you by the same talented production team that gave you Radio Nero with Milo Yiannopoulos. We know the kind of quality you've come to expect in a gaming show and we won't let you down. Here's a rundown of the team members that are making this show possible.

    • Steve Tom Sawyer

      Steve is a former Metacritic listed videogame journalist and critic who has had over 200 articles run in sites and publications like GameGavel, Hardcore Gamer, RETRO Videogame Magazine, Liberty Gamer UK, and more. Steve also served as producer and co-host to Milo Yiannopoulos with Radio Nero.

      He currently owns RevueLabs.com and is the host and producer of Carbon Based Gaming Radio.

    • Robin Gething

      Robin grew up in the 8-bit age and has seen games go from a niche hobby to a multi-billion dollar behemoth. In the earlier days of the the "mod" scene with Quake, he contributed with maps, models, sound effects and music. His interests have moved into photography, film and animation over the past decade.   His role in the project is to bring a calm voice of reason to an otherwise vitriolic shoutfest.

      Robin is the co-host and associate producer of Carbon Based Gaming Radio.

story:
What is Gaming Grounds?

Gaming Grounds is a tabletop gaming store located in Kent, Ohio. It is a small business that is run by two independent owners with the sole goal to establish and maintain a fun gaming community!

And we mean it when we say Gaming Grounds is all about the community. Anyone who walks in the door finds him or herself immediately welcomed into our little family, whether they’ve been playing these games their whole life or they’re brand new.

But don’t take our word for it; on our facebook page, well over two dozen people have recommended our store, using words like “inviting” and “friendly” to describe us. But even we know that we can always strive to create more improvements to our store in order to increase the feelings of welcome and comfort.

That’s why we’re running this campaign. We want to use the money you, OUR COMMUNITY, helps us raise, to address the needs of the players. This summer has been a hot one, especially this past week with temperatures well over 90 degrees!  Our players have spoken, and we have listened, and so we have created this campaign to fund the replacement of building wide air conditioning.  

But we need your help!  Read on to see how you can help and some of the things you can get in return for your assistance.

What We Need

We are looking to raise approximately $3,000 for a new air conditioning unit (our old one was damaged by ice and after an inspection we were informed we need an entirely new unit!).

Even if we don't make this goal, all money raised will go toward the investment of a new AC unit!

If we were to raise additional money on top of our goal, here are some more things we would like to do to create a positive and comfortable gaming location:

  • Update lighting in our back gaming room (the Annex)
  • Re-paint the walls to create a bright gaming area
  • Complete the RPG table to provide comfort to our roleplaying patrons
  • Replace the front windows to add additional comfort during hot days
  • Provide lockers in our spare hallway so that our players can store their items during events

What You Get

Should you choose to help us out, you will be generously rewarded depending on the amount you are able to donate!  You can always look to the right for the donation perks, but know that any amount you are able to donate will be greatly appreciated!  Everyone who donates, be it 1 dollar or 1,000 dollars, will be recognized in our special indiegogo at the end of this campaign.

Plus, you all get Air Conditioning!

The Impact

Any contribution you make will help make a difference, not only to provide a more comfortable environment, but to kick-start the development of our gaming community! Air conditioning is only the start, but it is a big project and one that many people are excited to complete.  

Gaming Grounds has always been about developing the community (as seen in our previous indiegogo) and we wont stop here.  This just helps us shift the focus and keep pushing toward our ultimate goal, the development of a successful gaming community in the Kent area that encourages all types of gamers!  With your help, we can make this dream a reality!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to help us out financially, you can help us boost our signal!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Share on Facebook, Twitter, Google+! Send emails and texts, make phone calls, and send letters! Whatever you can do to help us get the word out we appreciate sincerely.

We are counting on you. THANK YOU, from the bottom of our hearts from all of us at Gaming Grounds.

Gaming Grounds has always been about developing the community (as seen in our previous indiegogo) and we wont stop here.  This just helps us shift the focus and keep pushing toward our ultimate goal, the development of a successful gaming community in the Kent area that encourages all types of gamers!  With your help, we can make this dream a reality!
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you are unable to help us out financially, you can help us boost our signal!

Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
Use the Indiegogo share tools! Share on Facebook, Twitter, Google+! Send emails and texts, make phone calls, and send letters! Whatever you can do to help us get the word out we appreciate sincerely.

We are counting on you. THANK YOU, from the bottom of our hearts from all of us at Gaming Grounds.

story:
Have you ever wished there was a MMORPG out there that would listen to you, that might implement some of your thoughts. Become a part of Venturia Online today and not only will we listen to you as donator, but all donators will automatically be selected for Closed Beta.  In addition you will automatically receive regular updates on the game development process during its development.  As we progress ideas, concepts and implemented features will be shared with our backers, keeping you up to date as it all happens. 

This also means that fresh ideas from backers might be implemented into the game as we go along, as our mission is to build a game you all would love to play.  For us to build the best MMORPG to date, we need to listen to our audience, you the gamer.  Together we can achieve it and in the process you can literally become part of Venturia Online, not just a backer waiting for the game to be released.

Our vision is straightforward - To create a long term value for our players.  Playing a game is not only an investment of money but it is also an investment of time.  Relationships are built over time and a strong community is essential.  To achieve this we need to create a game unlike those seen before.  Venturia Online needs to offer a unique, in-depth fun experience for the players and to achieve that we must meet player expectations in a responsible, cost-effective way.

We aim Venturia Online to be the best MMORPG available on the market.  To achieve that we recognize the need to truly listen to our players.  Our vision is long term and once the initial game is released we will continue to add new and fresh content.  We feel it is essential that future expansions should not just be a content update but a breath of fresh air with something totally different.  An example being: A major expansion is already planned for the future where players will be able to leave earth and travel the cosmos, build space stations, facilities and expand into the universe.

Note: Venturia Online is not limited to these features.  There are more features that will feature within the game.

Dynamic weather and ocean.  Battles will take place away from the city on battlefields and whilst in the city players can perform more relaxing activities.  We also realized that some activities can be boring unless we can provide a beautiful immersive environment.  Thus the decision that the sky will feature a dynamic weather system where each day will be different from the next.  The sun will rise and set,   The ocean will be alive with beautiful waves which will slot in and be controlled via the weather engine.  This means activities like fishing are affected by the weather and ocean on a given day, which adds to depth in game-play.


We felt that in an online world like Venturia Online players should be able to experience player housing where they can own their own apartment.  Players will also be able to decorate their own apartments as well as manufacture furniture etc in-game, which in turn can be placed within apartments.  Thus the look and feel of each apartment will depend on each player and their preferences.

Each area of game-play should have some purpose behind it and in their own apartments players will thus be able to use it to perform certain activities like cooking.  The food produced will in turn be used, by the virtual characters, to temporary boost their stats and can be even used for NPC's that a player might have hired in their factories, labs etc.  Players will be able to experiment with different ingredients to produce different types of dishes, which in turn will produce different stats.  If a new recipe are discovered it will be up to the player if he/she wants to keep the recipe a secret or not.  Thus it can be a good way or generating income once a player are a good cook in-game.


Players will be able to mine for raw ore and refine it into minerals.  Being 50 years into the future players will make use of mining robots to perform their mining tasks for them.  Mining robots in itself will vary hugely depending on the way the robot was built and configured by a manufacturer.  This will affect for instance a robots physical mining ability, carrying capacity, AI units for mining etc.  Players will be able to research into better mining technologies to build better mining robots over time. 


Ore will be refined it into minerals.  These minerals will be needed by players to manufacture items.  The refining yields depends not only on the refining skills of players but also by facilities used.  Players will be able to research into better technologies and build better refining facilities over time.  This includes better refining techniques etc.  It might be that while one player might specialize in mining another might decide to specialize in refining.  Together they might form an excellent team.

Players will be able to manufacture almost all items in-game, from furniture right through to combat robots etc.  Each area of manufacturing will also have a research tree which has to be opened up over time by players doing research for better technologies.  The new technologies can then be applied into the blueprints of applicable components that will be manufactured resulting in better, improved items. 

We will cater for complete manufacturing chains.  This means that some players might specialize in the final product whilst others might specialize in manufacturing components needed by those manufacturing end products.  Players specializing in manufacturing can even make use of researchers to improve their manufacturing process over time.

People specializing into research will need research laboratories and hire teams of scientists to do their research for them.  The success of their research will hugely depend on the way they construct their scientist teams as well as the facilities within their research labs.  Research can be costly but the rewards can be massive if a research team has achieved a breakthrough. 

Almost every area in Venturia Online has a full research path that is never ending.  What we mean with never ending is that we, the developers, will add new content to be researched as technologies gets unlocked.  Also sub areas are available for researchers.  For example:  A combat robot makes use of Vanadium Steel Armor...however the weight needs to be reduced and a player can task his scientists to research lighter Vanadium Steel armor.  It might even happen that while they do their research that they have an unexpected breakthrough in another area related to what they are researching.

Quarantine facilities will also form part of Venturia Online.  After all we are dealing with alien technology at times as some of the loot from battlefields might contain alien artifacts.  These needs to be placed under quarantine and after a while if it is safe to remove those items it can be handed to scientists to reverse engineer, which might result in possible new technologies etc.  If an item is classified as hazardous it wont be able to be removed from quarantine and must either be destroyed OR task scientists to try and find a way to neutralize the hazardous effects it might have.

Players will be able to own farms and perform various farming activities.  Due to the dynamic weather system we decided to take farming to another level in gaming.  A full weather forecast system will be available which players can monitor and base their decisions on.  Crops will literally grow over time, although accelerated for gaming purposes.  We are currently considering using 7 different models for each type of grain etc, representing the different stages of growth.  Some examples of items players will be able to farm with are: Grain, fruit, vegetables, cotton, sheep, cows, chickens and even wood.

On the fishing side, different types of fish will appear at different locations and on different weather conditions taking fishing to a new level as well within gaming.  It might be useful for people planning to go fishing to keep track of the weather forecast as well.  Fish will be a cheap way of producing food for NPC's and players.  It might also be used in recipes to produce food dishes of higher potencies. 

Battlefields are away from the city and robots can be teleported onto these battlefields.  A complete battle interface will be available for these battles in which players can control their robots in battle.  In group battles a separate (optional) Commander Interface will also be available for the player in charge of the battle to plan a solid battle strategy and assist him/her in commanding other players in battle.  Items can be looted in battle and also used for resources, research and/or reverse engineering.

Battlefields will be broken up into sectors and players will be able to build supporting infrastructure buildings on the starting sector.  Once new sectors has been conquered players can then safeguard those sectors by building additional defensive structures for example turrets.  These captured areas should be defended as valuable resources will be available on captured sectors for harvesting etc.  Players will also be able to control their infrastructure via a Combat Control Centre located in Venturia.  Each Battle Control Station is a live camera view onto the battlefield.

Smaller battlefields will be available for single players that like to solo.  On the other end there will be huge battlefields to conquer that is ideal for large teams.  Once a battlefield is conquered the players can then start reinforcing it with additional defensive structures like sentry guns etc.  While a guild has control of a battlefield it will be possible to harvest resources from the battlefield and they will even be able to build mines etc.  However the more valuable the battlefield the more difficult it would be to keep it, as there will be alien attacks over time, trying to recapture the battlefield.



Venturia is a self sustaining city and get for example most of its power from the core of the earth.  Part of Venturia is located underneath the Ocean bed underground.  Some of the most important facilities will be located underground.  These underground facilities will require various levels of security clearances to visit and players can over time improve their standings, as well as security clearance within Venturia Online.

The part of Venturia above the ground is an ocean city built on massive platforms.  In the centre of the city is the main building with a massive shield generator that generates a spherical shield over the entire city if an attack would occur.  This will be from time to time and an alarm will sound in the city before an attack, after which the city shields will be raised etc.  The visuals of that will be absolutely spectacular and players will even be able to see the effects of alien weaponry against the shield as they try to penetrate into Venturia.


Players can buy and sell items and/or services through a player market facility.  Players will also be able to contract other players for specific jobs, goods, service etc.  When this happens all payments will be held in escrow and once the contract is fulfilled payment will be released to the contracted player via the automated contracting system.  A NPC Market system will also be available and NPC's will also submit contracts onto the market for other players to full-fill.

Development of Venturia Online is a lengthy and costly process and although part of the team is working full time on it, we would love to get everyone working full time on Venturia Online.  We are expecting to launch Venturia Online in 2015, with the first Alpha as early as 2014.  The funding are basically to keep the team full time on the project as well as to acquire services where needed from other individuals.  One such example is for a sound specialist assisting us with creating in-game sounds etc.  Part of the funding will also go towards 3rd party software and development tools.

If we don't reach our entire goal Venturia Online will still be completed and released, although it might be at a slighter later date than intended.  On the other hand, if we do surpass our goal, the additional income will still go towards the development of Venturia Online.  This will be in the form of additional content, online servers etc.  An example of such content might be additional Battlefields at launch (which are originally scheduled for after release) etc.

With your help Venturia Online might be able to be completed sooner than intended, with richer in-game content.  We will also be able to launch it properly providing a better gaming experience for all involved.  We are also in the process of creating a website for Venturia Online.  Once it is up and running all contributors will be able to join the development forums for feedback as well as telling us their ideas of what they would love to see within Venturia Online.  After all...Venturia Online is developed for gamers and to be a success its essential that we should listen to the gamers.

We would appreciate it if you could get the word out and make as much noise as possible about our campaign.  We need people to use Twitter, Facebook and whatever means they have to spread the word.  Thus even if you can't  contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help.  We truly appreciate every effort to help us out.

To share this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, Websites or where possible use the link/embed at the top of the page underneath the video.

Thanks for taking the time to read through all this and we hope that you are as excited as we are.

story:
Who We Are

The First Tee of Greater Knoxville is a nonprofit organization that specializes in introducing and teaching the game of golf to underprivileged children and teens in the Greater Knoxville area.  Starting at the age of seven, participants are able to come to one of seven golf courses in the area, learn the basics of the game early on, and improve their game with instruction from coaches.  However, the participants are not just taught more about the game of golf.  Participants in The First Tee program are also taught valuable lessons that include maintaining a positive attitude, learning effective problem solving, how to set and achieve goals, and how to translate these skills to their everyday lives.  

What We Need

The goal of this campaign is to raise at least $1,000 so that we can reach out to more children and teens, and give them the same opportunity that has been given to so many already.  In the next three years, The First Tee is planning on expanding into nine new counties, to better reach out to thousands of “at risk” young people in the area.  By the end of 2013, The First Tee hopes to be able to positively influence the behavior of young people by mentoring, coaching, volunteering, and financially investing in the lives of over 12,000 children and teens.  However, we do need help from everyone.  With your help, operating costs are more easily met, more children and teens are able to be sponsored, and it will become less difficult to expand our territory.  If you do contribute to The First Tee, you can receive anything from a personalized thank you on Twitter to a full adult membership to the Wee Course at Williams Creek.

How It Helps

Recently, an independent, four-year study led by The University of Minnesota’s Maureen R. Weiss, Ph.D. confirmed The First Tee’s ability to positively impact the participants’ lives by teaching life skills and The First Tee Nine Core ValuesTM to those participating in the Life Skills Experience.  During this research, The First Tee retained 73% of participants from year one to year four.  This is an outstanding percentage when compared to an approximately 50% dropout rate per year in other youth programs.  Of those who are no longer with The First Tee, 57%  are still actively involved in the game of golf and 55% are actively involved in another sport.  At the end of the study, over 70% of parents and guardians of the participants reported dramatically improved communication skills, confidence, and responsibility.  Over 60% of parents reported improved social skills and more than 50% reported improved grades.  As you can see, The First Tee improves the lives of youth both on and off the course.  

In order to continue to reach out to children and teens in the Knoxville area, and to expand to other areas, we need your help.  Monetary contributions to this campaign will help The First Tee purchase new equipment for participants to use, including new golf balls, clubs, and practice supplies.  

Other Ways To Help

Contributing financially is not the only way to make a difference.  You can still help by spreading the word about this campaign to your family and friends by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, and even here on Indiegogo.  You can also volunteer by being a coach or a mentor at any one of our locations in the Greater Knoxville area.  Any help at all will encourage “at risk” teens become responsible members of society, and will be greatly appreciated.

story:
Game 1 “Santa Vs Banker”

“Santa Vs Banker” is a hilarious side scrolling platform pursuit game, which is a follow up to upcoming “Joe Vs Banker”

Help Santa keep ahead of the nasty banker, bailiff and dog as they set out to repossess Santa's sleigh, reindeers and presents and ruin Christmas for all excited children on Christmas eve.

Keep running over beautifully designed rooftops and put Santa’s presents down the chimneys whilst avoiding all the obstacles and enemies.

This product will be available as a PC version but our next campaign will be to put this out on Android and then iOS.

ETA Nov 2012

ETA Nov 2012

story:
Short Summary

We are passionate about our brain and its capabilities. Thirty years have gone by in which we have been been participating in meetings with brain specialists like BlueBrain and studying the brain thanks to scientific and experimental methods such as astral projection, alpha and theta biofeedback machine, high speed proprietary EEG, Stanford Research Institute trainings, etc…

Now what we want to do now is to carry out further research in this field through a unique process: a huge social experiment taking place in your smartphone, in the form of a video game.

What we propose to you, is the creation of an entertaining application. The goal in the game is to find the target as stated in Remote Viewing. Each target has specific attributes. The target will be displayed after the choice. The player will have to find which of two attributes best match the target. We will relax the player by playing binaural music. Follow our instructions carefully (such a breathing slowly, listening to our specific music and by making the void in the brain) and the good attribute should appear in the player's spirit, or the target itself could appear with our tips, or if you are gifted. The game will compare the birth date and time of play with the score and help us to understand the influence of the position of the planets - mostly Venus- on our brain's capabilities in remote viewing.

The aim is to measure and develop specific brain capabilities - such a precognition - which characterize "mentalists", as well as helping us to build the first database listing score of players corresponding to different profiles.

In a nutshell, it's not a IQ test  but a scientific "mentalist" test to help us study advanced brain capabilities and to help you develop yours own.


What We Need & What You Get

We need money to create the game and make it known. We have already written two books explaining why we think our brain is really a space and time machine, but we need to consolidate the data and the game is the best approach. With $20.000 we can produce a good game, integrate it into social networks and make it known through them.

It will be the first ever wide-ranging attempt to confirm the reality of clairvoyance and precognition. Be proud to participate in it. Be part of a major step in the understanding of life and consciousness.

By helping our campaign, you can get a copy of our novel “The Lost knowledge”

"A novel with a strong factual base and all the ingredients needed to keep the reader enthralled... secrets of ancient civilizations lost to the human race, except for the Freemasons, who jealously guard many of them. Powerful agencies with enormous technological resources that want to unravel the mysteries of encounters with advanced forms of intelligence. Espionage in the form of harassment of a young Chinese researcher and the main characters, two talented young people who live an incredible experience - between California, Space and the desert - and a blossoming romance. All of them are searching for The Lost Knowledge that could save the human race ..."

Also available in French!!!

You can also help us and receive, in addition to the novel, the addendum containing 250 pages of facts from history, archaeology, astronomy, biology,  optic, etc...
All these facts help us to understand why we think our brain has such specific capabilities.

If we don’t reach our funding goal, we will do our best to produce the game anyway, but we want to shortcut marketing campaign and integrate it into social media.

The Impact

Your contribution will be unique, funding the production of the game and making it known. You will participate in a major attempt to know us better and maybe change the way we see things in the future, and - who knows - make our world a better place.

We have been carrying out research in the field for 30 years, making hundreds of astral projection experiences, studying them scientifically, working with brain labs, using alpha and theta wave biofeedback devices and making prototypes of high speed EEG to reverse engineer our brain waves. We helped the Blue Brain project, the most ambitious neo-cortex simulation project ever attempted. We obtained help from former Stanford Research Institute members, making lots of Remote Viewing experiences. But this is not enough... we need YOU and the help of social media to demonstrate that our brain is really able to guess the future thanks to your gut feeling.

We will associate an anonymous statistical database to the game, enabling us to match performances with features of gamers, and to see if there are features that are related to best performers.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can certainly make people aware about our project - please use the Indiegogo share tools to make our campaign a success.
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are passionate about our brain and its capabilities. Thirty years have gone by in which we have been been participating in meetings with brain specialists like BlueBrain and studying the brain thanks to scientific and experimental methods such as astral projection, alpha and theta biofeedback machine, high speed proprietary
EEG, Stanford Research Institute trainings, etc…
Now what we want to do now is to carry out further research in this field through a unique process: a huge social experiment taking place in your smartphone, in the form of a video game.
What we propose to you, is the creation of an entertaining application. The goal in the game is to find the target as stated in Remote Viewing. Each target has specific attributes. The target will be displayed after the choice. The player will have to find which of two attributes best match the target. We will relax the player by playing binaural music. Follow our instructions carefully (such a breathing slowly, listening to our specific music and by making the void in the brain) and the good attribute should appear in the player's spirit, or the target itself could appear with our tips, or if you are gifted. The game will compare the birth date and time of play with the score and help us to understand the influence of the position of the planets - mostly Venus- on our brain's capabilities in remote viewing.
The aim is to measure and develop specific brain capabilities - such a precognition - which characterize "mentalists", as well as helping us to build the first database listing score of players corresponding to different profiles.
In a nutshell, it's not a IQ test  but a scientific "mentalist" test to help us study advanced brain capabilities and to help you develop yours own.

What We Need & What You
Get
We need money to create the game and make it known. We have already written two
books explaining why we think our brain is really a space and time machine, but
we need to consolidate the data and the game is the best approach. With $20.000
we can produce a good game, integrate it into social networks and make it known
through them.
It will be the first ever wide-ranging attempt to confirm the reality of clairvoyance
and precognition. Be proud to participate in it. Be part of a major step in the understanding of life and consciousness.

story:
Summary

My name is Cy Bowers. I have always been fascinated by geography, politics, spy movies, conspiracy theories, and international travel. I also love intense strategy games like Risk, Monopoly, Ticket to Ride, and Settlers of Cataan. Thus, in that nerdy primordial soup of my brain, Intel was born.

In the fall of 2012, I began to put my ideas on paper. I saved my pennies and had a prototype game board and cards printed and made my own game tokens. Over the past year, I have been working with Ad Magic, a game-producing company, to get an estimate on the cost of professionally producing this game. I have also played the game with friends and relatives to try and get the bugs out, as well as experiment with various playing options.

This is where you come in...

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise $11,500 to produce 250 games. If the goal is not reached, we hope to still be able to produce on a smaller scale. If we get a REALLY good response, this may be the beginning of an international phenomenon! (And who wouldn't want to be a part of that?!) If the goal is reached, everyone who donates will get some variation of the game or other awesome perk!

The Impact

Intel is a smart and exciting game that is fun for all ages 10 and up. Beyond its entertainment value, it also is a great way for younger players to become more familiar with world geography. With the success of this game, I hope to expand to make more variations on the game, such as Intel Europe, North America, Asia, etc.

    Risks & Challenges

    Obviously, the big challenge is getting enough people interested to donate. If we can get 250 people interested in buying one $50 game (which includes shipping, and is similar to the price of Settlers of Cataan or a similar strategy game) we will have just enough money to produce the game. This will mean an aggressive, grass roots campaign through word of mouth and social media.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I realize that some people may not be interested in ever playing a highly-entertaining and intellectually stimulating game of international espionage. Or perhaps they just can't afford to donate right now. These individuals may still like to help in some small way because they are just that kind-hearted. If you happen to be in this category, please consider "liking" us on Facebook, sharing a link to this site, telling all your friends about it, or use one of Indiegogo's share tools.

      Thanks for reading! I hope I was convincing enough. :^)

story:
THE DOOMBOT WEBSITE PORTAL

Attempting to create a new merchandise model for video games that puts the gamer in the creative driving seat!

WHAT IS IT?

The Doombot is an attempt to create an experimental merchandise marketplace and innovative new business model using crowd-funding and crowd-sourcing strategies and is being built by Robots to help gamers, developers and creatives alike to make and sell fantastic merchandise to other Robots (and humans). These Robots have been busy building a giant death Bot for years but sadly have run out of money. Since crowd-funding for a giant, genocidal Robot is highly unethical they've instead decided to help the video game industry by creating a web portal where gamers, creatives and developers can meet and create unique and interesting merchandise to be enjoyed by all!

HOW DOES IT WORK?

Simply put - A gamer suggests an idea for a product related to his favourite game. This could be anything that we have on our books (currently 3D printed figures, laser engraved glass, t-shirts, concept art in canvass and acrylic and 3D flip lenticulars and we aim to add much much more).  A creative expert then makes a design working with the gamer to get a precise design and feel for the product then submits it through a vetting process with us and the developers. Once approved then the Gamer gets EXACTLY what he asked for and not something that's been chosen and designed for him and then mass-produced in sweat shop conditions in the Far East.

A more in depth explanation requires talking about the benefits for the different tiers and we have different tiers for gamers, creatives and developers.

Gamers have a tough time when it comes to buying merchandise for their games. Finding the right present or next cool collectible can involve going to many different sites, many badly run or with a poor selection.  The Doombot's goal, besides total world domination, is to provide a one stop shop of the latest and coolest video game art and related products. Some of these may be rare or even unique pieces. We aim to make any related products available for any related games which means that gamers will have a huge choice of products to choose from. As well as this all members will have a unique ID which they can build on. So for instance if a member links a portrait of their face to their ID then we could use that to create, say a 3D printed figure from their favourite game with their face inserted onto it. Or add a full body picture and digitally insert yourself into your favourite game moments to create unique dioramas. The website will also get the latest news and gossip that we will be getting direct from developers themselves as well as have the opportunity for gamers to be involved in the creation of cool merchandise. They can comment on any and all merchandise and provide useful feedback for the creatives and developers.  We will also be holding frequent competitions, both creative and fun and sometimes even silly, to make sure that all members of our community are involved with the games and developers we will be working with. Since gaming is a Robots favourite past time they aim to make it as fun as possible for all gamers involved.
Finally, and most importantly, gamers will be able to suggest the types of merchandise that would appeal most to them. If enough people are interested in a design suggestion and a creative makes something super cool that the developers approve of then you'll be able to buy it and have the warm glow of being part of a collective process that you've been able to influence and grow from a design idea to the final completed product in your hand, on your desk or hanging on your wall. The key thing here is that we want to build not just a business but an all inclusive gaming community with forums that anybody can join and be part of as well as a website with the framework to take your amazing ideas and turn them into the merchandise that you, the gamers, want.

Creatives will be given free reign to design any game merchandise they like with whatever materials they like for any developers who are linked to our site. Any creative work they do can then be showcased and submitted for approval to both the public and relevant developers. If approved then it will be added to the merchandise gallery and anyone anywhere can buy it! This allows artists to create work that gets recognition not only from your peers but also from developers themselves. As well as this developers can post their own requests for any creative work directly so we hope it could prove to be a useful job lot too! One of the better perks of joining us as an accredited artist is that you will have a platform on which to showcase your work to all of our users and developers as the business grows and have the potential to gain notice in the industry, be recognised by your peers and turn a profit too!

Developers have a tough time these days as making awesome video games is a lengthy and frustrating process. So the Doombot robots would like to make it easy for them to sell cool products based on their games with as much input as they want to put into it. Firstly any developers will be allowed to sell merchandise through our site as well as use it as a message board for their fans. They will also be put in touch with creatives such as artists, animators and any other interested parties who can help them create cool and targeted merchandise. They will be allowed to set any guidelines for those creatives to work to and then vet any work that those creatives make. This gives developers the best of both worlds in that they can utilize the Internets undiscovered talent to make great merchandise, have a firm but easy-going control over what is made and sold and what isn't and best of all they save time so that they can focus more fully on making their own games as fantastic as possible. We feel that this would be an especially good boon for small indie developers who may not have the resources or technical know-how to set-up their own merchandising programs. As well as this they will have an extensive range of promotional materials to market by as well as the expertise of creatives skilled in whatever particular medium they need. Finally as an added bonus since we work on a unit-by-unit basis it won't cost them a penny (with options to scale up production if required).

HOW WILL YOU USE MY DONATION?

Your donation will be spent solely for the use of creating a website portal for video game related merchandise and promoting its use. We aim to create a modern and intuitive website that anyone can use and enjoy with a friendly community spirit and promote it any way that insane robots can think of to further its influence. The Doombot robots guarantee that they will NOT use the donation money to further their plans for human annihilation but spend it only on the website and its promotion. Creation of the website means all matters involved in getting it to work including legal counsel, servers and any additional technology that may be needed. Planned promotional events include such things as expos, parties, video game store meets, gallery viewings and more! We look to create interesting events that people feel enthused about and work with the best people possible to make them happen.


ARE HUMANS ALLOWED TO USE THIS SITE?

Robots aren't too fond of humans due to their smell and the fact that they are used as Human slave labour. However one of the wonders of the internet is that we can do all of the above from the comfort of our own computers. That way the robots wont have to be directly involved with humans at all. Besides video games is one of the only things where Robots and Humans see eye to optical input so they've put aside their irrational hatred of mankind to help make a place where everyone can buy unique merchandise.

WHAT DO I GET IF I PLEDGE?

Besides a variety of gifts that you can see below, all pledgers great or small will be put on a unique list - the Founding Member List - which will give you a range of future benefits. I will be sending everyone a personal email of thanks (and I really hope I don't get a million+ pledgers). You will always get early access to new tech as and when we add it. You will also get perks such as free face-scanning and digital insertion and say, if we have a full body scanning kit at future conventions then we'll do that for you for free. As the business expands then we'll be adding more stuff such as private forums and game servers. Basically you'll be on the ground level for anything exciting that we do.

CAN WE SEE SOME PICS OF THE PLEDGE GIFTS?

Of course!

A wall poster and a large lenticular wall art piece signed by the artist!

A mousemat, 2 different styles of lenticular postcard and some cups!

A 6x4x4, 8x5x5 and a the big 18x15x8 inch crystal looming off screen on the right. The little key-chain on top of the middle block can light up red,blue or white.

A 3D printed figurine of the Doombot!

story:
About Firewall


Tired of always playing by the rules? Now you can make your own! 


Firewall is a two-player tactical board game where you get to decide the rules.


In Firewall, you command an evil army of cyber units on a battlefield where the rules of war change according to players' whims.


How it works


The aim of the game is for players to win points by taking their opponent's units. 




But in Firewall, as in all cyber warfare, there are no hard and fast rules. Players get cards that help them shift the balance of power, like by making  threatened units poisonous, so your opponent loses a point if she takes it, or by switching the direction a type of unit can move.


Combine luck with tactics in a game where no match is ever the same.


What is the money for


We believe we made a great game and we'd love to take it to the next level in terms of play and experience.  For that we need your help!


Our wish list of things we'd love to add to the game includes:


A smart artificial intelligence that players can use to practice or for a quick match.

A better scoreboard system like in professional Chess, and match making according to your rank.

A cool soundtrack  to add atmosphere.

Enhanced gameplay strategies with new rule-changing cards.

An HD version for iPad.


and your money is what we need to accomplish these goals!


What's next


We have grand plans for more board, puzzle, and multiplayer games...


 But first we want to make Firewall the best it can be - so please help us transform our dream into a reality!


Who we are 


We're a small independent team of programmers and software designers, with day jobs in serious fields like business process management.


We're also passionate computer and board game geeks, and believe the new mobile platforms are perfect for combining and innovating in these two gaming worlds.  


Our dream is to create those games, and we have some darn good ideas! 


How else you can help


Do you have friends who:

    like iPhones?

    like board games?

    like cyber-warfare?

    hate mosquitos?


Share this site ( http://indiegogo.com/Firewall ) with them using the sharing tools so they can join you in creating Firewall. For just a few bucks, they can get cool wallpapers, and help improve the game for themselves, for you and for everyone else!


Thank you!

story:
My son, Wyatt Rathgaber, is seven years old. Like many his age, he enjoys playing games, both video and board, and has taken quite a shining to a particular subset of games that involve Tanks. Now, taking control of a behemoth of the battlefield, slinging explosive shells at your opponents in an attempt at demolition can give one quite a thrill. That being said children get in trouble, and Wyatt did just that. That was when Wyatt's Tankmania! was born.

I arrived home one evening to hear my son mid sentence explaining to me how he had made a game, drew up the playing board and made game pieces all on his own. He would no longer be denied the excitement of tank battles simply because he was grounded from Daddy's computer, and we would have to sit down to play. We did, and I was surprised how much thought he put into the rules. Different classes, different ways to damage your opponent, and different consequences to that damage, all put together to make a very fun, simple board game to simulate his favorite pasttime without being stuck behind a computer.

We played for hours, my husband and I playing his game with him and slowly helping him flesh it out. When we were done, he ended up with a game with a simple set of rules, easy to pick up and fun to play with friends.

He then asked us if he could sell his game to the stores. He wants to be a brain surgeon, and believes he could sell this game to help with his college fund. We believe the first thing you have to do is file for a patent on the idea. The cost of a patent application is $200, and we told him he would have to make this himself ( but we would help him write up the application). The additional funding would be used to commission original artwork and put together the first kits. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

story:
We made it!

Da Clash is now officially funded thanks to all of you, thank you very much to have made it possible!

Woah, we are still so excited, we really overpassed our hopes and yes, this dream project becomes true!

We will post updates as often as possible, with information and "works in progress" of the sculptures.

Then, next week we will set up a page that will allow people who have alredy pledged to add extras at the "campaign price" (Diablito, unlocked stretchgoals and T shirts).

Cheers!

The happy Ammon Team

 

 

 

 

 

“Faster than a tequila shot, make your foe bite the dust in Da Clash! The weird wrestling boardgame for 2 players from 12 to the grave!”

 

Da Project!

Da Clash! is a boardgame with miniatures for 2 players created and developed by Ammon Miniatures. Fun, fast and addictive, a game lasts for about 20 minutes.

Unique in its kind and innovative, it is a perfect crossover between a miniatures game and a board game. Da Clash! is intended for both pure gamers and miniatures lovers.

Inspired by the Mexican Lucha Libre, Z movies and weird comics, Da Clash! will make you experience the brawl of your life!

Beta-tested since 2011, the game met a big success in the gaming clubs and that’s why we are sure you will love it too!

 

AMMON MINIATURES

For years now, Ammon Miniatures is known for the originality and cartoony style of the miniatures, the attention to detail and high quality castings in resin.

We can count on years of experience in the miniatures industry and on skillful collaborators with technical and artistic expertise (Valentin Zak, Allan Carrasco…).

You can find more info on our products on our website: www.ammon-miniatures.com or our Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Ammon-Miniatures/110440962309406

 

 

DA GAME !

 

 
 
 
The box contains everything you need to play. The others miniatures will allow you to play with new profiles and test new crazy combinations (all the existing Ammon miniatures already have a Da Clash! profile ready to be played) and miniatures lovers will just prefer to play with miniatures instead of the cardboard silhouettes included in the box.

Each gamer plays with 2 fighters, on a wrestling ring divided in 9 zones.

Da Clash! is fast and fun, but you’ll need reflection and tactics if you want to make your opponents bite the dust.

Stretch, warm up, roll the dices…and no, unlike the others games, a 1 or a 2 are not weaker than a 5 or a 6.

Every dice is precious and can be used in different ways:

-you can activate your fighters and determine their initiative,

-launch Special or Bonus Attacks,

-create combinations to earn Zen or Rage tokens…well, if you win the bet.

-or fill your Superpowa gauge a bit more…

 

On the other hand, the two sources of power of a fighter: the Zen and the Rage tokens can be stocked and will allow you to make your fighters faster, more resistant or aggressive…And if you have enough of them, you’ll even be able to launch your fighter’s Superpowa to inflict him a 3-Hits Combo!

But stay watchful even if you have almost reduced his Tonus Points to zero, you could be punched in the back... everything's allowed in Da Clash!

 

 

Why Indiegogo?

At the moment, the rules, the miniatures, illustrations and graphic elements are already made. This crowdfunding campaign will allow us to start the production of the Da Clash! game boxes.

Planned shipping date: October 2013

 

We need your support!

 

If you love to brawl, have a good laugh with friends and if you have the eye of the tiger, Da Clash! has been made for you!

By supporting us, you will benefit of goodies, exclusive miniatures and (very) preferential prices.

Oh, and do not forget to spread the word!

You wanna be da Challenger?

 

Please note that:

-All the Ammon miniatures already have a Da Clash! profile ready to be played

-Designs are not definitive

-all the miniatures are cast in high quality polyurethane resin

-miniatures are sold unpainted if not specified and may require assembly

-the wrestling ring in resin is sold unpainted and will require some assembly

-the logo on the wrestling ring in resin is sculpted in low relief 

 

 The game is in both French and English.

 

OPTIONAL EXTRA:

 

PLEDGE LEVELS:

you can support Da Clash! through these different pledge levels.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

STRETCHGOALS

 

If we reach our initial goal, we will unlock stretchgoals, which means more goodies and exclusive miniatures for you!

 

Please note that the Exclusive items will be sold only through this Indiegogo Campaign and then only on conventions and gaming events for a higher price.
