Realismo, controles, sons, ambientação, todos os elementos de game design estão lá para você finalmente saber como você se sentiria em uma experiência de estar cercado por mortos vivos e lutar pela sua sobrevivência.
Gráficos ultra-realistas em hardware mobile. 
 
Nós Amamos Imersão de Verdade.
Nós amamos a imersão oferecida por controles de movimento, desde as pistolas laser dos árcades até tablets, Wii e Kinect. Nesse sentido, You Are Surrounded permite você progredir ativamente em uma habilidade relevante de tiro como um esporte físico. A sensação de realidade virtual é como um óculos head-tracking futurista, porém imediatamente acessível.
 
Wii, Kinect and smartphones are the prelude to the Matrix
 
Nós Amamos Zumbis
E nós amamos zumbis, como tantas outras pessoas. O mundo e as situações do game são fiéis ao clima de produções como The Walking Dead e os filmes do Romero. O gameplay provoca pânico como Resident Evil 4 e medo como Resident Evil 2.
Os zumbis surgem dos escombros e dos cantos escuros.
 
STRETCH GOALS!
$72.000 – Visão 360
Muitas arenas / estágios: cidades, escola, cemitério, shopping center, supermercado, igreja… Diferentes modo de interagir com o cenário e derrotar os vários tipos de zumbis mutantes: rastejantes, corredores, saltadores, que escalam as paredes e o teto…. Ranking global e entre amigos do Facebook. Entre um level (área) e outro cut-scenes contam a história (como em Infinity Blade). O dinheiro e recursos que você saqueia em cada área são usados para comprar novas armas, fazer upgrades nos equipamentos (coletes, rifles, granadas, espadas, lança-míssel...) como o mercador em Resident Evil 4.
 
Essas criaturas (a venda no TurboSquid), e muitas outras vão entrar no game, se financiado. 
 
$90.000 - Camera Face Tracking
Movendo a cabeça, você poderá desviar e se desviar dos golpes dos zumbis. Ou se agachar atrás de um muro,  e esperar o momento certo para se levantar e atirar. Graças a um sistema capaz de reconhecer a posição da sua face e mudar o ponto de visão no jogo.

 
$125.000 - Multiplyer Local (via Bluetooth)
Você poderá reunir os amigos em jogar um multiplayer cooperativo conectados no mesmo local, um protegendo a retaguarda do outro, enquanto competem por recursos e pontos.
 Você poderá comprar armas e evolui-las como em RE 4
 
$210.000 -Caminhada Real 
Você poderá andar em pequenas arenas se movendo fisicamente no mundo real. Desvie-se dos zumbis rapidamente e encontre a melhor posição para atirar. Sua aceleração linear será detectada pelo fluxo óptico da câmera. Uma completa experiência de imersão  em um mundo pós-apocalíptico virtual
 
 
 
340.000 – Levels Lineares de FPS 
Fases semi-lineares de FPS exploradas por um direcional virtual ou pelo movimento real do jogador em um campo aberto!
 
$410.000 - Adventure Mode
Exploração não-linear de horror. Vasculhe pequenas salas, colete itens, resolva puzzles e mate zumbis, do jeito clássico ou caminhando realmente pelo ambiente assustador.
 
Camiseta Exclusiva You Are Surrounded
 
$630.000 Modo História / Decisão 
Mate os zumbis que perseguem um sobrevivente ou mate o sobrevivente fugitivo para distrair os zumbis, você ecolhe. Faça alianças ou inimigos, mas escolha com cuidado em quem confiar. Várias bifurcações na história como The Walking Dead da Telltale, usando o controle de movimento nas cenas virtuais interativas.
 

 
$789.000 – AR Mode – Realidade Aumentada. 
Transforme sua própria casa em um campo de batalha zumbi!
 

 
$1.200.000 - Multiplayer Online
Mata-mata online entre times em mapas de FPS infestados de zumbis. Se você estiver em um campo aberto, poderá  andar, mirar e atirar como se estivesse realmente dentro do jogo!
 
A criatura deseja a sua vida mais do que você mesmo
 
 
 
Notícias


Brasileiro cria shooter de zumbis com gráficos de ponta para tablets - Tech Tudo

Neste game brasileiro de realidade virtual, você vai ficar cercado por zumbis --Superinteressante

You Are Surrounded: game nacional tem zumbis e realidade virtual - Tec Mundo

You’re Surrounded! O game realista de apocalipse Zumbi! - Gamestroming

Neste game brasileiro de realidade virtual, você vai ficar cercado por zumbis - GameVicio

Brasileiro cria jogo de zumbi bastante realista - Universo Zumbi
 
 
Junte-se a nós nesse movimento para ascender os games para um novo paradigma!
 

 
 OBS.: Atendendo a pedidos, para quem prefere não usar cartão de crédito, adicionamos um botão próprio de doação do Paypal que aceita a moeda brasileira. As recompensas são as mesmas!

story:
Thank you all!

The campaign is over, and we have sent out the first two decks (Jean le Maingre and Galeazzo da Mantoa), the Indiegogo special card, the Limited Edition card, the Lady deck, and the Armour Expansion. The Patron deck and Liechtenauer Expansion pack are ready as Print and Play decks, and have been sent to the printers: we expect the proofs to arrive in January 2016, and if all goes well, they should ship that month.

WE ARE DONE! Sorry it took so long!

If you missed the campaign, you can buy the print and play version of all the decks here, and the printed decks here.

We will post sporadic progress reports on here, and let all backers know when we hit certain goals. If you would like to upgrade your perk, or make a specific request, please contact us through our website: www.audatiagame.com 


And now for the original pitch, preserved here for posterity:


Swords are Cool

And knowing how they work is even cooler.

And blasting past 200% of our funding goal is coolest of all. Thank you!!

Newsflash: We have our Liechtenauer funding! 

Newsflash: Our Patron has spoken: his deck will be based on him personally, in the guise of a Teutonic Knight. This means of course that the Patron deck, probably named "Nicodemus Kariensis", will be a highly-trained Liechtenauer style swordsman. This will be compatible to fight with the other decks, with or without the Liechtenauer expansion pack. But if you want to beat him at his own style, you will need the Liechtenauer expansion!

About the Game

This game idea was born when Rami and Guy were discussing how hard it is for students to learn swordsmanship terminology and theory. So we thought about flash cards, and suddenly it came to us- a card game that is fun to play, and at the same time imparts real knowledge of our martial heritage.

So we talked to some game designers, raised some funds, and hired Games and Tales in Oulu, Finland, to come up with a prototype. The game is done, playable, ready.

Thanks to the generosity of our Patrons, we have raised thefunds to complete the artwork and print up the first run of cards. Not just the two original decks, but four character decks and the armour expansion. Now we are working towards expanding the game to include medieval German techniques. That's where you come in: please help us reach our new stretch goal of 50,000€!

The Team:

Samuli, the game designer. He makes it fun to play.

Guy, the swordsmanship instructor. He makes it as accurate as possible.

Jussi: the Artist. He makes it beautiful.

Rami, the director: he keeps the artists (Guy, Jussi and Samuli) in check, and makes sure we won't go bankrupt or get arrested.

Your money is safe with us: Guy has done two campaigns before: Swordschool Syllabus Video, which raised money to create a free online swordsmanship video archive, and Veni VADI Vici, which raised money for Guy to translate and publish a medieval Italian combat manual. You can buy the book here! So when we raise the funds, the game WILL be made.

Why Buy Now?

Why not wait until the game is in the shops? Firstly, we will include a limited edition card for all subscribers who buy at least one deck of cards. This card will be playable in the game, or can be collected, as you like. The total print run will be determined by the number of copies of the game we sell during the campaign. Collectors please note, we also have a much more limited-run card (100 copies total) with some of our perks at 100€ and over. 

Secondly, we may not release it through normal channels: it all depends on how many we end up selling here. The more sales we make now, the more likely it is that the appeal is broad enough to warrant normal distribution channels.

Please note that all perks at 10€ and above include the basic game pdf, so even if you can only afford a single printed deck, you can print out the other and play with your friends.

Update: We have decided to add a PDF copy of the second edition of Guy's book, The Swordsman's Companion, to all perk levels at 10€ and above. This will be retroactive, of course, so if you have already backed us, you will be getting this too. It will be bundled with the "full game in pdf" that is already included in all perks at 10€ and above.

The Game:

 

For an unsolicited and independent review of the game, see here

Background:

In August 1395, two of the finest knights in the world met in single combat.  A couple of months earlier, Jean le Maingre, known as Boucicault, had made disparaging remarks about the valour of Italian knights. Galeazzo da Mantoa heard him and demanded satisfaction. Finally, they met on the field of honour. Galeazzo was slow to mount his horse, so Boucicault got impatient, jumped off his, and ran at Galeazzo with a spear. Galeazzo beat his spear aside and smacked Boucicault upside the head.

Perhaps Galeazzo’s training with legendary Master of the Art of Arms, Fiore dei Liberi, had something to do with his success?

That master, Fiore dei Liberi, wrote a comprehensive manual of his techniques, which Guy has been studying since 1994. This sophisticated combat system is now sufficiently well understood that it has provided the mechanics for this game. 

The game was born when, after a swordsmanship class one evening in October 2012, Rami and Guy were talking about how hard it is for some swordsmanship students to remember the basic terminology and theory of the Art of Arms. Sure, it doesn’t help that it’s all in Italian. Medieval Italian. With funny spelling.

Rami suggested flashcards. Guy then thought of the enemy recognition cards used by the Armed Forces. In WWII it was German planes and ships; in Afghanistan these days it’s pictures of wanted terrorists. So while G.I.Joe is playing poker, he is constantly being reminded of what the enemy looks like. So why not make swordsmanship playing cards?

Then Rami said: why not a game?

And a student passing by chipped in: “I’d buy it”.

So Rami went to his business college and secured some funding, which we used to hire Samuli and Jussi; we started a company; and here we are: On the point of launching the first ever card game based entirely on authentic, historical swordsmanship.

This game is the most accurate possible representation of Fiore dei Liberi’s swordsmanship style.  Play the game and you will learn the terminology, tactics and techniques that Fiore describes in his monumental book, The Flower of Battle.

You can see video samples of gameplay in our Gallery.

What We Need & What You Get

We now have enough money to make the game, two extra decks, and our first expansion pack. Huzzah! We are now raising the funds to make a second expansion pack, which will add German medieval combat skills to the characters. We need money for the game designer (genius is not cheap), the artist (also a genius, and so not cheap) printing and packaging (which we could do on the cheap but will not: art of this quality deserves the best physical form we can get), and shipping. Please help!

Stretch Goals

We have made it to our first two stretch goals: a female deck, and the armour expansion pack, thanks to our kind and excellent patrons!

The Lady deck will probably be one of these amazing combatants:

- Joanna of Flanders, “Jeanne la Flamme”, who in the siege of Henneport in 1342 “took up arms and, dressed in armour, conducted the defence of the town”.
- Isabella, Duchess of Lorraine, who led an army to rescue her husband in 1436.
- Lady Agnes Randolph, “Black Agnes”, who defended her castle at Dunbar against a siege for 5 months.
- Agnes Hotot, of the House Dudley, who fought a duel in her father’s stead and (legend has it) following it stripped her breastplate to prove to the offender he’d been bested by a woman. This last is obviously impossible, as anyone who has ever worn armour knows!

Let us know which one you favour! We have a poll running here, where you can let us know what you think, or make your own suggestions.

The Armour expansion pack:

The armour expansion will be between 18 and 24 cards, which will include armour, and the techniques that work agains it. So with one copy, you can destroy your unarmoured opponent, or divide the armour and the techniques that work against it with your opponent. But best of all of course, and essential for a formal duel, is if you have a copy each.

If we make it to 50,000€, we will produce a second expansion: LIECHTENAUER (the dominant German system of Longsword). So all characters can add the guards, techniques, and tactics of this system to their repertoire.

If we get to 60,000€ we will produce a third expansion pack: AXES AND SPEARS! When Galeazzo and Boucicault actually fought, they did so with spears. Fiore provides us with instruction for the spear, and also the pollax, so if we reach our 60k stretch goal, we will make an expansion pack that allows players to add these fantastic weapons to their arsenal. This will include the possibility of fighting with the sword against axe or spear; the spear against axe or sword, and the axe against spear or sword, as well as the more usual matched weapons setup. If possible, we will include daggers as a back-up weapon for close quarters work, but that will depend on game design issues that are not yet resolved.

The Impact

This game provides entertainment, of course. But it is firmly based on the system of knightly combat written down in 1410 by Fiore dei Liberi. So you will also learn something about our European martial heritage, and be supporting our work to research the lost martial arts of Europe. We know we have done our job right if by playing this game, anyone who then comes to a Fiore beginner's course will find that they are familiar with the terminology and basic structure of the system.

The game will also be useful to those already training in swordsmanship, as a teaching tool. It can, for instance, be used to make freeplay more interesting: pick a guard card and fight from there, or pick a technique card and that's the only action you can win with. 

The game can also work for LARPers, as a set of combat mechanics to simulate fights between players.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think this is a cool idea, please share it with your friends. If you can't afford the game right now, persuade your friends to get one!

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Jamie Vanderhoef, and I'm the developer of Siege of Turtle Enclave. I've been developing the game for about a year and a half, and it has at last arrived at the home stretch. The journey to this point has been magical, and the support from fans has been humbling. I thank you all for what you have done for the project and for me personally as a result. Though I have endeavored to provide the most polished and appealing experience possible, I am only one person, and as the end comes more clearly into view I realize that there is much that remains beyond my power in order to make the game into the gem that I know it can be. That is why I am appealing to you today.

Siege of Turtle Enclave is a turn based strategy war game with real time battles, it's set in a vibrant and inviting fantasy world where the last remnant of a nation of turtles valiantly makes a stand against the ravaging hordes of corrupt owls which have wrested away most of the turtle's homeland. Over the course of the game players will research technologies, build up their settlement, train armies, and fight their way across the map in an attempt to overthrow the enemy warlord in his keep. Along the way, players will find goodie huts, collect resources from the map, and discover and recruit powerful heroes to fight alongside their armies. Each play through will be different, as the campaign map is randomly generated at the start of each new game, adding to the game's replay value.

                     

Battles are fought between armies consisting of up to 12 units each, with each side deploying up to 6 units onto the field and the remainder kept in reserve to replace fallen or wounded units as the battle proceeds. Each unit has a Damage Type and an Alignment, these two factors combine to determine how much damage deals to another unit in a kind of 'dual-rock-paper-scissors' system, countering Damage Types increases damage, whereas countering Alignment types reduce incoming damage. Units will also gain levels as they fight, increasing their HP, Attack, Defense, and Stamina. Stamina is used for special abilities, unlocked when a unit reaches lvl 3 and some units get a second one at level 6, and it's also used for attacking/defending, running out of Stamina will result in de-buffs and reduced combat efficiency. These features have been implemented into the current build of the game.

                     

Players move armies around the map in traditional turn based fashion, with battles ensuing when two armies sharing the same tile decide to engage one another. The enemy corrupts the tiles it occupies, and players must move their armies onto the corrupt tiles to purify them so resources can be collected from them. Hidden throughout the map are Goodie Huts, which can offer the player new techs, crops, units, or even Heroes! Enemy armies will spawn from Barracks and Towers hidden throughout the map, and taking these out will reduce their ability to fight against you as you build up enough strength to attack the enemy capital, which is somewhere on the opposite side of the map. These features have been implemented into the current build of the game.

                     

The player's settlement is the heart of their empire, it's where all troops are trained and all buildings are built, losing it means game over. Each turn represents one day of game time, how much a player can do each day is determined by how many workers they have stationed in the Enclave contributing 'hours' of work, these hours are used to build new buildings and harvest resources, as well as to construct improvements on the world map such as roads or citadels. Time as a dynamic resource adds a bit of spice in comparison to the standard turn-based interpretation of time; i.e. wait X amount of turns for Y to be finished. These features have been implemented into the current build of the game.

                     

Within the Enclave, players will be able to forage for and cultivate powerful crops which can be assigned to armies to give them buffs or single-use-per-battle advantages. Other crops may provide a slow but steady stream of resources, or other non-battle buffs. This feature is planned for implementation before release, but a rough iteration of it exists in the current build of the game.

                     

Players can discover, learn, and cast powerful spells with the use of a Sorcerer's Tower at the cost of Magic Crystals, this is how the system works now, though I have plans to implement a more robust and exciting system utilizing mana, charges, towers, and area-of-effect spells, for example: one might have a Sorcerer's Tower built in the Enclave, but it's range won't be able cast spells across the map, for this the player will have to build 'relay towers' to channel the spell, and these towers may have spells cast on them to effect any units or tiles within their range, like a thick fog to restrict the movement of enemy armies. The enemy will also be given such tools to use against the player, bringing into play the need for magical 'defenses' to hinder or stop such evils from blighting your lands or soldiers. This feature is planned for implementation before release, but a very rough iteration of it exists in the current build of the game.

                     

Besides the main Campaign, I am planning on adding two other game modes, Skirmish, and Conquest Mode, both of these modes focus on the real time battles. Skirmish mode is a simple set piece battle, fought with either random or selected units, with limited or unlimited resources to build both armies, this could be thought of as a testing ground for new battle strategies or just a bit of fun checking out units you might not normally use or see in-game. Conquest Mode is a progressive series of procedurally generated battles. At the start of the game players will select their units, paying for upgrades or levels, and select a Hero to lead their army, then the army they have built will fight an enemy army. If the player wins the they will receive money and experience to put towards more upgrades, replacing fallen units, or purchasing different ones, then they fight another battle, a little harder than the previous one. This goes on until the player dies/runs out of money, so it's an endless survival mode filled with nothing but battles. I hope to allow players to command either turtles or owls in both Skirmish and Conquest mode. These features are planned for implementation before release with no iteration of them in the current build of the game.

You can try out the game yourself right now, as a demo of the Beta is currently available for download.

This demo includes the first tier of structures, techs, units, and spells, there's no turn-limit or 10-day trial limit on the demo, play around with the content provided for as long as you like! It should give you a good idea of what the game is all about and how much fun it is.

The planned additions and revisions I can do with nothing but time and effort. What I cannot do at all is compose an original soundtrack, generate clean, atmospheric, and professional sound effects, nor am I much of a pixel artist. These elements of polish require the expertise of others. So if the campaign here is successful with the help of loyal fans such as yourself, I shall procure the services of said experts to raise the quality of the game to match it's potential, further improving the UI, sound, and music. The funding will also permit me to put more time into developing the game, freeing me to add a level of design and feature polish that would otherwise be outside the realm of practicality, and some of the planned features may not be able to reach their full potential if certain goals are not met. Of course I realize that many of you may not be able (or willing) to offer the project material resources, but if you really like what you see and want to help somehow, spread the word, this actually can help just as much or more than contributing to the campaign. If you tell even as few as 8 people about the game, if one of them contributes then in essence you just supported the campaign without any cost to yourself! (And potentially made another gamer very happy by leading them to this game).


                   

The Grunt perk give access to the Beta* of the game, and all updates up to release. These should all be sent out within a month after the campaign ends.

                   

The Steelfist perk grants my undying and sincerest appreciation, Beta* access, and the option of having the your name in the credits of the game (under the heading 'Extra Special Thanks To').

                   

The Archmage perk grants undying appreciation, Beta* access, credits option, and you get the next 2 titles that I release for free.


*All Beta access/copies/key codes will be sent out through Desura, the platform that the game is being distributed on. The game can then be downloaded through their client or as a standalone installer from their website once the code has been redeemed.


NOTE ON PERK DELIVERY: The estimated delivery date on the Beta access is a late-estimate, I will try to send out the keys as soon as someone gets the perk, all of them should be sent out by the end of January 2014 at the very latest. Credits will be included in the first update of the game client after the campaign has concluded, provided I receive the name of the contributor in time for the update, if it's late I'll include it in the next update. Archmage perk owners will be contacted when the future titles are made available for download to anyone outside the development team.
story_txt:
Hello everyone, my name is Jamie Vanderhoef, and I'm the developer of
Siege of Turtle Enclave. I've been developing the game for about a
year and a half, and it has at last arrived at the home stretch. The
journey to this point has been magical, and the support from fans has
been humbling. I thank you all for what you have done for the project
and for me personally as a result. Though I have endeavored
to provide the most polished and appealing experience possible, I am
only one person, and as the end comes more clearly into view I
realize that there is much that remains beyond my power in order to
make the game into the gem that I know it can be. That is why I am
appealing to you today.








Siege of Turtle Enclave is a turn based strategy war game with real
time battles, it's set in a vibrant and inviting fantasy world where
the last remnant of a nation of turtles valiantly makes a stand
against the ravaging hordes of corrupt owls which have wrested away
most of the turtle's homeland. Over the course of the game players
will research technologies, build up their settlement, train armies,
and fight their way across the map in an attempt to overthrow the
enemy warlord in his keep. Along the way, players will find goodie
huts, collect resources from the map, and discover and recruit
powerful heroes to fight alongside their armies. Each play through
will be different, as the campaign map is randomly generated at the
start of each new game, adding to the game's replay value.



                     


Battles are fought between armies consisting of up to 12 units each, with each side deploying up to 6 units onto the field and the remainder kept in reserve to replace fallen or wounded units as the battle proceeds.
Each unit has a Damage Type and an Alignment, these two factors
combine to determine how much damage deals to another unit in a kind
of 'dual-rock-paper-scissors' system, countering Damage Types
increases damage, whereas countering Alignment types reduce incoming
damage. Units will also gain levels as they fight, increasing their
HP, Attack, Defense, and Stamina. Stamina is used for special
abilities, unlocked when a unit reaches lvl 3 and some units get a
second one at level 6, and it's also used for attacking/defending, running out of
Stamina will result in de-buffs and reduced combat efficiency. These features have been implemented into the current build of the game.



                     


Players move armies around the map in traditional turn based fashion,
with battles ensuing when two armies sharing the same tile decide to
engage one another. The enemy corrupts the tiles it occupies, and
players must move their armies onto the corrupt tiles to purify them
so resources can be collected from them. Hidden throughout the map
are Goodie Huts, which can offer the player new techs, crops, units,
or even Heroes! Enemy armies will spawn from Barracks and Towers
hidden throughout the map, and taking these out will reduce their
ability to fight against you as you build up enough strength to
attack the enemy capital, which is somewhere on the opposite side of
the map. These features have been implemented into the current
build of the game.



                     


The player's settlement is the heart of their empire, it's where all
troops are trained and all buildings are built, losing it means game
over. Each turn represents one day of game time, how much a player
can do each day is determined by how many workers they have stationed
in the Enclave contributing 'hours' of work, these hours are used to
build new buildings and harvest resources, as well as to construct
improvements on the world map such as roads or citadels. Time as a
dynamic resource adds a bit of spice in comparison to the standard
turn-based interpretation of time; i.e. wait X amount of turns for Y
to be finished. These features have been implemented into the
current build of the game.



                     


Within the Enclave, players will be able to forage for and cultivate
powerful crops which can be assigned to armies to give them buffs or
single-use-per-battle advantages. Other crops may provide a slow but
steady stream of resources, or other non-battle buffs. This feature is planned for implementation before release, but
a rough iteration of it exists in the current build of the game.



                     


Players can discover, learn, and cast powerful spells with the use of
a Sorcerer's Tower at the cost of Magic Crystals, this is how the
system works now, though I have plans to implement a more robust and
exciting system utilizing mana, charges, towers, and area-of-effect
spells, for example: one might have a Sorcerer's Tower built in the
Enclave, but it's range won't be able cast spells across the map, for
this the player will have to build 'relay towers' to channel the
spell, and these towers may have spells cast on them to effect any
units or tiles within their range, like a thick fog to restrict the
movement of enemy armies. The enemy will also be given such tools to
use against the player, bringing into play the need for magical
'defenses' to hinder or stop such evils from blighting your lands or
soldiers. This feature is planned for implementation before
release, but a very rough
iteration of it exists in the current build of the game.



                     


Besides the main Campaign, I am planning on adding two other game
modes, Skirmish, and Conquest Mode, both of these modes focus on the
real time battles. Skirmish mode is a simple set piece battle, fought
with either random or selected units, with limited or unlimited
resources to build both armies, this could be thought of as a testing
ground for new battle strategies or just a bit of fun checking out
units you might not normally use or see in-game. Conquest Mode is a
progressive series of procedurally generated battles. At the start of
the game players will select their units, paying for upgrades or
levels, and select a Hero to lead their army, then the army they have
built will fight an enemy army. If the player wins the they will
receive money and experience to put towards more upgrades, replacing
fallen units, or purchasing different ones, then they fight another
battle, a little harder than the previous one. This goes on until the
player dies/runs out of money, so it's an endless survival mode
filled with nothing but battles. I hope to allow players to command either turtles or owls in both Skirmish and Conquest mode. These
features are planned for implementation before release with no
iteration of them in the current build of the game.



You can try out the game yourself right now, as a demo of the Beta is
currently available for download.





This demo includes the first tier of structures, techs, units, and
spells, there's no turn-limit or 10-day trial limit on the demo, play
around with the content provided for as long as you like! It should
give you a good idea of what the game is all about and how much fun
it is.








The planned additions and revisions I can do with nothing but time
and effort. What I cannot do at all is compose an original
soundtrack, generate clean, atmospheric, and professional sound
effects, nor am I much of a pixel artist.
These elements of polish require the expertise of others. So if the
campaign here is successful with the help of loyal fans such as
yourself, I shall procure the services of said experts to raise the
quality of the game to match it's potential, further improving the UI, sound, and music. The funding will also
permit me to put more time into developing the game, freeing me to
add a level of design and feature polish that would otherwise be
outside the realm of practicality, and some of the planned features
may not be able to reach their full potential if certain goals are
not met. Of course I realize that many of you may not be able (or
willing) to offer the project material resources, but if you really
like what you see and want to help somehow, spread the word,
this actually can help just as much or more than contributing to the
campaign. If you tell even as few as 8 people about the game, if one
of them contributes then in essence you just supported the campaign
without any cost to yourself! (And potentially made another gamer
very happy by leading them to this game).










                   



The Grunt perk give access to the Beta* of the game, and all updates
up to release. These should all be sent out within a month after the
campaign ends.



                   


The Steelfist perk grants my undying and sincerest appreciation, Beta* access, and the option of having the your name in the credits of the
game (under the heading 'Extra Special Thanks To').



                   


The Archmage perk grants undying appreciation, Beta* access, credits
option, and you get the next 2 titles that I release for free.
*All Beta access/copies/key codes will be sent out through Desura, the platform that the game is being distributed on. The game can then be downloaded through their client or as a standalone installer from their website once the code has been redeemed.
NOTE ON PERK DELIVERY: The estimated delivery date on the Beta access is a late-estimate, I will try to send out the keys as soon as someone gets the perk, all of them should be sent out by the end of January 2014 at the very latest. Credits will be included in the first update of the game client after the campaign has concluded, provided I receive the name of the contributor in time for the update, if it's late I'll include it in the next update. Archmage perk owners will be contacted when the future titles are made available for download to anyone outside the development team.

story:
Thanks for your interest in GameSamba and Ran Online. Following our successful partnering with Min Communications for the launch of Remnant Knights in the US last year, we plan to introduce a new English server for their flagship title: Ran Online. We are an independent online games publisher startup and the official publisher for Ran Online in North and South America.


Classic MMO with a Modern Flair
Ran Online is one of the early classic MMO games to gain huge success in SE Asia, and is still extremely popular today. We figured it was about time the English speaking markets could enjoy this modern day sci-fi RPG with a rock and roll soundtrack.

Unlike more recent MMO titles, you'll find nearly a decade of well-honed content to play through in Ran Online. The game is set in modern city environments, where you join one of 3 training institutes: Mystic Peak, Sacred Gate or Phoenix. Once enrolled, you start by developing one of 6 specialized classes (Brawler, Swordsman, Archer, Shaman, Scientist, and Assassin) as you progress your armor, skills and weapons all the way to level 260! Once you reach level 195, you can unlock a 7th class with superior abilities called Extreme, which can use all the skills and weapons of the other 6 classes.



The story originates with a meteor shower that infected humans with unusual abilities and opened a passage to a dark dimension.  The institutes were created to hone their students' newfound abilities so they can fight the unwelcome cross dimensional travelers. You'll find yourself cleaning up the city from all manner of hooligans, bandits, gangsters, and junkies initially, but soon evolve to more demented monsters like cyclops, vampires, humanoid mech hybrids and more. You can lure mobs for AOE attacks or choose PvP and block enemy attacks with the perfectly timed skill combo. Travel automatically with a single click on the map, but beware of agro as you cross dangerous neighborhoods.

Ran Online also provides group vs group battle via Death Match and Club Battles, as well as RvR opportunities with the Conquer System. With quests and plenty of player customization options, there is never a lack of things to do or places to explore.



It takes quite a bit of effort and cash to start up a new server and website, improve the English localization, bring in new users, and properly support the community, so we hope you'll take some time to help us with a donation of any size. Our goal with Indiegogo is to offer players old and new a way to be rewarded for their support before the servers are launched, and to use funds to improve this new English version of Ran. Check out the rewards on the right and we hope to see you in the new Official English server of Ran Online this Fall!

story:
Visit the Monster Trainer website

View some neat pieces of Monster Trainer art

What happens when we reach our goal?

Upon successfully completing the Monster Trainer Indiegogo campaign we'll begin hiring on essential team members (a more skilled developer to complete our prototype, a marketer to handle product launch/planning and bring our incredibly talented artists on as paid staff members.

Following a short period of development, the game will open for first private, then public beta (on the web browser, mobile phones, tablets and supported console browsers!).

Hi, everyone! I'm Nick McMillen and I'm working on Monster Trainer, an in-development browser-based monster training MMORPG project.

I'm super excited to talk to all of you about what we've been working on and what we hope you can be a part of.

Monster Trainer is an open-world monster capturing, trading and battling multiplayer online role-playing game where players navigate large, open landscapes inhabited by dangerous creatures. Trainers battle, capture and tame these monsters to compete with other trainers in battle or use their monster's skills for other in-game activities (like gather materials and racing). Monster Trainer will feature countless "mini games" to ensure that there's always something new and exciting to do.

Monster Trainer is the world's very first real world MMORPG. Monster Trainer9* is set in a real world identical to our own (meaning players can navigate large, open representations of actual cities all around the world (like London, England..New York, New York…Paris, France…Ha Noi, Vietnam or Pompeii, Italy……the list goes on and on).

The game functions in real time, meaning when the time is 1:30 PM in the "real" New York City, the time in the game's New York City will also be 1:30 PM. We take this real-time aspect to the extreme by extending it things like weather and seasons, construction, natural disasters and all sorts of other real-world events.

Let me put this in to perspective for you. As of today the United State's government is not functioning as it usually has been. These events would drastically effect things in the Monster Trainer world. In cities in the United States in-game, national battle leagues may cease to function, forcing players to pursue underground or illegal battling…national parks have been closed, so players wouldn't have access to the monsters unique to, for example, Yellowstone national park. 

Another example is animal migrations. A yearly occurrence in (for example) California between October and February is the migration of butterflies (traveling up to 2,000 miles). The Monster Trainer world would reflect these real-world happenings, making butterfly creatures available for battle and capture during this time.

These types of events would be occurring almost daily, making Monster Trainer incredibly unique and offering players an ever-changing environment to play in and learn from.

Like other RPGs, each city will have it's own collection of unique monsters, quests, items and just the culture in general. There's no limit to the potential of this real-world aspect.

Monster Trainer allows for a great deal of customization, allowing players to create a an in-game character that represents exactly who you are or somebody completely different. The customization extends far past the look of the player as we've introduced a very unique and in-depth skill system that allows trainers to develop certain abilities to gain advantages over other players in various areas, which could even allow players to barter their skills/service in-game.

Those that contribute by backing the project will have beta access to the game, working directly with our developers and designers and getting a sneak peak at the game before anyone else.

We're creating a very strong and involved community where each member can contribute their thoughts and opinions to the development process by suggesting ideas and having open discussions about how certain features could effect and better the gameplay. You can see this in action right now in the Monster Trainer forums.

Myself and several other really talented artists and game designers have dedicated all of our valuable free time to working out the kinks in these concepts but it's reached the point where the game needs things that we just can't do ourselves (such as a developer to expand on the multiplayer/open-world aspects and a marketing manager to handle the game's advertising).

Your support and backing is very important to us! If we reach our funding goals we'll be able to give Monster Trainer all the attention it deserves and finish this amazing game.

I hope you're as excited as we are about the potential of this project and that you're willing to jump on-board and bring our vision to life. 

Thanks for watching, I hope you guys will back us. 

Good luck, future trainers!

Can't back us? No problem, you can do just as much (if not more) help to the project by spreading the word! Tell your friends or post the project around the web....anything helps!


Update 10/11

Update 10/12

Update 10/13

Update 10/14

Your support and backing is very important to us! If we reach our funding goals we'll be able to give Monster Trainer all the attention it deserves and finish this amazing game.
I hope you're as excited as we are about the potential of this project and that you're willing to jump on-board and bring our vision to life. 
Thanks for watching, I hope you guys will back us. 
Good luck, future trainers!




Can't back us? No problem, you can do just as much (if not more) help to the project by spreading the word! Tell your friends or post the project around the web....anything helps!

story:
LIT tracks common activities like walking, running, swimming, etc., and it was designed to include movements unique to action sports like surf, skate, snow, moto, MTB, and BMX. LIT makes it easy for you to share videos, stats and updates from your latest sessions across social media.

Press highlights

Track activity and action

LIT’s advanced sensors analyze your movements 24×7, scoring both everyday activity and action by interpreting steps, distance, duration, intensity, strokes, paddles, jumps, rotations, turns, g-force, airtime, and more.

Earn points for activity and bonuses for action. Points become the currency used to challenge yourself, your friends, and the world.

Built For Action

  • Measure & Score your Action Sports Performance
  • Challenge friends anywhere
  • Share sessions, videos, stats and pictures

LIT Keeps You Connected

Using Bluetooth 4.0, the LIT module delivers data from your device to your smartphone App. LIT is designed to be worn 24/7 and has an extended battery life that lasts up to four days.

LIT allows you to compete with friends, share on social networks, track your performance and earn points. So whether you’re a runner, surfer, boarder, skater, do BMX, ride Moto or just live actively …LIT is for you. LIT is inspired by and built for the action sports lifestyle.

Wear it wherever, whenever!

LIT is 24x7 wearable and built to go where you go. Snow, surf, dirt, pavement? No problem. LIT is built for extremes. It’s rugged, shock resistant, and water resistant to 10 ATM / 100 m.

LIT’s also modular. So it can be worn on your wrist, on your belt, on a lanyard, in your pocket, or just about anywhere else you can hide a small matchbox. The difference is you won’t want to hide LIT.

Create and crush your own X Games

Launch a competition - versus yourself, versus your friends, versus the world. LIT scores everything you do. So stop talking and start doing.

It's like Strava, just for more things that you love to do. 

Share your most awesome highlights

Touch share in the app to send your verified awesomeness to friends via Twitter, Facebook, and eventually more.

Team

Perks

 

Why Indiegogo?

We have poured our hearts, souls, and savings into this business. And after 15 months of development, we are finally ready to share our creation with the world.

Before we take the next step, we want to know that you are just as excited about this product as we are. Entrepreneurship can be a very lonely endeavor, and creating a crowd of believers via Indiegogo is vital to our success moving forward. You are not just supporting a cool project - you’re helping to create a company that lasts.

FAQ

Q: Where can I get a LIT activity tracker?
A: LIT is currently only available through Indiegogo. Support the campaign and reserve your own LIT today. Be the first of your friends to experience LIT.

Q: When does LIT begin shipping?
A: LIT begins shipping in August 2013, hurry up and reserve LIT today so you can get yours first.

Q: What activities does LIT track?
A: LIT has been specifically designed to recognize the movements in action sports and applies tailored algorithms to score those movements. LIT also tracks day-to-day activities like walking and running (i.e. steps). See the specification section above for a partial list of metrics provided for select activity types.

Q: Do I have to be a pro athlete to use LIT?
A: No. LIT allows you to set up casual competitions with your friends through the mobile App. You can also share your activities online, so that while other people may be saying they're riding, shredding or boarding, you have the stats to prove it.

Q: What smartphone does the LIT app work with?
A: Right now, the LIT App works with any iOS device that uses Bluetooth 4.0. That includes iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, the latest iPads and iPod Touches (version 6.0 or higher). The LIT app will be available for Android in January 2014.

Q: When will Android be available?
A: Android is a major priority for us. We'll for sure have it by January 2014, possibly sooner.

Q: Does LIT track heart rate?
A: No. The LIT module does not include sensors for heart rate. However, we do anticipate adding the feature to import heart rate data from other heart rate monitors that use Bluetooth 4.0 in 2014.

Q: Does LIT function as a regular watch/pedometer/etc? Is the idea to make this something people rock full time or just when they're shredding?
A: Yes, LIT displays time. LIT is an activity tracker designed to be worn 24x7, no matter the occasion and in its simplest form, LIT functions as a normal watch and pedometer. In the design process we took all of the popular features of activity trackers and just added to them. We really hope that people will love LIT the way we do and rock it all day. Our team certainly does.

Q: Does LIT track sleep?
A: Not at this time. LIT interprets inactivity (including sleep) as inactivity. We do not analyze periods of inactivity to detect specific sleep patterns or sleep metrics.

Q: Does LIT count calories?
A: No. We count fun. In all seriousness, calories are too difficult to calculate accurately, so out of principle, we do not include it. In our opinion, most of the other products that do display calories are making a guess, and that is not good enough for us. Daily scores and duration of activity are more reflective of day to day exertion.

Q: Will there be a desktop or web app available?
A: For now, we are focused on the mobile (and tablet) experience. LIT syncs wirelessly with your phone, and the richest experience occurs through the phone/tablet.

Q: Can I wear LIT while swimming or surfing?
A: For sure! LIT goes where you go. It is modular, rugged, and water resistant to 100 meters (that's more than 300 feet).

Q: Are you supposed to wear LIT all day?
A: Yes. LIT tracks your activities 24x7 and can be worn in several ways. We have accessories that can put LIT on your wrist, hip, pocket or hanging on a lanyard. Keeping it on all day will help you track your active lifestyle with no interruptions or excuses.

Q: How long does the LIT tracker's battery last?
A: The LIT battery lasts up to four days on a single charge. We're working on extending battery life, so that you rarely have to stop to charge up.

Q: How do you sync LIT with your phone?
A: LIT syncs with your smart device wirelessly, through Bluetooth LE. Swipe to sync and just watch your scores roll in.

Q: Does LIT improve my abilities at all?
A: It's really cool, but it's not magic. LIT can help your training, but won't improve your abilities directly. With LIT you'll be able to monitor exactly how high, long and hard you're hitting your active lifestyle on a daily basis. LIT also gets you to a new level of competition - including one-on-one challenges, live leaderboards, king of the mountain, impromptu competitions and more.

Q: What data is available straight from the device?
A: The LIT device displays time, cumulative score, steps, and battery life. The free downloadable app will offer a majority of the information. It's designed this way to optimize the battery life of the module. LIT can be worn for more than four days without a recharge. The app will provide details on your day-to-day activities as well as specific details about the action sports you participate in. See specifications above for more details.

Q: Does LIT track speed and altitude?
A: The LIT app imports GPS information from your smartphone. As such, LIT will capture speed, distance, elevation, vertical, etc. for activities where you have your phone with you while participating. The LIT module itself does not have a GPS sensor.

Q: What is the difference between LIT and other activity monitors?
A: LIT contains many of the awesome features of existing activity trackers. Our design intent was to take the best features and add to them by accounting for the dynamics of action sports. So, in addition to counting steps, we count jumps, rotations, airtime and lots more.

Q: What does it mean to track airtime?
A: There are potentially lots of false positives when it comes to airtime, especially when you wear the device on your wrist. But, for those of you who have gotten some air (hopefully everyone reading this), you definitely know the feeling and so do we. It's addicting and super fun, and we capture that in all it's glory.

Q: What does it mean to track turns?
A: Whether moving around the office, the house, driving around in the car, etc, you make lots of turns throughout the day. We don't track those turns, we're talking about the big ones, the ones you feel in your thighs.

Q: Can LIT track flips?
A: Oh yea... We have been working pretty hard on getting that in there, and our accuracy is almost there. Anyone want to test for us? And we're not talking about on a trampoline.

Q: How does your technology work?
A: It's a secret! But, we'll say that a big part of it is recording crazy data from multiple complementary sensors and turning it in to rotation matrices and 3D vectors, much like computer game developers use to render 3D graphics. It's cool technology and we're lucky it works so well with action sports.

Q: What does it mean to track paddles?
A: It's a lot like being able to track a swim stroke. Almost identical in fact, and yeah, we track swim strokes too, but we're all about action sports. So train in the pool to live in the ocean...

Q: Will you add more metrics?
A: Yes, for sure. It takes a lot of testing, and we want to make sure we achieve an acceptable quality level and accuracy, but the good news is that we love testing.

story_txt:
LIT tracks common activities like walking, running, swimming, etc., and it was designed to include movements unique to action sports like surf, skate, snow, moto, MTB, and BMX. LIT makes it easy for you to share videos, stats and updates from your latest sessions across social media.

Press highlights







Track activity and action
LIT’s advanced sensors analyze your movements 24×7, scoring both everyday activity and action by interpreting steps, distance, duration, intensity, strokes, paddles, jumps, rotations, turns, g-force, airtime, and more.
Earn points for activity and bonuses for action. Points become the currency used to challenge yourself, your friends, and the world.


Built For Action


Measure & Score your Action Sports Performance

Challenge friends anywhere

Share sessions, videos, stats and pictures

LIT Keeps You Connected
Using Bluetooth 4.0, the LIT module delivers data from your device to your smartphone App. LIT is designed to be worn 24/7 and has an extended battery life that lasts up to four days.
LIT allows you to compete with friends, share on social networks, track your performance and earn points. So whether you’re a runner, surfer, boarder, skater, do BMX, ride Moto or just live actively …LIT is for you. LIT is inspired by and built for the action sports lifestyle.

Wear it wherever, whenever!
LIT is 24x7 wearable and built to go where you go. Snow, surf, dirt, pavement? No problem. LIT is built for extremes. It’s rugged, shock resistant, and water resistant to 10 ATM / 100 m.
LIT’s also modular. So it can be worn on your wrist, on your belt, on a lanyard, in your pocket, or just about anywhere else you can hide a small matchbox. The difference is you won’t want to hide LIT.



Create and crush your own X Games
Launch a competition - versus yourself, versus your friends, versus the world. LIT scores everything you do. So stop talking and start doing.
It's like Strava, just for more things that you love to do. 
Share your most awesome highlights
Touch share in the app to send your verified awesomeness to friends via Twitter, Facebook, and eventually more.

Team



Perks

 

Why Indiegogo?
We have poured our hearts, souls, and savings into this business. And after 15 months of development, we are finally ready to share our creation with the world.
Before we take the next step, we want to know that you are just as excited about this product as we are. Entrepreneurship can be a very lonely endeavor, and creating a crowd of believers via Indiegogo is vital to our success moving forward. You are not just supporting a cool project - you’re helping to create a company that lasts.

FAQ
Q: Where can I get a LIT activity tracker? A: LIT is currently only available through Indiegogo. Support the campaign and reserve your own LIT today. Be the first of your friends to experience LIT.
Q: When does LIT begin shipping? A: LIT begins shipping in August 2013, hurry up and reserve LIT today so you can get yours first.
Q: What activities does LIT track?A: LIT has been specifically designed to recognize the movements in action sports and applies tailored algorithms to score those movements. LIT also tracks day-to-day activities like walking and running (i.e. steps). See the specification section above for a partial list of metrics provided for select activity types.
Q: Do I have to be a pro athlete to use LIT? A: No. LIT allows you to set up casual competitions with your friends through the mobile App. You can also share your activities online, so that while other people may be saying they're riding, shredding or boarding, you have the stats to prove it.
Q: What smartphone does the LIT app work with? A: Right now, the LIT App works with any iOS device that uses Bluetooth 4.0. That includes iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, the latest iPads and iPod Touches (version 6.0 or higher). The LIT app will be available for Android in January 2014.
Q: When will Android be available?A: Android is a major priority for us. We'll for sure have it by January 2014, possibly sooner.
Q: Does LIT track heart rate? A: No. The LIT module does not include sensors for heart rate. However, we do anticipate adding the feature to import heart rate data from other heart rate monitors that use Bluetooth 4.0 in 2014.
Q: Does LIT function as a regular watch/pedometer/etc? Is the idea to make this something people rock full time or just when they're shredding?A: Yes, LIT displays time. LIT is an activity tracker designed to be worn 24x7, no matter the occasion and in its simplest form, LIT functions as a normal watch and pedometer. In the design process we took all of the popular features of activity trackers and just added to them. We really hope that people will love LIT the way we do and rock it all day. Our team certainly does.
Q: Does LIT track sleep? A: Not at this time. LIT interprets inactivity (including sleep) as inactivity. We do not analyze periods of inactivity to detect specific sleep patterns or sleep metrics.
Q: Does LIT count calories? A: No. We count fun. In all seriousness, calories are too difficult to calculate accurately, so out of principle, we do not include it. In our opinion, most of the other products that do display calories are making a guess, and that is not good enough for us. Daily scores and duration of activity are more reflective of day to day exertion.
Q: Will there be a desktop or web app available? A: For now, we are focused on the mobile (and tablet) experience. LIT syncs wirelessly with your phone, and the richest experience occurs through the phone/tablet.
Q: Can I wear LIT while swimming or surfing? A: For sure! LIT goes where you go. It is modular, rugged, and water resistant to 100 meters (that's more than 300 feet).
Q: Are you supposed to wear LIT all day? A: Yes. LIT tracks your activities 24x7 and can be worn in several ways. We have accessories that can put LIT on your wrist, hip, pocket or hanging on a lanyard. Keeping it on all day will help you track your active lifestyle with no interruptions or excuses.

The app will provide details on your day-to-day activities as well as specific details about the action sports you participate in. See specifications above for more details.

story:
NeuroMash, is a “mind-control” casino gaming company utilizing newly available third-party mobile, inexpensive EEG-reading headsets for casino games. This headset, developed by NeuroSky, utilizes raw brainwave signals to control the game’s interaction. We chose NeuroMash as our company name because we wanted to “mash-up” classical gaming with this unique and novel form of user interaction. We believe our new “mind-control” casino gaming will offer a "disruptive" level of user interaction right along with currently available traditional casino gaming. Just imagine using a "mind trick” to beat the house in slots. Mind-control casino gaming will offer gamers what they have always wanted, the power to self influence their odds of winning. Nothing captures the imagination like the power of the mind and playing our “mind games” in multiplayer environments, such as our upcoming “Neuropoker” game, will teach you how to hone your real-world poker skills and become a better competitor. Please join us at this critical moment in time for mind-control gaming and “cross the chasm” with us!

 


We are currently at the beginning of the mind game evolution. This is a unique moment to join a brand new industry by helping us put this genre of technology on the gaming map!

 

First, we must work towards the Beta Release of NeuroSlot and our single line of casino games. The beta release will be built through a cross platform strategy using Unity 4.2 and will interface with Neurosky’s MindWave and MindWave Mobile hardware. These will be released on Android, iOS, PC and Mac. For instance, you could view a detailed video description of our prototype for Neuroslot in the gallery section of this campaign. Upon the successful Beta completion, we plan on publishing “Neuroslot” (Slots mind game) followed by “Neurowar” (Casino Wars mind game), “Neurojack” (Blackjack mind game) and “Neuroulette” (Roulette mind game) on Neurosky’s gaming portal. 



Furthermore, each headset comes with several unique algorithms developed by NeuroSky including concentration, relaxation, blinks, task difficulty. and task familiarity activities. To that effect, along with our single player line of casino mind games, we are currently working on an interactive multi-player poker mind game. Just imagine playing Texas Hold ‘Em and although your opponents can’t see your cards, they can see your various biosignals. Yes, we are giving the online Poker enthusiasts what the “live players” have always had. “Tells!” For the first time ever, online poker players will have tells on their opponents. For instance, your opponents will be able to see both your own and your competitor’s level of relaxation and focus during the game.  In the process, you will learn to make better gambling decisions and become better online poker players. Neuropoker can become a valuable “learning tool” for live players! Live players can monitor their online playing activity while playing Neuropoker and learn how to control their real-world poker skills and become a better competitor. Please note that Neuropoker will be a web-based only game and will be offered on Neuromash.com in a multi-player environment.

  


We are on Indiegogo because we know that this is the best way to get our “mind-control” casino games in your hands as soon as possible! With all of the above in mind, we estimate we will need $25,000 for the launch of our initial single player casino mind games and initial development of Neuropoker and other upcoming multi-player mind-control casino games. Join us in creating this new genre of casino games and let’s share our novel vision with the world!

 

   

 

 

 


The core Neuromash team includes Mehran, Daniel and Kevin. Our passion is cutting edge technology and we aim to integrate technology into our everyday activities in a natural and fitting way. Mehran and Kevin are life long friends working in the tech and business sector.They came across thought-controlled computer interface technology back in the fall of 2010 and eventually became infatuated by it. Dan joined the group in the following summer of 2011 right out of college with a fresh degree in computer science and somewhere along the way we combined our backgrounds in computer science and entrepreneurship to create Neuromash. We believe that “mind-control” gaming is in its infancy and will only make every day life more interactive and entertaining. That is why we are asking for your support. We are eager to listen to your feedback once you receive and play our single player casino mind games. If you believe in our futuristic vision of casino gaming, our passion, and/or if you just really like Canadians, then please donate to this project!

 

What sort of emotional states can we use to play the single player line of games?

A user will be able to set as concentration or relaxation as his or her desired emotional state to play the 4 casino single player games for now. As new algorithms for other emotional states are developed for the headset, we will include them into updates to the games for users to choose from.        

 

Will you be adding new algorithms to Neuropoker?

Yes, we will be adding new algorithms to Neuropoker, as they become available to us. We strive towards giving online poker players insight into their psyche!

 

Are the single-player line of games and Neuropoker purely brain controlled?

Yes, the games will be principally brain controlled. The only way a user can have an effect on his or her gaming outcome is by altering his or her emotional states. Players will be able to view his or her opponent’s emotional states as well as their own in these applications.

 

Are the single player line of games and Neuropoker playable without the headset?

Yes, they are playable without the headsets. But, they are no longer considered mind games and are back to being classic casino games. A mind-control casino game is a casino game where the odds of the game are altered by a users emotional state “captured and analyzed” by the headset.One last note regarding classic casino gaming, we plan on eventually offering “mind-control and classic casino gaming" on Neuromash.com

story:
Nimrod and Linda Jones have worked in the games industry for a number of years doing various jobs within it. Nimrod as a freelance writer, editor and proofreader (predominantly with Cubicle 7 (www.cubicle7.co.uk)), Linda as a freelance illustrator and designer (www.sheblackdragon.com). Together, they have a beautiful baby girl and lots of awesome game ideas.

Talking Skull is the culmination of years of gaming and the launch of a brand new card game, Faustus, by Nimrod Jones, art by George C. Cotronis (www.ravenkult.com), due for release later in the year through Angus Abranson's new company, Chronicle City (www.chroniclecity.com).

Using Faustus as our flagship game, we want to release our other exciting games in development through next year. The darkly occult tactical card game, Faustus, is only the beginning: we have a light-hearted, fun family card game, a Euro-style game of social dynamics and an epic deck building game that’ll blow you away! And that’s just for starters…

With the first two games entering playtesting and the third in development for playtesting, we really want to get these games to you as soon as we can. Dividing time for freelance work, it's taken a long time to get Faustus launched, but we want to get these other awesome games out sooner and really get this new gaming company up to a running start.

We're so excited about them and we know you will be too. To give these games the full attention they deserve, to thoroughly playtest, develop the art and rules, we need your help! If we are to work full time on these games, we're likely to have very little other sources of freelance income and with a baby girl to provide for this won't be possible within the time-frame we would like.

Faustus is already in layout and has had a preview print made. This made its debut at UKGamesExpo in Birmingham in May and was very well received. We need to make a few tweaks to the layout, correct a few typos, but it's all good to go to the printers as soon as we can afford it.

Meanwhile, we're ready to start turning out the art on our other two games while also getting them into playtesting to get the rules down pat. With your help funding us to give us time to dedicate to our work, we can realistically look at these games hitting the shelves no later than next year (if we can dedicate enough time to push getting at least one of them out by Christmas, we'll be very happy!).

We're asking for $4,000, but the more we get the better we can do! This covers start up capital and "breathing room". This lets us get components to make decent prototypes for playtesting, gives us the time to concentrate on producing the art promptly and do the layout. Some of our games ideas have already had a lot of work put into them, others are really cool but big projects that require a lot of time to make.

The more money we get the more we can put back into those projects when we get to seeking funding for them independently. We can lower the amount we need to ask for by already having a large chunk of it from you now.

If we don't reach our goal, we'll still put that money to good use to give us as much time as that money will allow to focus on what we can. It might stretch our timeline a little as we won't be able to get as much done, so we might only get one game out next year instead of two.

Even if you can't donate much, whatever you can afford will be greatly appreciated. You can still help by really letting people know that we're doing this. I'll be honest, if Kickstarter was available to the UK, we'd probably be doing it there, so let your friends know about us and that we're on Indiegogo.
 
We'll expand the Perks available soon after this fundraiser launches, so if nothing grabs you now, please come back and check again.
 
Please share our start up with as many people as you know might be interested and let's make some games!
 
Remember: You're not bound by the Perks. If you can't afford that much, or you want to give more, when you hit Contribute you can enter any value you want. If it doesn't match a Perk, or you don't wish to claim a Perk, just select the option to contribute without a Perk.
 
Scenario Disclaimer: The scenario we're offering is the copyrighted property of Cubicle 7 Entertainment, written by Nimrod Jones for them. If you take a Perk that includes the scenario, we shall purchase the scenario on your behalf from either RPGNow or DriveThruRPG (your choice) and you'll be emailed a link to obtain your copy. We will contact you at the end of funding to confirm which site you wish to obtain your copy from.
 

Perks Update 13/06/12

We're pleased to announce that with the support of Deadstar Publishing we can offer two ebooks. Anyone claiming the $10 Perk can choose between one of the below. Everyone else gets both ebooks!

Suncaller by B. John Shaw Liddle

Sixteen year old Mortimer 'Hopeless' Hope can't run, can't catch and can't fight. How on earth is he supposed to be a hero?

As if coursework and P.E. lessons weren't bad enough, there's a psycho on a killing spree in his home town that only he can see, his dreams have been getting weirder, and people he’s not sure he believes in want him to win a war on another plane of existence. Hopeless just wants to impress the foul-mouthed goth girl next door, but apparently he's got a prophecy to fulfill...

Rising Stars Vol. 1

Containing eight graphic stories from up and coming authors and artists, Rising Stars vol 1 is Deadstar Publishing's first foray into the graphic novel market. Featuring medieval backstabbing, futuristic manhunts and crime-fighting dolphins, among other things this collection combines fantasy, horror and science-fiction in a way you've never seen it before!

Perks Update 15/06/12

We thought we'd put up a sample of some of Linda's art. Unless you already know SheBlackDragon's art and know a specific print you'd like to have, we'll probably look to putting a little 'catalogue' type thing together for you to choose from.

Meanwhile, here's a sample of Linda's awesome art:
story_txt:
Nimrod and Linda Jones have worked in the games industry for a number of years doing various jobs within it. Nimrod as a freelance writer, editor and proofreader (predominantly with Cubicle 7 (www.cubicle7.co.uk)), Linda as a freelance illustrator and designer (www.sheblackdragon.com). Together, they have a beautiful baby girl and lots of awesome game ideas.
Talking Skull is the culmination of years of gaming and the launch of a brand new card game, Faustus, by Nimrod Jones, art by George C. Cotronis (www.ravenkult.com), due for release later in the year through Angus Abranson's new company, Chronicle City (www.chroniclecity.com).Using Faustus as our flagship game, we want to release our other exciting games in development through next year. The darkly occult tactical card game, Faustus, is only the beginning: we have a light-hearted, fun family card game, a Euro-style game of social dynamics and an epic deck building game that’ll blow you away! And that’s just for starters…With the first two games entering playtesting and the third in development for playtesting, we really want to get these games to you as soon as we can. Dividing time for freelance work, it's taken a long time to get Faustus launched, but we want to get these other awesome games out sooner and really get this new gaming company up to a running start.We're so excited about them and we know you will be too. To give these games the full attention they deserve, to thoroughly playtest, develop the art and rules, we need your help! If we are to work full time on these games, we're likely to have very little other sources of freelance income and with a baby girl to provide for this won't be possible within the time-frame we would like.Faustus is already in layout and has had a preview print made. This made its debut at UKGamesExpo in Birmingham in May and was very well received. We need to make a few tweaks to the layout, correct a few typos, but it's all good to go to the printers as soon as we can afford it.
Meanwhile, we're ready to start turning out the art on our other two games while also getting them into playtesting to get the rules down pat. With your help funding us to give us time to dedicate to our work, we can realistically look at these games hitting the shelves no later than next year (if we can dedicate enough time to push getting at least one of them out by Christmas, we'll be very happy!).
We're asking for $4,000, but the more we get the better we can do! This covers start up capital and "breathing room". This lets us get components to make decent prototypes for playtesting, gives us the time to concentrate on producing the art promptly and do the layout. Some of our games ideas have already had a lot of work put into them, others are really cool but big projects that require a lot of time to make.
The more money we get the more we can put back into those projects when we get to seeking funding for them independently. We can lower the amount we need to ask for by already having a large chunk of it from you now.
If we don't reach our goal, we'll still put that money to good use to give us as much time as that money will allow to focus on what we can. It might stretch our timeline a little as we won't be able to get as much done, so we might only get one game out next year instead of two.

Even if you can't donate much, whatever you can afford will be greatly appreciated. You can still help by really letting people know that we're doing this. I'll be honest, if Kickstarter was available to the UK, we'd probably be doing it there, so let your friends know about us and that we're on Indiegogo.
 
We'll expand the Perks available soon after this fundraiser launches, so if nothing grabs you now, please come back and check again.
 
Please share our start up with as many people as you know might be interested and let's make some games!
 

Remember: You're not bound by the Perks. If you can't afford that much, or you want to give more, when you hit Contribute you can enter any value you want. If it doesn't match a Perk, or you don't wish to claim a Perk, just select the option to contribute without a Perk.
 

Scenario Disclaimer: The scenario we're offering is the copyrighted property of Cubicle 7 Entertainment, written by Nimrod Jones for them. If you take a Perk that includes the scenario, we shall purchase the scenario on your behalf from either RPGNow or DriveThruRPG (your choice) and you'll be emailed a link to obtain your copy. We will contact you at the end of funding to confirm which site you wish to obtain your copy from.

How on earth is he supposed to be a hero?As if coursework and P.E. lessons weren't bad enough, there's a psycho on a killing spree in his home town that only he can see, his dreams have been getting weirder, and people he’s not sure he believes in want him to win a war on another plane of existence. Hopeless just wants to impress the foul-mouthed goth girl next door, but apparently he's got a prophecy to fulfill...

Featuring medieval backstabbing, futuristic manhunts and crime-fighting dolphins, among other things this collection combines fantasy, horror and science-fiction in a way you've never seen it before!

story:
Svenska kulter - rollspelet

Svenska kulter – rollspelet är ett skräckspel som bygger på böckerna Samlade Svenska kulter, Jag såg henne i dag i receptionen och En man av stil. Spelet innehåller en ny novell och ett intro-äventyr av Anders Fager själv, som dessutom har bidragit med ovärderlig bakgrundsinformation.

Myten

Den moderna människan tror att hon har grepp om universum. Kanske inte i detalj, men vetenskapen kan förklara en hel del. Och det är bara en tidsfråga tills den har upptäckt universums sista hemligheter. Vilket övermod. Om folk visste sanningen skulle de gå under i galenskap och förtvivlan. Människan är inte ensam. Det finns fruktansvärda varelser, gudar och andra varelser, oändligt gamla och oändligt onda. Bortom stjärnorna eller dolda i vår värld. Och om de överhuvudtaget känner något för mänskligheten så är det hat. De väntar bara på ett tillfälle att återkomma och förgöra oss. Det riktiga universumet är kallt, ont och bortom mänskligt förstånd.

Sanningen har dock uppenbarats för ett fåtal. De flesta av dem har krossats av denna vetskap. Men inte alla. De har istället omfamnat den, sökt att dra nytta av den. Blivit de gamla gudarnas tjänare här på jorden. Dessa människor kallas för kultister.

Du är en av dem.

Eller kanske ännu värre, du är ett monster, en hybrid som kämpar för att överleva i en ogästvänlig värld. En värld som de andra kallar Sverige.

Vi vill göra en så bra version som möjligt 

Spelet kommer göras i mjukpärm i standardversionen, men vi vill gärna kunna göra en inbunden bersion också. Hårdpärm och bättre bokpapper i inlagan. Vi vill också göra en liten exklusiv upplaga på bara 10 böcker, handinbundna i svart läder, för samlaren.

De första 300 exemplaren av böckerna kommer dessutom vara signerade av Anders Fager.

Planeras att vara tryckt och klar i augusti... absolut senast till Bokmässan i September.

Vad kan man köpa?

Vi kan erbjuda följande:

Uppnått:

  • Stöd Svenska kulter, få ditt namn i boken (om €2000 nås)
  • Spelet som PDF (om €2000 nås). FINNS ENDAST ATT KÖPA UNDER CROWDFUNDINGEN! 
  • Spelet med mjukpärm (om €2000 nås)
  • Bli medlem i ett hemligt sällskap i den tryckta boken (bara 3 platser, om €2000 nås)
  • Spelet med hårdpärm – STRETCH GOAL 1 
  • T-shirt med furie (Bilden nedan) – STRETCH GOAL 1

Vid €4000:

  • Hoodie med omslagsbilden (Skarvmannen) – STRETCH GOAL 2 (om €4000 nås)
  • Spelet i numrerad upplaga med handgjort läderband – STRETCH GOAL 2 (om €4000 nås)
  • Affisch med furie (A2) – STRETCH GOAL 2 (om €4000 nås)
  • NYTT: Boken trycks med inlagan i 2-färg – STRETCH GOAL 2 (om €4000 nås)

OBS. Allt köps separat! 

T-shirt finns att köpa nu! (svart)


Alla priser är inklusive frakt inom Sverige.

_________________________________________________________________________

20% av vinsten från försäljningen kommer skänkas till hjärnforskning. 

_________________________________________________________________________

In english:

Svenska kulter – rollspelet is a swedish roleplaying game based on Anders Fagers books. Lovecraft-inspired horror with unique twist. 

All prices are including shipping in Sweden.
