story:
This video is the presentation of the artificial intelligence, we created it with RAIN but it's not so simple as we thought xD.

However now the enemies follow you and they don't walk across the walls and the game objects, they also do a waypoint path or go in random movement and if you are in a certain distance they attack you with punch, if you run behind an house they don't see you so they stop to follow you and turn back to their path.

This is a little video to show you the fluidy of the animations, that are in continuous improvement!


This is a video about the equip system of weapons:



Here some screenshots:

About Us:

  • Hello, I'm Agnese, an italian girl, i love play survival pc games than i would develope a new survival game with my team.
  • This campaign is for all the people who love survival game like me.
  • With you're help we want to achieve a more beautiful game with more features, weapon, environmental, landscape, building and a more expansive gameplay with a lot of animations and more. 

Why 500€

  • At the moment we're working with Unity free version and free assets, so with the money we'll buy buildings, textures, a site, servers online and unity pro version for obtain a better quality of the game in general.
  • We also hope to reach the goal to pay Steam Greenlight.
  • For all donations over 20€ we'll give 20 keys when the game will be released.
  • If we don't reach the goal we'll invest the money consistently in the game.

What the project needs:

  • A site;
  • Steam Greenlight;
  • Rifle Animset Pro for 46.36€;
  • Weapon HQ #1 for €27.82;
  • Weapon HQ #2 for €9.27;
  • Weapon HQ #3 for €27.82;
  • Weapon HQ #5 for €23.18;
  • Weapon HQ #6 for €27.82;
  • Weapon HQ #7 for €23.18;
  • Apocalyptic City Pack for €69.54 (or something like that) as Human destroyed city;
  • Dark City for €69.54 (or something like that) as City of robots;

About the Project

Software:

  • Unity3D 4.6 free version for make the game;

  • The Gimp 2 for icons.
Gameplay:
  • Third person.
  • Multiplayer, the game will be released as a multiplayer version cause pvp and coop will be important parts of our game!
  • 9 kinds of weapons: P2000, Glock19, MAC-10 and Knuckles as primary weapons and UMP-45, M4A1, AK-47, R-870, M39-EMR as secondary weapons; and these will be only a start because with the development will put others weapons!
  • 3 kinds of enemies: Low robot with low skills that drops low armors; Mid robot with mid skills that drops mid armors and high robot with high skills that drops high armors.
Scripts:
  • Done: Shot and reload system; Inventory system; Storage system; Player health; Player energy; Player respawn; Player animation controller; Pause system (when the inventory is open); Bleeding; Weapons equip; Enemy AI; Enemy Health; Enemy AI Damage; Enemy respawn; Consumable items; Spawn random objects.
  • To do: Clothing (only to write); HeadShot; Enemy drop (already thought); Online system. 

Map:
  • Size: 4500x4500
  • 3 main sites, 4 smaller places and 2 protected areas.
  • Environments: a desert, a canyon, a big pine forest, a lake and a rocky area.




Distribution (coming soon):

  • Steam;
  • Game site.

Other Ways To Help Us

You can also help us sharing our campaign on the sucial networks like facebook, twitter; leave a comment and follow the campaign.

story:
A strong Website shows a Strong Guild. It's with the first exposure many players will have to our guild. As well as the pulse of the guild's activity itself. If it's easy and convenient to find people looking for static groups to do FoTMs, Raid, PvP, or WvW with then it serves to promote those activities within the guild. That's my goal. Something more usable that can serve, not only as a resource for incoming members but as a consistent, useful resource for veterans as well.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

- You know who we are. You know what we've been through to get here.

 

Our community's been around for almost 8 years now & it's not going anywhere. When I mentioned that we were bringing back teamspeak & making a website a bunch of people offered to throw money at me without question. Taking funds in that way seemed distasteful, but I wanted to open the opportunity to contribute to the guild up to everyone instead of just a few people.

No contribution is required of course, but every little bit helps!

Thanks to Rio & Kyban's efforts we currently have a teamspeak for free! But it costs about ~$250 / year for the domain & website. Which are important parts of how we do recruitment & keep the quality of our members high!

I haven't & never will take a cent from anyone for my personal use. Everything, the funds, my efforts, & anything extra we raise is and always will be for the community!

 

If you have any questions feel free to ask me on TS or in-game!

See you in Tyria,

 - Pseudo

story:
Updates

#5 Industry veteran Mark Jones who used to work at Ocean Software has now joined the writing team of the magazine. In this issue will be the first of a 2-part article on what life was really like at the head offices of Ocean back in the 80's and early 90's.

#4 TIGA is now fully supporting the production of Retro Fusion. Check out the press release here : http://www.tiga.org/news/press-releases/planned-videogame-publication-receives-tiga-backing

#3 As mentioned in an earlier blog, Jonathan Cauldwell is writing an exclusive ZX Spectrum game for Retro Fusion Issue 3. The game is coming along nicely and I am pleased to present a number of screens from the game, called 'Encyclopaedia Galactica. The game will be avaialble for download plus there will be a limited number of magazine issues with a cover mounted tape of the title. There will also be a 'novella' story behind the game in the magazine. For now enjoy the screenshots and spread the word.

 

#3 Digital Version of Retro Fusion with embedded video and music

Retro Fusion will be released in digital form with embedded media. Each of those who pledge will be given the digital version. Click the image below and you will see a preview of the digital distribution of the magazine.

#2 New Fusion ZX Spectrum game being developed

Retro Fusion has been in touch with infamous ZX Spectrum developer Jonathan Cauldwell. JC is going to be producing us a unique Retro Fusion game with a SCI - FI theme to our liking in parallel with Spanner writing a background story to the game. This will make a facinating article and the game, once finished, will be on the front cover of Retro Fusion issue 3 in cassette form for you to play on your ZX Spectrum (there will be a digital version to download also to play on Emulators). For now take a look at one of Jonathan's previous games that appeared in Fusion 08 (an event held by the RF crew):

#1 Interview with Ste Pickford

The Pickford Brothers have had an illustrious career that has spanned decades. We here at Retro Fusion had the pleasure of talking to Ste Pickford this week about the obscure title they made for the SNES back in the early 1990's called Plok. Ever heard of this game? Seems like not many have - we have an article on the game coming in issue 3 and a nice long interview with Ste to discuss the merits of the title.

 

Short Summary

Retro Fusion as a magazine started back in 2005 as a token read to those who attended a retro event I held in central England in aid of the Everyman charity. Those who came to the gig, comprising of arcade cabinets, pinball tables and a plethora of retro consoles and computers, received a copy of the magazine as a thank you. Over a £1,000 was raised for charity.

The magazine covers the retro games and systems that you played with in your youth. We also venture into the films and TV programmes you watched in between gaming, the sweets you sucked whlist playing Jetpac and even the toys you played with whilst waiting for Uridium to load on your Commodore 64! All in full glorious colour spread across 68 pages.

Two further issues of the Retro Fusion magazine were produced and distributed in the Gamestation stores in the UK - this was 6 years ago.

I now have a desire to continue Retro Fusion and we are now looking to the community to help fund the print of the next issue of the magazine. 

What We Need!

Primarily the funds to print 500 issues of the next issue of the magazine.

A portion of the remaining fund will go to those who to date have largely written for the magazine for free - I feel it is would be great to give something back to those who have made the brand so special over the years.

Then there is the marketing - the remaining budget will go on making sure the largest possible audience is aware of the Retro Fusion magazine. 

The development of this issue of Retro Fusion is well underway and features the following within its pages and much more:

  • The Making of Z - Retro Fusion interviews Mike Montgomery
  • A day in the life of OCEAN - written by Ocean employee Mark Jones
  • A look back at the Red Dwarf series
  • Archer Maclean's Top 10 Favourite restored arcade cabinets
  • The Top 10 Science Fiction Games across all gaming platforms
  • Your favourite Top 10 Science Fiction Robots
  • Plok - A Pickford Brothers Classic

Previous issues of Retro Fusion have seen retro celebrities putting pen to paper and contributing  - this issue will be no different with Archer Maclean sharing pictures and thoughts on his favourite 10 arcade cabinets and Jeroen Tel telling us a little about SID music and what it still means to him.

Check out the front cover of the next issue of the Retro Fusion magazine:

 

What You Get - The Perks!

We have some wonderful perks that we can offer in exchange for your support of our magazine.

We will have a number of signed copies of Retro Fusion to give to those who pledge - the likes of Archer Maclean, The Oliver Brothers and Jon Hare will sign and personalise your copy of the magazine.

We have advertising space within the pages of the magazine including the inside cover, centre pages and inside back and back cover. Advertise your retro wares or up and coming retro project.

Or maybe you would like Editor signed copies of Issue 0, 1, 2 and 3 along with mugs, pens and T-shirts ablazoned with the Retro Fusion logo.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to see more issues of this great mag become a reality then please spread the word as widely as you can to all your friends and colleagues.

The more money we raise the better quality paper that can be used during the printing process.

If you use social networking sites and blogs please take every opportunity you can to mention our campaign as we really need as much support as possible! 

If you would like to contribute to future magazines then please get in touch with me at chris@retrofusion.org.uk

In the mean time please do check out the Retro Fusion website - www.retrofusion.org.uk.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read our proposal and we very much hope that you will support our retro magazine and keep gaming!
story_txt:
Updates
#5 Industry veteran Mark Jones who used to work at Ocean Software has now joined the writing team of the magazine. In this issue will be the first of a 2-part article on what life was really like at the head offices of Ocean back in the 80's and early 90's.

#4 TIGA is now fully supporting the production of Retro Fusion. Check out the press release here : http://www.tiga.org/news/press-releases/planned-videogame-publication-receives-tiga-backing
#3 As mentioned in an earlier blog, Jonathan Cauldwell is writing an exclusive ZX Spectrum game for Retro Fusion Issue 3. The game is coming along nicely and I am pleased to present a number of screens from the game, called 'Encyclopaedia Galactica. The game will be avaialble for download plus there will be a limited number of magazine issues with a cover mounted tape of the title. There will also be a 'novella' story behind the game in the magazine. For now enjoy the screenshots and spread the word.

 

#3 Digital Version of Retro Fusion with embedded video and music
Retro Fusion will be released in digital form with embedded media. Each of those who pledge will be given the digital version. Click the image below and you will see a preview of the digital distribution of the magazine.

#2 New Fusion ZX Spectrum game being developed
Retro Fusion has been in touch with infamous ZX Spectrum developer Jonathan Cauldwell. JC is going to be producing us a unique Retro Fusion game with a SCI - FI theme to our liking in parallel with Spanner writing a background story to the game. This will make a facinating article and the game, once finished, will be on the front cover of Retro Fusion issue 3 in cassette form for you to play on your ZX Spectrum (there will be a digital version to download also to play on Emulators). For now take a look at one of Jonathan's previous games that appeared in Fusion 08 (an event held by the RF crew):

#1 Interview with Ste Pickford
The Pickford Brothers have had an illustrious career that has spanned decades. We here at Retro Fusion had the pleasure of talking to Ste Pickford this week about the obscure title they made for the SNES back in the early 1990's called Plok. Ever heard of this game? Seems like not many have - we have an article on the game coming in issue 3 and a nice long interview with Ste to discuss the merits of the title.
 
Short Summary
Retro Fusion as a magazine started back in 2005 as a token read to those who attended a retro event I held in central England in aid of the Everyman charity. Those who came to the gig, comprising of arcade cabinets, pinball tables and a plethora of retro consoles and computers, received a copy of the magazine as a thank you. Over a £1,000 was raised for charity.

The magazine covers the retro games and systems that you played with in your youth. We also venture into the films and TV programmes you watched in between gaming, the sweets you sucked whlist playing Jetpac and even the toys you played with whilst waiting for Uridium to load on your Commodore 64! All in full glorious colour spread across 68 pages.
Two further issues of the Retro Fusion magazine were produced and distributed in the Gamestation stores in the UK - this was 6 years ago.
I now have a desire to continue Retro Fusion and we are now looking to the community to help fund the print of the next issue of the magazine. 


What We Need!
Primarily the funds to print 500 issues of the next issue of the magazine.
A portion of the remaining fund will go to those who to date have largely written for the magazine for free - I feel it is would be great to give something back to those who have made the brand so special over the years.
Then there is the marketing - the remaining budget will go on making sure the largest possible audience is aware of the Retro Fusion magazine. 
The development of this issue of Retro Fusion is well underway and features the following within its pages and much more:

The Making of Z - Retro Fusion interviews Mike Montgomery
A day in the life of OCEAN - written by Ocean employee Mark Jones
A look back at the Red Dwarf series
Archer Maclean's Top 10 Favourite restored arcade cabinets
The Top 10 Science Fiction Games across all gaming platforms
Your favourite Top 10 Science Fiction Robots
Plok - A Pickford Brothers Classic



Previous issues of Retro Fusion have seen retro celebrities putting pen to paper and contributing  - this issue will be no different with Archer Maclean sharing pictures and thoughts on his favourite 10 arcade cabinets and Jeroen Tel telling us a little about SID music and what it still means to him.
Check out the front cover of the next issue of the Retro Fusion magazine:

 
What You Get - The Perks!

We will have a number of signed copies of Retro Fusion to give to those who pledge - the likes of Archer Maclean, The Oliver Brothers and Jon Hare will sign and personalise your copy of the magazine.
We have advertising space within the pages of the magazine including the inside cover, centre pages and inside back and back cover. Advertise your retro wares or up and coming retro project.
Or maybe you would like Editor signed copies of Issue 0, 1, 2 and 3 along with mugs, pens and T-shirts ablazoned with the Retro Fusion logo.
Other Ways You Can Help


If you'd like to see more issues of this great mag become a reality then please spread the word as widely as you can to all your friends and colleagues.
The more money we raise the better quality paper that can be used during the printing process.
If you use social networking sites and blogs please take every opportunity you can to mention our campaign as we really need as much support as possible! 
If you would like to contribute to future magazines then please get in touch with me at chris@retrofusion.org.uk
In the mean time please do check out the Retro Fusion website - www.retrofusion.org.uk.
Thank you so much for taking the time to read our proposal and we very much hope that you will support our retro magazine and keep gaming!

story:
About the Game

 

 “100 years ago this very morning, as the dawn blazed across all the lands of Dashiri, a single child was born in the city of Ebon Dene. They say she had the sun in her hair and the sky in her eyes. No soul remembers who she was, but all remember what she was.

   “She was a 'Dene', one who could shape the lands and bend the very elements to her will. There were those of superstition who called it 'magic', but reason and hindsight offer a more accurate answer: as man came to dominate the natural world with the gift of reason, the Dene would one day come to dominate man.” - Peptus Clove, The Changing Times.

 

   Join Aria Leane, a gifted Dene who joined the oppressors of her people for the sake of a greater peace, in a journey across the known world, fighting to uncover her people's dark past and battling powerful forces who seek to control the future.

 

Features

 

  • Fight anywhere! Tactical grid generated over current landscape.
  • Classic JRPG style and gameplay.
  • Engaging and compelling storyline with identifiable characters.
  • See enemies and their threat zone, choose to engage or avoid.
  • Turn based, intuitive tactical combat system.
  • Striking 2D pixel art style.
  • Intricate and addictive character progression.
  • Crafting system where any piece of loot can be broken down to make power gems.
  • Power gems allow massive customisation variety to characters powers.
  • Future content download.
  • Available on PC.

 

 

Why Indie Go Go

 

   Fate of Ages began production a long time ago as a game for original Xbox. The game got to a certain point and just could not get sufficient funding from the big publishers at that time, who just weren’t interested in this kind of product.Years later, the market place has changed and indie go go is a place where ideas like this can become a reality. Also several years in the industry has taught us all to be better at what we do and how we do it, so we now feel we can bring you the best possible version of Fate of Ages.

 

Where funds go

 

   Fate of Ages production was restarted on the 28th of May 2011, and we have spent our time creating a core RPG engine and set of tools, as well designing our tactical combat system. We have also spent the time putting together a great story and great characters, as well as art concepts for characters and locations. As of this moment, we need funding to produce the final versions of assets and music. This will include

  • fully animated sprites for numerous families of monsters
  • a variety of main plot and side quest bosses
  • the complete artwork for five or more different environments and related towns that the player will visit over the course the adventure
  • a top quality musical score, over one hour in length, specially composed for Fate of Ages.

   If we fail to reach our funding goal, we still intend to see this project to completion, though the time scales may have to be reassessed. If we exceed our stated target, we will be able to consider a number of additional extras to the game, such as optional bosses, additional side quests and new options for character development. With enough money, we would ideally like to produce a version of the game on the Xbox 360.

 

About the QPB Studios

 

  • Dave – Game Director, 10 years' games industry experience.
  • Phil – Writer. Forging our world, with 5 years' development experience.
  • Justin – Level designer, famed blogger and game theorist.
  • Rob – AI programmer and server wizard, with 10 years' development experience.
  • Ivo – Environment artist and general aesthetic expert, with 11 years' experience in games, film and TV.
  • Charochai – Amazing 2D sprite artist, who has worked on a huge number of indie titles.
  • Ian A – Amazing professional composer with years of experience in film and television work.
  • Ian H – Professional graphic artist and Photoshop expert.
  • Amanda H – RPG expert and multi talented production coordinator.

story:
Crate 360 is a 3D puzzle game, initially built for the iOS market (iPhone/iPad), but also currently being developed for PC/Mac systems.

The entire game is split into over 220 levels. The aim of each level is to destroy the crates, whilst guiding the jewels to safety. Simply drag your finger (or mouse) across the scene to view the level from all angles, and click crates to destroy them.

Sounds easy, right? It is! Well, for the first few levels it is, then we make things a *tiny* bit complicated...

The main game is split into 15 chapters, where each chapter we bring in a new crate mechanic.

Each crate mechanics has a different reaction when you tap it. Wooden crates, which you'll see from the start, simply destroy themselves, whereas special mechanics such as arrow and magnet shoot across the screen, often making a mess!

When all these elements are combined, its up to you to find the safest way to complete the level. There are millions of ways to complete each level, but there are only a few perfect solutions.

 

Crate 360 has 3 game modes:

Arcade

The main game mode, currently contains 120 levels in 15 chapters.

The goal in this mode is to save as many jewels as possible. Each level will reward 1-3 stars at the end, depending on how many jewels you saved.

We're also in the process of making a further 30 bonus levels, which will be available to backers early, if they fund us $25 or more.

Classic

Based of our previous game, Crate Collapse. Contains 100 levels in 10 chapters, and uses a 2.5D gameplay style.

This mode doesn't have a 3 star system like arcade, so the goal is to complete the level, without destroying a single jewel!

Creative

Finally, we have creative mode, where you can create your own levels (on all gaming platforms), and download them online.

Levels you create and play in this mode follow the arcade style of gameplay, including the 3 star system & the 360° camera.

You'll be able to share you levels manually, by sending people a 6 letter code associated with your level, or though facebook, twitter, or the in-game level browser.

Crate 360 has most of the work done already. All of the mechanics have been coded, and all of the levels we've mentioned have already been made!

We've also done most of the heavy lifting for the level editor, as all of the levels we're created and uploaded to our server, so we could test them on the fly, instantly!

BUT, the game has a little way to go if we want it polished (which we really do!):

  • 15 dynamic backgrounds, one for each arcade chapter - We currently only have 2 backgrounds for that mode, which would get stale quickly. We really want to be able to create fully dynamic backgrounds, ones which react to what you press in the level.
  • Universial UI for each gaming platform - With the game being available on many platforms, making a user interface easy to use (especially in the level editor) will take a while!
  • Licensed sound and music - We've been developing all this time without music! We've been making humming sounds and bop noises every time we destroy a crate, but it isn't the same. We've already found some music that would be ideal, we just need it licensed!
  • And a few minor tweaks here and there.

This is where we need your help!

Our first hurdle is two professional software licenses - priced at $3250. 

Our game engine of choice is Unity 3D, which we have been using the 'lite' versions of for almost a year. While it works great, many of the advanced features of the professional licenses would speed up the games development significantly, which would allow us to release the game much sooner.

Our second goal is to upgrade our existing PC equipment, to handle the strain of game development (freezing and crashing slows us down lots!).

Upgrading our current PC fully to handle 3D, art & video software well would cost $885. This would make Thomas, the 3D artist, very happy!

We also need a mac system to port games to the iPhone & iPad. The one we have currently works, but its incredibly old, and has a 1 in 4 chance of turning on! Being able to replace this would cost $1590, and it'd be tremendous if we could.

A cheap android tablet would be the last piece of hardware we would acquire, as it would allow us to test & build our game on an android device. This would ensure we could port our game to the android market.

Our final goal is living working accommodation -  Stumpytree is only made up of two people, but the amount of time travelling back and forth to collaborate is huge! Our current working environments are also less than ideal.

Any money we get past $6000 would go into a few months accommodation, so we could create the ideal work environment and concentrate solely on Crate 360 development.

 
If you donate $1 or more, we'll send you a personal thank you email.
 
Donations over $10 will receive a full copy of the game on PC & iOS.
 
Donate $25 or more and receive first access to the bonus 30 arcade levels.
 
If you donate $50 or more, we'd greatly appreciate it! We'll post you a Crate 360 Photo card, signed by us both, with our thanks.
 
Donate over $100 or more, and you'll get the Stumpytree T-Shirt, as seen below!
 
 
If you donate over $500, we'd be immensely grateful! You'll be able to demand your own crate mechanic, that we would put in the game as soon as we can after release.
 

Finally...

 
If you don't have the means to fund this project, we completely understand!
 
You could still help by sharing this page through Facebook and/or Twitter. We would greatly appreciate every like & tweet we get!
 
You can find us on Facebook: Facebook.stumpytree.com
 
Or on twitter:
Sean Lloyd-Booth - @SeanLloydBooth 
Thomas Penny - @Thomas_Penny

story:
Welcome to the „The Great Chase“ indiegogo page. The Great Chase is an indie game , where you play one of the multiple characters  with their own unique abillity and race with the time to set the highscore. Greatly inspired by the old classic game called „Icy Tower“ , but with a different gameplay approach.

This is the first game developed by Wolt Studios. Our goal is to make a small indie game , which players will play on and on , trying different characters racing for the first place on the highscore list.

The Great Chase is currently being developed in Unity Engine (free licence) for PC Windows only , and first planned to be release on Steam as free to play game and later for Android,iOs , Max , Linux and Facebook. Currently we're in alpha stage of the game.

 

- Why Crowdfounding? We feel that crowdfounding is the best way to get close to the community interested in our game , and it will help us create the game as we'd like it to look like.

 

 

- Multiple Characters – In the game there will be more then 1 character , and each character has his own unique abillity that impacts the gameplay and unique soundtrack. For example , the first character you get in the game is Ninja , and he has a wall walking abillity.

- Randomly Generated level – The game is set on one level that is always randomly generated , so the players will never encounter the same platform positions thus making the game harder.

- The Store – Before you start the game you can visit the in-game store to grab some helpful items. For example you can buy rocket boots there , that would save you from falling down. You may only carry 2 items with you per game , so chose wisely. Also you buy your characters in the store , level/platform skins and so on...

- Challanging Gameplay -  From the moment you make your first jump in the game , the camera starts speeding up. At the first it’s slow , but as you go higher and higher it gets faster and faster. If you fail to be faster then the camera , the game is done and you have to start again.

- Multiple Game Modes – There wont be only 1 game mode in „The Great Chase“. The game will have multiple game modes. More info on this incoming in the future.

- Global highscore list – The game will have global highscore list , where players will be competing for the first place. At the end of each season (seasons will last about 2-3 months) the highscore list will be reset , and top 3 players will get their rewards.

- Achievements – There will be a list of achievements players can try to do. Some of them are going to be challanging , some of them just trivial. Some of the achievements will also reward something (e.g character obtainable only through achievement).

                                                                           The Level
 
Gameplay in the game is pretty simple and straightforward. First let’s talk
about levels. There’s only „1 level“ that is randomly generated when you enter the game , and it keeps generating as you go higher and higher. The level has no ending and the goal is to set good highscore. There are 3 types on platforms you can encounter , and they all have a certain chance of spawning.

1. Regular Platforms – Just regular platforms you stand on.
2. Fall-Down Platforms  - Stepping on one will trigger it to fall down after few seconds.
3. Bouncy Platform – Stepping on one will bounce you off in the air.

Also there are 2 types of collectables you can encounter atop of platforms :

1. Coins – Collecting the coins will bring you money and will impact your highscore.
2. Power-Up Orbs – Collecting the power-up orb will bring you one step forward to using the special abillity. Three Power-Up orbs are needed in order to use an abillity , and you may have only 3 at a time.

                                                                          Characters

Next let’s talk about characters and the movement. The movement in the game is pretty simple , you use A and D to move left or right (or arrow keys) , space button to jump and W (or clicking an icon) to trigger special abillity.The character can be moved while he’s in the air. There’s no bouncing off the wall like in traditional jumping games.  There are 3 factors that distinct characters from each other :

1. Movement Speed (the speed at which character moves left or right , impacts the speed in the air aswell).
2. Jump Power  (determines the jump height).
3. Character Abillity  (each character has own unique abillity).




                                                                           The store

Let’s talk about the store system now. Items bought in the store can change gameplay quite abit aswell. In the store you can buy items that are usable in the game , but you may only carry 2 at the time. For example in  the store you can buy rocket boots that will give you a lift up (the same height as bouncy platform) or Enchancing Boots that would increase your movement speed etc...

We will reveal more information about the store in the future , and the store will not make it in the first game demo.


 

We decided to start an indiegogo campaign for simple reasons. So far we haven't invested a dollar in the game , and we have been working on it for about 3 months now. We would like to raise some money to finish the game faster , and to make it look better. We can , and we will finish the game no matter what the results of the campaign are, but it will affect the game quality majorly. The more money we rise , the more things we will be able to implement in the game at the start , such as : Multiple game modes at the start , multiple backgrounds (there will be few of them at the start anyways) , 3d backgrounds , more characters and imporved quality of the game in general.

Second reason is keeping us close to the community. Everyone who joins and actually donates or shares this page is curious how the game is gonna end up , and usually these people will give the best feedback to help develop the game in the right way. So we want to keep these people close and gather their suggestions to make the final product look really good.

 

 

 

 

 

One of our major plans for the game is to keep it updated , giving players new content every few weeks. Our plan is to release a new character every 3-4 weeks , and a new content patch every 2 months , bringing players new game modes etc...

Our second major plan is to release the game for Android/iOS , Facebook and consoles. This would require a different approach then what we have now and some gameplay changes , and we need money for the technology needed to port the game (Unity Pro version).

Also , we plan to reward our best players at the end of each season. The reward could be anything , from in-game items to real money. We still have to consider what the rewards will be , but we will for sure have some. We will tend to keep community close to us , and to have players involved in development of the game as much as possible.

We would also like to expand our team with additional programmer and 3D modeler for the future , but we’re satisfied with our team as it’s now , and it’s unlikely we will see any changes.

 

 

 

We've been working really hard with the tools we have to get this game off of the ground, however we are now starting to reach the limits of what we're able to produce using our current equipment.

 

Below is a list of what we're going to be spending the money on:

  • Buying Unity Pro licence
  • Administrative costs
  • Servers for the game
  • Better equipment
  • Advertising

 

 


 

 

5E Tier - In this tier you get one big thanks for us , aswell as Donator title on our forums and your name in the credits.

15E Tier - In this tier you get everything above plus all the music used in "The Great Chase" in mp3 format.

30E Tier - In this tier you get everything above plus limited edition Space Marine character aviavable only for indiegogo beckers , and will not be obtainable on any other way.Here's the space marine model concept :

Note : this is only the model concept , and the final product will have changes.

45E Tier - In this tier you get everything above plus limited edition Background and Platform skin aviavable only to indiegogo beckers.

125E Tier - In this tier you get everything above plus a signed Wolt Studios T-shirt and invitation to game launch event. Game launch event will be held 6-8 hours before game launch and will last untill the game launch. During this time you will get chance to ask us whatever you want about the game , and we will reveal our other projects and what's incoming in the future. Also we will have all kind of giveaways during the event.Do not forget to leave your e-mail in order to recieve the event key.

220E Tier - In this tier you get everything above plus a chance to meet the Wolt Studios crew online. Meeting will be on skype with all the members online , and you can ask us anything you wanna know about the game or about us. We will also share some exclusive information with you , maybe?

350E Tier - In this tier you get everything above plus a chance to name something in the game. That could be anything from the store items,characters,backgrounds etc... The name mustn't containt inappropriate words.

550E Tier - In this tier you get everything above plus a chance to design a character with us. You get to design the looks , name the character  and design his unique ability , aslong as the character fits the game. The names mustn't contain inappropriate words. This perk requires that you collaborate with one of the game designers.

1000E Tier - In this tier you get everything above plus a chance to design a game mode with us. This perk requires that you collaborate with one of the game designers.

 

 

Project Leader/Programmer – Vukašin Vučenović aka Vulegend , 17 years old Programmer from Serbia. Currently attending Highschool of electrical engineering Zemun. He shares great passion towards games and gaming in general , and is a big fan of World of Warcraft (playing for more then 6 years). He founded Wolt Studios with a friend from World of Warcraft (which unfurotuantely left Wolt Studios).He is coding the game mechanics and overveiwing all other work done on the game.

Vice Leader/Programmer – Antreas Apostolou, born in Cyprus, 1987, spent his whole life playing and investigating how game works.During childhood he was always dreaming of creating his own game. Combine pieces together and give a life to scripts and models through gaming. But back then it was hard to learn how to do this on your own.In 2012 he thought to give it a try again, this time with much more information available, he succeeded to study and learn coding and basic modeling.In August 2012 he managed to meet Vukasin which helped him to develop his coding knowledge.The 2 of them started finding and recruiting members who could help in forming a complete Game Develop team. In 2013 our basic team have been formed and Wolt Studios was created. Now as a Vice-Leader, Antreas uses C# programming for game coding and keeps  track of game develop process and helps his colleagues to learn and develop their skills.

Music/SFX/Voice Acting - William is a 24 years old musician who is currently based in the UK who has a wide range of experience, both as a performer and composer. William is in charge of creating all music and sound effects used within Wolt Studios' titles.

3D Modeling/Character modeling - Belal Saeed,  born in Cairo, Egypt  1993, in the last year of Highschool, willing to study art afterwards. Since he was a kid he like drawing, and he has been into 3D stuff for 5 years now. He can describe himself as a 3D Generalist specializing in modeling, character design, digital sculpting, texturing, shading, lighting, rendering, compositing. He is also Lead 3D character designer in Wolt Studios.

3D Modeling/Scenery - Ilya Bakhtin , 27 years old 3D modeler from Russia. Ilya was amongst the first to join Wolt Studios and has been working hard since then. Ilya is in charge of scenery for the game , the platform design , 3d elements of the background etc…


2D Artist – Jack Tickle, 17 years old artist from Britain , currently attending Student at St. Helens Collage.. Jack is in charge of all the 2d work in the game , from Main Menu’s to the GUI and background.

Artwork – Luka Stanić , 17 years old artist from Serbia , attendintg highschool of electrical engineering Zemun and goes in the same class with Vukašin. He is drawing all the characters and scenery and passing them to our modelers.

Webpage Administration/Community Manager – Casper aka Ezz , 17 years old programmer from Sweden. Casper is currently studying Economy , but that hasn’t stopped him from being really good at programming. He has made alot of windows applications. He is in charge of webpage administration for the Wolt Studios , aswell as managing the community and making the game launchers.
story_txt:
Welcome to the „The Great Chase“ indiegogo page. The Great Chase is an indie game , where you play one of the multiple characters  with their own unique abillity and race with the time to set the highscore. Greatly inspired by the old classic game called „Icy Tower“ , but with a different gameplay approach.This is the first game developed by Wolt Studios. Our goal is to make a small indie game , which players will play on and on , trying different characters racing for the first place on the highscore list.
The Great Chase is currently being developed in Unity Engine (free licence) for PC Windows only , and first planned to be release on Steam as free to play game and later for Android,iOs , Max , Linux and Facebook. Currently we're in alpha stage of the game.
 
- Why Crowdfounding? We feel that crowdfounding is the best way to get close to the community interested in our game , and it will help us create the game as we'd like it to look like.
 
 


- Multiple Characters – In the game there will be more then 1 character , and each character has his own unique abillity that impacts the gameplay and unique soundtrack. For example , the first character you get in the game is Ninja , and he has a wall walking abillity. - Randomly Generated level – The game is set on one level that is always randomly generated , so the players will never encounter the same platform positions thus making the game harder.- The Store – Before you start the game you can visit the in-game store to grab some helpful items. For example you can buy rocket boots there , that would save you from falling down. You may only carry 2 items with you per game , so chose wisely. Also you buy your characters in the store , level/platform skins and so on...- Challanging Gameplay -  From the moment you make your first jump in the game , the camera starts speeding up. At the first it’s slow , but as you go higher and higher it gets faster and faster. If you fail to be faster then the camera , the game is done and you have to start again.- Multiple Game Modes – There wont be only 1 game mode in „The Great Chase“. The game will have multiple game modes. More info on this incoming in the future.- Global highscore list – The game will have global highscore list , where players will be competing for the first place. At the end of each season (seasons will last about 2-3 months) the highscore list will be reset , and top 3 players will get their rewards.
- Achievements – There will be a list of achievements players can try to do. Some of them are going to be challanging , some of them just trivial. Some of the achievements will also reward something (e.g character obtainable only through achievement).




                                                                           The Level

 
Gameplay in the game is pretty simple and straightforward. First let’s talk
about levels. There’s only „1 level“ that is randomly generated when you enter the game , and it keeps generating as you go higher and higher. The level has no ending and the goal is to set good highscore. There are 3 types on platforms you can encounter , and they all have a certain chance of spawning.  1. Regular Platforms – Just regular platforms you stand on. 2. Fall-Down Platforms  - Stepping on one will trigger it to fall down after few seconds. 3. Bouncy Platform – Stepping on one will bounce you off in the air. Also there are 2 types of collectables you can encounter atop of platforms : 1. Coins – Collecting the coins will bring you money and will impact your highscore. 2. Power-Up Orbs – Collecting the power-up orb will bring you one step forward to using the special abillity. Three Power-Up orbs are needed in order to use an abillity , and you may have only 3 at a time.                                                                          Characters Next let’s talk about characters and the movement. The movement in the game is pretty simple , you use A and D to move left or right (or arrow keys) , space button to jump and W (or clicking an icon) to trigger special abillity.The character can be moved while he’s in the air. There’s no bouncing off the wall like in traditional jumping games.  There are 3 factors that distinct characters from each other :  1. Movement Speed (the speed at which character moves left or right , impacts the speed in the air aswell).  2. Jump Power  (determines the jump height). 3. Character Abillity  (each character has own unique abillity).                                                                           The store Let’s talk about the store system now. Items bought in the store can change gameplay quite abit aswell. In the store you can buy items that are usable in the game , but you may only carry 2 at the time. For example in  the store you can buy rocket boots that will give you a lift up (the same height as bouncy platform) or Enchancing Boots that would increase your movement speed etc... We will reveal more information about the store in the future , and the store will not make it in the first game demo.

 
We decided to start an indiegogo campaign for simple reasons. So far we haven't invested a dollar in the game , and we have been working on it for about 3 months now. We would like to raise some money to finish the game faster , and to make it look better. We can , and we will finish the game no matter what the results of the campaign are, but it will affect the game quality majorly. The more money we rise , the more things we will be able to implement in the game at the start , such as : Multiple game modes at the start , multiple backgrounds (there will be few of them at the start anyways) , 3d backgrounds , more characters and imporved quality of the game in general.
Second reason is keeping us close to the community. Everyone who joins and actually donates or shares this page is curious how the game is gonna end up , and usually these people will give the best feedback to help develop the game in the right way. So we want to keep these people close and gather their suggestions to make the final product look really good.
 
 
 

 
 
One of our major plans for the game is to keep it updated , giving players new content every few weeks. Our plan is to release a new character every 3-4 weeks , and a new content patch every 2 months , bringing players new game modes etc...
Our second major plan is to release the game for Android/iOS , Facebook and consoles. This would require a different approach then what we have now and some gameplay changes , and we need money for the technology needed to port the game (Unity Pro version).
Also , we plan to reward our best players at the end of each season. The reward could be anything , from in-game items to real money. We still have to consider what the rewards will be , but we will for sure have some. We will tend to keep community close to us , and to have players involved in development of the game as much as possible.
We would also like to expand our team with additional programmer and 3D modeler for the future , but we’re satisfied with our team as it’s now , and it’s unlikely we will see any changes.
 
 
 
We've been working really hard with the tools we have to get this game off of the ground, however we are now starting to reach the limits of what we're able to produce using our current equipment.
 
Below is a list of what we're going to be spending the money on:

Buying Unity Pro licence 
Administrative costs 
Servers for the game 
Better equipment
Advertising

He is also Lead 3D character designer in Wolt Studios.

story:
Why am I making this game?

Hi my name is James Arndt. I'm a professional game developer based out of Ormond Beach, Florida. You can take a peek at some of my work, and a list of games I've worked on that shipped to market: http://www.jamesarndt3d.com/about/


I've come from a background of working on a couple of Need for Speed titles and along the way I developed a real affinity for car racing games. This current project of mine, Super Kart Racing, is a labor of love and one that I want to share with the world via their mobile devices and tablets. I am working with a small team of (3) under the name fatbox Software. This is our small development studio based in Central Florida.

I noticed that there was a serious lack of kart racing games to be found in the mobile markets, that focused on a more realistic simulation of racing go karts. Seeing this opening in the market, combined with a love for vehicle racing games, led me to start development on Super Kart Racing quite some time ago.

Screenshot of the game as of Feb. 2013:

 

What will gameplay be like?

There are currently (6) main track layouts, with a bonus track that is only unlocked once all prior tracks are completed. Each of the (6) track layouts will be run in reverse configurations as well, creating a total of (13) tracks for this game. The game will use an unlock system, in which initially all tracks but the first will be locked. As you progress, competing against (2) other AI opponents, and win races, you will unlock tracks progressively. Each new track will present new challenges in navigating the course. These will be present in the difficulty of a track's layout or the competitive paths the AI opponents will choose to race along.

I'm also implementing local multi-player via Bluetooth and/or Wifi using the Prime31 Bluetooth/WiFi Mulitplayer plugin for Unity. This will allow players who are near to each other to engage in races against one another. There will be a simple multi-player lobby in the game's menu, you will find any competitors in this lobby to race.

Follow links to Youtube real time footage:

Early Test Footage of Player and AI Behavior

Wide View of Level and Player AI Driving

Racing against AI

In Kart Camera against AI

Demo Track Flythrough

What does some of the early work look like?

I will be creating (5) variations of Player Karts to choose from, each with their own distinct markings and paint. The AI opponents will consist of (3) variations of design and paint color. There will be (15) choices of unique decals/ numbering/lettering for each kart selection. 


This is a peek at the current Player Kart driver (without markings or design):


I've also started development on a fully driveable demo track to demo the game to the public. I am demoing the game via  web streaming using Unity Game Engine's Web Player tech (simple, light browser plugin). I am also using updates to the online web streaming build to gain valuable feedback from users in forums and on official pages. I gain knowledge of bugs that become apparent, features players would like to see implemented, feedback on the vehicle handling and feedback on game design elements. I think this is a valuable step in the development to ensure a high level of quality is reach for the end product.

There is an ongoing QA list of features to work on or improve based on community feedback. I've publicized this list directly on the Super Kart Racing web page so that others can see what is being worked on and make new suggestions for improvement. Please visit the page and view the list:

Visit the Super Kart Racing Official Website


Here is screengrab of the current demo level that is playable via the web:

Give the Early Build Demo a Try:

If you do have the Unity Web Player plugin installed you can follow this link to an immediately playable demo that plays via web streaming. This demo contains all of the functional controls for iOS and Android in the HUD, but utilizes the keyboard controls for PC/Mac testing. This is a great opportunity for anyone and everyone to provide feedback via comments, towards improving Super Kart Racing's development.

Super Kart Racing (Early Test Build)

What We Need & What You Get

Special Note for perks:

In game advertising, and in-game characters will be placed on a first come, first serve basis. The early contributors (in order) will get first choice of placement in the game environments. There is ample space in every environment for high visibility.

This game will be distributed to iOS devices via Apple's App store, to Android devices via Google Play and to certain backers as a stand alone PC version via direct download.

 Specific Minimum Device Support:

Android OS 2.0 or later
Device powered by an ARMv7 (Cortex family) CPU

iOS 4.3 or later
ARMv7 (Cortex family) CPU
iPhone 3GS and newer


The funds generated via this campaign will allow me to complete this game with an expected release in July 2013. This will allow me to realize this game to it's full potential, as it's always been pushed aside for paying work. This is a Unity Game Engine based project. Funds will be used to acquire an upgrade license to Unity 4.0, to take advantage of new optimizations and bug fixes within the Unity editor environment itself. Important licensing fees will need to be paid as well. I will need to renew my iOS Developer License this February as well as purchase the Android Developer License. Funds will also be used to acquire needed prop or environment models for future artwork needs. I will need assistance in general prop modeling, some of the reverse track configs will require movement of barricades, signage, etc.

I will also use funds for Sumner McCarty's time (assisting programmer/former Firebrand co-worker) to look over my scripts, clean up my code, offer more efficient code structure, etc. He’ll be more in a consultant capacity and will be paid an hourly consulting fee. I will also use funds to purchase required audio assets from online sources. We will also need to purchase at least one Android handset device for testing. All initial testing for Android will be done via emulation. Lastly funds are needed to acquire the Prime31 plugins for implementing wifi/bluetooth multiplayer into the game. After development needs are met, this funding will allow me to sustain myself during development on Super Kart Racing.

 As with any game development it's important to know the strengths and risks up front. Currently the game is about 25% feature complete.I feel the biggest hurdle to completion might be solving difficult bugs. My strengths as an environment, prop and vehicle artist will allow me to produce the game's needed artwork relatively smoothly. QA and solving hard to find bugs seem to be the largest time killer. I intend to help mitigate this by using frequent TestFlight builds to approved testers, usage of the Unity forums and Unity Answers forums, utilizing an already existing network of professional developer friends, and by my own knowledge of QA and debugging racing games. A good example: While working on Need for Speed Undercover I averaged the closing out of 35-50 bugs each day, for a period of several weeks. 

All programming will be completed in-house, so there will be no issues with outsourced scripting. I am a capable programmer, that can handle most challenges, issues or logic that is required. If I do hit a hurdle, I immediately reach out to programming professionals I am connected to through prior working relationships. I do not anticipate complications with builds or testing to the devices as iOS testing has gone smoothly so far. I have credentials and certificates installed on both an iPad2 and iPhone 3GS, as well as access to an iPhone 4S for testing. Android testing will be done first via emulation in the development environment and then on actual purchased Android hardware. I have successfully submitted and was approved to Apple's app store before (Tablet Match game), so I am familiar with their processing/approval time and technical rules for submission.

The current lack of funding poses the biggest risk to the completion of this project, but hopefully we can solve that as a team! The great part of Indiegogo is the fact that it uses flexible funding, meaning development can still be funded even if we don't entirely hit the goal amount.

The Impact

This campaign will allow me to bring a great kart racing experience to the mass audiences of mobile platforms. It will allow friends to compete against each other and hopefully bring back some of those go karting memories from childhood. The game will also be very reachable to a wide spectrum of consumers, with a price point of $2.00 for a download from Apple's App Store and the Android Marketplace. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, but would like to help promote this game, you can easily use the share tools right here on IndieGoGo to share this project on the various social networks. Help me spread the word on Twitter, Facebook and any other avenue you might think is helpful. Independent developers such as myself need all of the help they can get to get the word out!

Important licensing fees will need to be paid as well. I will need to renew my iOS Developer License this February as well as purchase the Android Developer License. Funds will also be used to acquire needed prop or environment models for future artwork needs. I will need assistance in general prop modeling, some of the reverse track configs will require movement of barricades, signage, etc.I will also use funds for Sumner McCarty's time (assisting programmer/former Firebrand co-worker) to look over my scripts, clean up my code, offer more efficient code structure, etc. He’ll be more in a consultant capacity and will be paid an hourly consulting fee. I will also use funds to purchase required audio assets from online sources. We will also need to purchase at least one Android handset device for testing. All initial testing for Android will be done via emulation. Lastly funds are needed to acquire the Prime31 plugins for implementing wifi/bluetooth multiplayer into the game. After development needs are met, this funding will allow me to sustain myself during development on Super Kart Racing.
 As with any game development it's important to know the strengths and risks up front. Currently the game is about 25% feature complete.I feel the biggest hurdle to completion might be solving difficult bugs. My strengths as an environment, prop and vehicle artist will allow me to produce the game's needed artwork relatively smoothly. QA and solving hard to find bugs seem to be the largest time killer. I intend to help mitigate this by using frequent TestFlight builds to approved testers, usage of the Unity forums and Unity Answers forums, utilizing an already existing network of professional developer friends, and by my own knowledge of QA and debugging racing games. A good example: While working on Need for Speed Undercover I averaged the closing out of 35-50 bugs each day, for a period of several weeks. 
All programming will be completed in-house, so there will be no issues with outsourced scripting. I am a capable programmer, that can handle most challenges, issues or logic that is required. If I do hit a hurdle, I immediately reach out to programming professionals I am connected to through prior working relationships. I do not anticipate complications with builds or testing to the devices as iOS testing has gone smoothly so far. I have credentials and certificates installed on both an iPad2 and iPhone 3GS, as well as access to an iPhone 4S for testing. Android testing will be done first via emulation in the development environment and then on actual purchased Android hardware. I have successfully submitted and was approved to Apple's app store before (Tablet Match game), so I am familiar with their processing/approval time and technical rules for submission.
The current lack of funding poses the biggest risk to the completion of this project, but hopefully we can solve that as a team! The great part of Indiegogo is the fact that it uses flexible funding, meaning development can still be funded even if we don't entirely hit the goal amount.
The Impact

This campaign will allow me to bring a great kart racing experience to the mass audiences of mobile platforms. It will allow friends to compete against each other and hopefully bring back some of those go karting memories from childhood. The game will also be very reachable to a wide spectrum of consumers, with a price point of $2.00 for a download from Apple's App Store and the Android Marketplace. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially, but would like to help promote this game, you can easily use the share tools right here on IndieGoGo to share this project on the various social networks. Help me spread the word on Twitter, Facebook and any other avenue you might think is helpful. Independent developers such as myself need all of the help they can get to get the word out!

story:
About us

Virgil Games is a spanish brand dedicated to the design and production of fantasy miniatures. We love collecting miniatures, painting and playing all kinds of games. These are the first models that we produce, but we would create many more in the future as long as you like them and help us to finance this project.

Fortunately, we have the support of RN Estudio. Surely you know them for their amazing miniatures, painted in a mind-blowing way. They have painted the gorgeous miniatures you can see in the gallery and will continue doing their magic with the rest of the team. Thank you very much guys!


Why Crowdfunding?

Although we have been dedicated to the hobby for a long time, this is our first serious project. We want to create a team of dwarves to play medieval fantasy football. But not a regular team, a team that sends a clear message to your opponent: You wanna play rough? We'll play rough! We're talking about a group of heavy, hard-to-crack and grumpy mother****ers. We’re talking about tons of metal, runes and beards. And, of course, a collection of exquisite miniatures that offers a unique painting experience.

But as you know, a project like this is not cheap. Design and produce miniatures is something that requires a lot of effort and an amount of money that we don’t have. But thanks to crowdfunding, we hope to find enough dwarf coaches to support this project and allow us to make it happen.


The team

What do these dwarfs looks like? As you can see in the picture, the team is formed by 13 different miniatures. Six blockers, two blitzers, two berserkers, two runners and a dwarf deathroller. All models are made of metal and include round bases. 

And check out this mind-blowing Deathroller:

In addition, every contribution level will receive a free dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. This way you can feel all his ancestral power in your games.


How can you please the dwarf ancestors?

You can support the project by purchasing any of the following levels of donation. Each level includes a unique reward.

Level 1

You will receive 1 dwarf of your choice. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 2

You will receive 1 dwarf deathroller. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 3

You will receive 4 dwarves of your choice. You can repeat miniatures or choose different models. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 4

You will receive the 6 dwarf blockers, one of each model. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.


Level 5 (Only 30)

You will receive 6 dwarf blockers + 2 dwarf blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 dwarf runners, one of each model. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 6

You will receive 6 dwarf blockers + 2 dwarf blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 dwarf runners, one of each model. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 7 (Only 30) - SOLD OUT

You will receive 6 dwarf blockers + 2 dwarf blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 dwarf runners + 1 dwarf deathroller, one of each model. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 8

You will receive 6 dwarf blockers + 2 dwarf blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 dwarf runners + 1 dwarf deathroller, one of each model. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 9 (Only 30)

You will receive 2 dwarf blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 dwarf runners + 1 dwarf deathroller, one of each model, and 10 dwarf blockers, 6 of each model and 4 of your choice. You can repeat miniatures in any combination. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 10

You will receive 2 dwarf blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 dwarf runners + 1 dwarf deathroller, one of each model, and 10 dwarf blockers, 6 of each model and 4 of your choice. You can repeat miniatures in any combination. In addition you will receive a dwarf ball and a dwarf turn counter. Free shipment included.

Level 11

You will receive 5 complete teams of 13 players. Each team includes 6 dwarf blockers + 2 dwarf blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 dwarf runners + 1 dwarf deathroller, one of each model. In addition you will receive five dwarf balls and 5 dwarf turn counters. Free shipment included.

Level 12 (Only 1)

You will receive the painted team used for the box art in this project. This team includes 6 blockers + 2 blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 runners + 1 deathroller, one of each model. All of them painted to the highest level by RN Estudio, a professional miniature painter. In addition you will receive 1 unpainted dwarf team composed by 10 blockers + 2 blitzers + 2 berserkers + 2 runners + 1 Deathroller. And that's not all! This level also includes 2 Dwarf balls + 6 dwarf counters. And, of course, free shipment included.

Check out some awesome work of RN Estudio here.

Dwarf field

You will receive a high-quality printed dwarf field. The field measurements are 80x70cms  canvas (32x28 inches aprox.) and has all the necessary elements printed on it: sidelines, scoring, pass boards, etc..


STRETCH GOALS

If we reach our initial goal of 3,500€, there will be unlocked new levels for everyone (not only bakers).

4.000€ - UNLOCKED

If we raise 4.000€ the first reward will be a reroll counter and counters of prone and stunned to the deathroller. You can choose any combination of 3 counters. If you are already a baker in this campaign the price for the three counters is € 5. Otherwise the price is 7 €, including shipping.

(Note: You can also choose Dwarf Turn counters instead of Reroll, Prone or Stunned)

4.500€ - UNLOCKED

If we raise 4.500€ the reward will be a berserker star player. The price is 7€, including shipping, a dwarf ball and a dwarf counter.

5.000€ - UNLOCKED

If we raise 5.000€ the reward will be a star player with chainsaw. The price is 7 €, including shipping, a dwarf ball and a dwarf counter.

5.500€ - UNLOCKED

If we raise 5.500€ the reward will be a set of 3 dwarf dice. The price is 7 €, including shipping, a dwarf ball and a dwarf counter.

6.000€ - UNLOCKED

If we raise 6.000€ the reward will be a bomber star player. The price is 7 €, including shipping, a dwarf ball and a dwarf counter.

6.500€

If we raise 6.500€ the reward will be a DwarfWeiser Girl. The price is 7 €, including shipping, a dwarf ball and a dwarf counter.

7.000€

If we raise 7.000€ the reward will be a coach for the team. The price is 7 €, including shipping, a dwarf ball and a dwarf counter.

7.500€

If we raise the amazing amount of 7.500€ the reward will be an apothecary coach for the team. The price is 7 €, including shipping, a dwarf ball and a dwarf counter.

story:
About US

Quidditch is gradually becoming a more recognized sport, it is no longer a magical scene found in The Harry Potter books anymore, with more than 300 colleges, and multiple community teams this magical sport is jumping right off the page in such a short time.

Quidditch is a co-ed sport that involves running, jumping, scoring, tackling and flying! Well not entirely flying, we do however have to stay on our brooms at all time to have the appearance that we are 'flying'. It is a full contact sport, but no one's died in years. Someone will vanish occasionally, but they'll turn up in a month or two!

The Scots themselves have a bit of a record themselves! They were only 5 teams away from making it to the world cup and going to Florida! There are also many unofficial wins on our side as well. 


What We Need & What You Get

Our team hasn't done much traveling due to cost, which is really bring down the numbers, because who wants to play a sport that can't travel anywhere? We are hoping with your donations, fundraising and other means we will be able start attending games in our region!

We have a few things to give you for your helpful donation. Each donation will get a thank you card signed by all of the Scots, personally thanking you, and depending on what perk you select you will get another prize from the Scots!

The Impact

Helping us might not cause Quidditch to jump into the big leagues and become a professional sport but it will help a bunch of college students with a passion for it and the drive to push and help this sport grow and become better known!

story:
4th Annual NES Marathon Benefiting Children's Miracle Network Hospitals

Pat and Ian are back for another 24+ hours of LIVE classic Nintendo gaming as they raise money for Children's Miracle Network during their 30th Anniversary! Watch them LIVE during the event as they play from a library of over 750 8-bit NES titles, interact with viewers, give away prizes, and host special guest cameos of other internet personalities who "stop by" via video. This year there will be certain scheduled events to help worldwide viewers and those with busy schedules plan ahead and not miss the fun. This page will be updated with those events as well as the giveaways as they are announced!

The live event begins Saturday, Oct. 19th at 3PM EST / 12PM PST! Tune in and watch the fun at NESmarathon.com!


Giveaways

Donating and Shaping the NES Marathon

All proceeds will go to the Children's Miracle Network, an organization that provides money to children's hospitals in need: 

Children's Miracle Network Hospitals is celebrating its 30-year anniversary! Since 1983, the organization has raised more than $4.7 billion—most of it $1 at a time—for 170 children’s hospitals across the United States and Canada, which, in turn, use the money where it’s needed the most. These donations have gone to support research and training, purchase equipment, and pay for uncompensated care, all in support of the mission to save and improve the lives of as many children as possible.

Any donation amount is greatly appreciated! As a thank you to donors at the $25 and above level, they will be able to help choose what games Pat and Ian play! Donors who select those perks have the option of making the donation in the name of any NES title released during the system's original run (via Indiegogo's comment system). The more money raised in the name of any individual game, the more time will be allotted for Pat and Ian to play it! The NES marathon really relies on the input of the viewers so help out a great cause and help make the event what you want to watch! Another bonus in donating: since this is a charitable organization, your contribution will be 100% tax deductible!

Note: All game-playing and time lengths are up to the discretion of Ian/Pat. Game-play lengths may not be exact and may be cut for time due to amount of games selected.

So that's what's going on! During the event, we'll have fun, prizes, and some surprises in store. This page will be updated in the near future with more perks and specific stretch goals that you can look forward to. 

Sponsorship Opportunities

Another way in which The Annual NES Marathon is able to raise money is by offering visibility and advertising to websites, organizations, businesses, and individuals who wish to make a larger donation and help sponsor the event. In return for these generous donations the donor will receive exposure in the form of banners on the marathon's main page, radio style read-out ads, commercial spots during regular break times, and at the highest levels call-ins and dedicated hour blocks. Tens of thousands of viewers watched the 3rd Annual event last year... here's your chance for your website/business to gain some great exposure while helping out a great cause with a 100% tax-deductible donation! Please check out the available package perks.

Spreading the Word

The NES Marathon's success is based largely upon others spreading the word via Twitter, Facebook, etc. Indiegogo.com can actually track how many donation referrals come in through your retweeting, posting the link, etc. To show our appreciation, we will reward the person responsible with the most donation referrals with a prize! We'll announce what this is later.

Thank You!

The NES Marathon has raised nearly $40,000 for hospitalized children in its first three years and we hope to continue strongly this year and into the future. Thanks to everyone for taking the time to read this page and all past/present donors and sponsors. Please help spread the word spread the word about this event on social media, twitter, etc. to help get the event more exposure and donations! We can't wait for October 19th!
