Is it going to be finished?
I understand your concerns. I am professional developer for 9 years in commercial sphere (Energy & Utilities), but I have been doing such side activities as learning different game engines, 3D modelling etc. for even longer time. This project has been born in October 2014 and should become my first contribution to gaming world. I have invested over 500EUR by myself so far (licences, gfx and sound assets) and I am planning to invest 2000EUR or more, depending on my work earnings and savings.I will finish this project no matter what, but without funding it will take a lot more time and some aspects of the game won't be as rich as I imagine that it can be.

story:
If You Build It They Will Come...

In 2001 we had a vision of creating a dual purpose, interactive/virtual reality gaming center, which would bring together the greatest and innovative gaming technology under one roof.    

Although we had a clear vision of what we wanted to create, in 2001 some of the technology was still in it's infancy (such as virtual reality technology) - however, now we feel that the technology has progressed to a stage that our campaign would make a unique and enjoyable environment, which would benefit the local community, as well as the gaming community.

The vision that we have, is to build a very limited number of gaming centers throughout the world, which will include technology such as:

Gaming PC's (e.g. Chillblast/YoYoTech)

Gaming Console's (e.g. Xbox/Playstation)

Virtual Reality Zone (e.g Omni Virtuix/CXC Motion Pro/Igloo 360 projection pods)

However, we do not want to create just another ordinary gaming center.  In addition to creating a unique gaming environment, we also aim to team up with local universities who offer gaming software development courses, to give them the opportunity to share the gaming center.  We will also create a think tank network and education facility, where gamer's can work together on creating new projects, whether it be new games or new gaming technology, so that their ideas and input can be shared with the gaming industry.  

What We Need & What You Get

We want to keep it nice and simple at this stage, so  initially we will only be asking for feedback on whether gamer's would like this type of facility to be built.  It's important that we get the project right, so if the demand is not there, we simply will not go to the next phase which would be to ask for funding.

However, if other gamer's feel as excited as we do and want to be a part of making gaming history, we are hoping to generate sufficient interest so that we can officially start initiating phase one of the campaign.

We are seeking moral and social support from gamer's, plus we would also love to receive feedback on what you would love to see in our gaming center's.

All ideas and suggestions can then be reviewed, and the best suggestions can then be incorporated into our initial business plan to be combined with our own thoughts and ideas.

Risks & Challenges

Times are hard and gaming is considered as a luxury item rather than a necessity. We realize that the revenue that will need to be generated to produce the type of gaming environment will cost £5 million per center - which is why we are seeking feedback and support from gamer's first, to ensure that the demand for such a facility is there.

We have already made preliminary inquiries regarding suitable premises and we have also compiled a short list of companies, whose technology we feel is the best available in the world and who are continuously seeking to improve the gaming experience.

Our first meeting to discuss the project and to start drawing up the business plan took place on 28th August 2014, however, we will want to incorporate the best ideas and suggestions that the gaming community has put forward to make this project truly unique.

What Can You Do To Help?

We would love to hear from you and get feedback and ideas.  What type of technology would you like to see in our center's?  Are you an X-Box fan or Playstation fan?  What are your favorite console and PC games?  Have you got ideas for new games or future gaming technology?  Have you got any suggestions for where our center's should be situated?

If you cannot spare a dollar, please help spread the word about our campaign.  

Your support is priceless.  Please share with your local gaming community, the more people that get involved and offer feedback and suggestions, the more unique this venture will become.  

We know that there are already other successful gaming centers that have already been built - but none have been created as a global gaming collaboration - hence our company name.  

If you would like to help be part of making gaming history, please get in touch via our Facebook page or follow us on Twitter.

story:
Hi everybody and welcome to the webpage of my campaign!

My name is Emil, I’m 30. I’m living and working in Hungary in Budapest. I have been fond of video games as long as I remember myself. The story started in the beginning of nineties when my parents gave me for the birthday present a game console Nintendo Intertaiment Systems (NES). Naturally even prior to that I had some experience in gaming world, playing on Atari computers famous hits such as Pitfall, Preliminary Monty, River Raid and etc. But getting to know NES has simply turned my vision of games upside down. I got so excited about gaming that until today I have bought practically any released device on which one can play anything. However it was never sufficient for me just to play as I always wanted to contribute something to the gaming industry. I dreamt about creating a gaming development company of my own. Today my dream has turned into an aim and that is why I’m here.



The game By the Rules will tell you a short story about a young guy which just have received his driving license and is now going to have a fun ride on the streets of different cities. It will be a so-called casual game, where a player needs to distribute approriate road signs on the way to help the caracter get to the point. Initially the game will be developed for mobile devices running iOS. However later on, in case the project becomes successful, the game will also be exported to devices running Android as well.

This idea came to my mind completely spontaneously, when I told off one of my colleagues for playing games on his mobile device instead of preparing for the road code exam which he was scheduled to take shortly. That’s when I thought, why actually not to help people combining a pleasure from playing game with an opportunity to learn about road signs easily? Naturally, the video game will not substitute for professional driving lessons, but you will probably agree, that the child who learnt how to read before the school, will definitely feel himself more comfortable in the class. In this case the result will be very similar.

Creation of this game will be a very special moment of my life, by launching this game and by putting my utmost effort to make it popular, will enable me take pride in providing people with meaningful entertainment. 



I have created everything what you can see in my campaign presentation by myself, but unfortunately my knowledge isn’t sufficient to create this game completely on my own, while also I would not like to seek assistance from people whose knowledge is doubtable. That’s why I have found a team of professional developers and have already discussed with them all conditions of the project and related costs.

Below you can see the list of items on which the money will be spent:

  • Total game development: Graphics, animation, sounds, music etc. – 34000$
  • Marketing campaign – 11000$
  • Professional Website – 5000$
  • Logo design – 2000$
  • IndieGoGo and Payment Processing fees – 4000$ 

In my company I have chosen a flexible way of financing, which means that even if I will fail to collect required amount with the current business plan, I will still be able to launch the project on a lower budget by hiring less renowned developers.

By helping me to realize this project you are contributing to the development of my company, but also to an educational benefit and fun of a very large audience.



This is my first project, but I truly hope that not the last one. In case of commercial success, names of people which helped me in the beginning will forever remain an integral part of the brand By the Rules. I will be extremely grateful to anyone contributing to the development of this project and will reward you with different presents, a list of which you can check below.

Hi
everybody and welcome to the webpage of my campaign!My
name is Emil, I’m 30. I’m living and working in Hungary in Budapest. I have
been fond of video games as long as I remember myself. The story started in the
beginning of nineties when my parents gave me for the birthday present a game
console Nintendo Intertaiment Systems (NES). Naturally even
prior to that I had some experience in gaming world, playing on Atari computers
famous hits such as Pitfall, Preliminary Monty, River Raid and
etc. But getting to know NES has simply turned my vision of games upside down.
I got so excited about gaming that until today I have bought practically any
released device on which one can play anything. However it was never sufficient
for me just to play as I always wanted to contribute something to the gaming
industry. I dreamt about creating a gaming development company of my own. Today
my dream has turned into an aim and that is why I’m here.

The
game By the Rules will tell you a short story about a young guy which just have
received his driving license and is now going to have a fun ride on the streets
of different cities. It will be a so-called casual game, where a player needs
to distribute approriate road signs on the way to help the caracter get to the
point. Initially the game will be developed for mobile devices running iOS.
However later on, in case the project becomes successful, the game will also be
exported to devices running Android as well.

story:
Welcome to the crowd funding effort for P-122-A "Mechanized pizza delivery", a fast platform game by Tembo Tambiko; an indie game developer with an international staff, based on the island of Tenerife in Spain.

The aim of this campaign is to speed up the development by hiring some more personal, thus allowing us to deliver much more content in the same planned time frame.

With your help we'll be in condition of delivering a wider choice of characters, stages and extras features, giving you much more to play with, in the end.

The game will be released for Pc/Mac, IOs and Android systems, a Linux version is being taken in consideration.


"P-122-A" is a fast, free roaming, platformer where you ride a mech.

You play as one of a huge cast of characters, delivering pizzas along the levels of a futuristic city, riding a contraption that looks like an hybrid between a scooter bike and a anime mech.

Rush and jump through the stage against the clock, in the constant brink of making a mistake and loose the all important time score. It's all about taking risks in exchange of the potential reward of a better time and, consequently, bigger money reward at the end.

You have a 10 pizzas to deliver in a set time. Each level contain 30 clients, divided in three categories. Each category earn you more money than the precedent but is harder to reach. You score a combo point for each client of the same level or superior you serve consecutively. If you serve a lower level client you loose your combo bonus. This bonus add a multiplier to your score at the end of the run and, more important, to the total money you earn between each play. The money serves to buy new and more competitive mechs, outfits and stages.



We are a fully funded game company, made up by four persons coming from other jobs in the industry and with some stable freelances contributors. The game will be finished with full features, the only problem is the time frame; the amount of details we are putting into the game and the quantity of meta-game material we want to add is bogging development times down. We don't want, if at all possible, compromise on quality. We are committed to deliver an high standard product. That's why we need your help to hire some extra hands to help us materialize all the great ideas we have in mind.

We decided to do flexible funding because the whole project is already funded, every little sum you can bring to the table will be immensely useful as banks in Spain had stopped giving credits. The complete financial weight of the business is, at the moment, sustained with personal funds of the company owners.


  • Extremely simple control scheme; two directions and a jump button and still a lot of techniques to master.

  • Nice hand drawn graphics.

  • Fast and furious, original surf and garage music soundtrack featuring a full band.

  • Challenge your friends online (sending them the ghost of your best runs)

  • Compete against the downloaded ghosts of the top ranking players worldwide or simply against your friends.

  • The Ghost has a will of his own!

  • Unlock dozens of hidden skins for your favourite mech.

  • Unlock the complete cast of mech and their colourful pilots.

  • Unlock dozens of stages and bonus stages.

  • Huge free training facility online, where to practice all the special manoeuvres you'll need in game (already in our website: tembotambiko.com).

Tier 1: Special Thanks

  • Your name will be listed in the game page of our website and kept there as long as we exist.

If you provide us with an e-mail address we will keep you up to date with all the updates and news regarding the game.

Tier 2: Standard Edition

  • We will send you a digital copy of the game or steam key if we manage to be distributed by Steam. 
  • You will receive an exclusive Backer wallpaper (it comes in different sizes to better fit your screen).
  • Your name will be shown with the "Backer" title in Contributor credits inside the game.

Tier 3: Soundtrack Edition

  • You will receive all the material from  the previous tiers.
  • We will send you a digital copy of the game spectacular garage/surf soundtrack.
  • Digital cover art of the full album.
  • Digital cover art of the two 7 inches discs that compose the full soundtrack album.

Tier 4: Art Edition

  • All the materials from the previous tiers.
  • A digital art book in .pdf format featuring the best illustrations from the game and the related promotional material.
  • A special wallpaper pack for the art lovers.

Tier 5: Red Spirit Edition

  • All the materials from the previous tiers.
  • A special "Red Spirit" skin for the base mech, for the collectors, never to be released again after this campaign. 

Note: The Red Spirit is a special skin for the mech, it doesn't give any special stat.

Tier 6: Green Spirit Edition

  • All the material from the previous tiers.
  • A special "Green Spirit" mech, for the nature lovers, never to be release again after this campaign.
  • Your name will be shown with the "Supporter" title in Contributor credits inside the game.

Note: The Green Spirit is a completely unique mech, with superior stats.

Tier 7: Silver Spirit Edition

  • All the materials from the previous tiers.
  • A very special "Silver Spirit" mech, for the fashion conscious, never to be released again after this campaign
  • A physical copy of the art book signed by the artist.
  • An exclusive T-Shirt with the company logo and game logo (comes in three sizes S, M, L, specify yours in your order)

Note: The Silver Spirit is a completely unique mech, with superior stats.

Note: For international orders add 8€ for postal fees. (Sorry about this but we are living in an island in the middle of the Atlantic).

Tier 8: Exclusive V.I.P. Edition

  • All the materials from the previous tiers.
  • A very special "Golden Spirit" mech, for the elite, never to be released again after this campaign.
  • Your name will be shown with the "VIP" title in Contributor credits inside the game.

Note: The Golden Spirit is a completely unique mech, with superior stats and a few extra perks.

Note: For international orders add 8€ for postal fees. (Sorry about this but we are living in an island in the middle of the Atlantic).

Tier 9: Personalized V.I.P. Edition

  • Exactly like Tier 8 but the pilot will look like you!

Note: We will need a picture or a description of the person you want us to base the pilot on. A description of the style or special traits could help us flesh out your special character.

story:
Who What & Why

Truth Arcade is a husband and wife team (Chantal and David Watson) dedicated to making a high quality Christian game for mature gamers.  The game will be called “Key of David”.

Why make a Christian game for so much and why make it "mature"?  

The video game industry is bigger now than the movie industry.  We believe there's a market for a game that brings the depth of the Christian message to the video game medium.  It should do so artfully, with a compelling story and with a production quality that the gamers of today expect when they spend up to $60 for a new game release.

It should be mature because the message and story of the bible is mature.

What We Need & What You Get

Like any crowdfunding campaign, the project needs funds and as a backer, you get perks.

High quality video games are expensive.  At this stage we are very much “indie”.  However, our ambitions for the game are much higher.  Whether this campaign is a little or a lot successful, it’s part of making our vision for the game a reality.  Even one backer is a success.

We’ve structured our perks all around the video game Key of David.  Our perks range from our minimum $1 support level where we acknowledge your awesomeness with many thanks, to our $60 “get everything” perk where you get a PC version of the game, a console version of your choice as well as access to the early prototype(s), beta test version(s), and the early release.

We made $60 the maximum perk level price because we figured that’s how much a brand new game costs nowadays.  If you want to contribute more than that, the $60 Level 7 perk (and only Level 7) allows you to purchase extra copies (your choice which version) as an add-on perk for $25 when you checkout.  There are 4 add-ons available (“Friend A copy”, “Friend B copy”, “Friend C copy”, and “Friend D copy”).  This is just a convenience to make it easy to buy up to four extra copies in one transaction without having to re-purchase a perk.  You get to choose the version in any case (an extra PC copy is also a choice in addition to Xbox, Playstation and Switch).

If you simply want to financially contribute without any attached perks, that’s an Indiegogo standard option available when you back any project.  You’ll see that option at the top of the list when you click “back it”.

Where The Indiegogo Money Will Go

It depends on how much is raised, but the next big item on our purchase list is to help us produce quality 3D cinematics efficiently.  In the short term we plan to purchase the following technologies that work with our chosen iClone/Unreal Engine pipeline:

  • Faceware:  $1,200 facial facial motion capture software

     
  • Xsens Link:  $12,000 motion capture body suit

     

This will first help with promos and trailers, but eventually for in-game cinematics as well.  $12,000 is a lot of money, but it more than pays for itself compared to what you’d spend getting a professional animator to do the same thing without it.  These kinds of technologies are a must-have for small teams that need to produce high quality animations and cinematics quickly.  

It’s quite amazing, but video game development technology has progressed to the point where ONE PERSON can make a game like Bright Memory in 1 year.  See for yourself:

We are using pretty much the same technology stack as the developer of Bright Memory. 
 

This doesn’t mean if the campaign doesn’t get to $12,000 we’re closing down shop or giving up.  All the money we raise through crowdfunding, pre-orders, and regular investment is in addition to what we’ve already invested on our own money and will continue to invest.  

We are already on the path to make Key of David and we have no intention of stopping.  However, the additional support we receive in these early stages is critical in building momentum, creating brand awareness, and helping to cover setup costs.

This all helps us get to our goal faster.

The Game:

The game's working title is "Key of David".  The game is intended to be a story-driven action adventure shooter game.  Its main characters are four angels: Michael, Sophie, Gabriel, and Dinah.  These main characters find themselves at the center of events as the "Day of the Lord" (the apocalypse) unfolds.  The setting is present day for the most part, but there will be some retelling of critical biblical events, some millenial kingdom flash forwards, and some gameplay in what you might call “heaven” and “hell”.

The end times will be told from pre-millenialist perspective with no pre-tribulation rapture and a literal Two Witnesses.  We have considered the idea of having multiple storylines or endings based on differing prophetic interpretations if it works and time/budget permits.

Telling the story from the perspective of angels makes the storytelling a bit easier.  It's easier to fictionalize the events surrounding angels as opposed to “filling in the blanks” with more well-known bible characters.  Angels in the bible are common and at the same time mysterious, so they're easier to work with artistically.  We can fictionalize the story of our angels and use that as the thematic glue that ties together the more well-known characters and stories.  

Angels also serve as God's messengers and "holy warriors" so it gives the most leeway in terms of making a Christian story centered around action. 

This game is being made for everyone, not just a Christian audience.  We are committed to taking any player from anywhere in the world on a journey that gives them insight into God's plan for mankind by indirectly relating Christian messages and themes through the stories of these four angels.

There's more game pitch at our website, and more that isn't even printed.  The idea is evolving as we go.  If you have specific questions just ask.  If you have ideas, let us know.  We are certainly interested in feedback and creative ideas at this stage where we're still fleshing out the story and finalizing the artistic look.

Early concept art collage:

A short demo of some of our 3d assets:

 

Challenges

Getting a following that believes in the idea and engages with us is the biggest and first challenge.

In a word:  MARKETING

This problem isn’t unique to us, but what we are trying to market is somewhat unique.  While our initial ad experiments have shown people are interested in Christian games for adults, etc. there aren’t a lot of products out there in that category.  Essentially, we are starting from scratch in the sense of building supporters vs. acquiring a chunk of an existing market.

We are patient though and we’ve already learned quite a bit since we went public with the website in early August 2020.  A lot of what we’ve learned is you need to market as early as possible and visuals (gifs, screenshots, short videos) are primary.  So we’re working very hard to get art and gameplay samples in front of our audience as fast as we can.  It’s challenging balancing the marketing with the game development, but not impossible.  Others have done it and succeeded.

Risks

The biggest risk is our game not meeting our expectations in terms of size and quality.  We’re confident that our game will be made, even if it’s significantly smaller than what we have planned.

We want to finance a game that has a lot of cinematics in order to bring our bible and apocalypse stories to life.  This means finding investors and likely publishers to help take the game into professional territory.  If our vision becomes a reality, this means a budget in the millions just based on the scale of cinematics alone.  

Our risk is that this doesn’t go as planned and instead we have a smaller game with say 5 hours of game content compared to 60, and less immersive cinematics that are few and far between.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have read all this so far, a sincere thanks!

Check out our FAQ, comments, and update sections here at Indiegogo.  Also, check out our website www.trutharcade.com for more info and to join our email list.  Joining our email list is SUPER helpful for us measuring our support!

When we post new videos we’ll be sure to post it in the updates section here on our campaign.  There's a definitive list of videos on our website.

You can also help by using Indiegogo's sharing tools to post this campaign on your own social media accounts.  

If you want to connect or engage with us on our own social media, accounts we have:

  • Facebook
    https://www.facebook.com/Truth-Arcade-599237460...
  • Youtube
    https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1KVKnnV5wtqa-...
  • Twitter
    https://twitter.com/TruthArcade
  • Discord Invite
    https://discord.gg/yA5UtxR
  • Blogger
    http://blog.trutharcade.com/
     

Please like, subscribe, follow or chat with us when you get the chance.  Every little show of support adds up.
story_txt:
Who What & WhyTruth Arcade is a husband and wife team (Chantal and David Watson) dedicated to making a high quality Christian game for mature gamers.  The game will be called “Key of David”.Why make a Christian game for so much and why make it "mature"?  The video game industry is bigger now than the movie industry.  We believe there's a market for a game that brings the depth of the Christian message to the video game medium.  It should do so artfully, with a compelling story and with a production quality that the gamers of today expect when they spend up to $60 for a new game release.It should be mature because the message and story of the bible is mature.What We Need & What You GetLike any crowdfunding campaign, the project needs funds and as a backer, you get perks.High quality video games are expensive.  At this stage we are very much “indie”.  However, our ambitions for the game are much higher.  Whether this campaign is a little or a lot successful, it’s part of making our vision for the game a reality.  Even one backer is a success.We’ve structured our perks all around the video game Key of David.  Our perks range from our minimum $1 support level where we acknowledge your awesomeness with many thanks, to our $60 “get everything” perk where you get a PC version of the game, a console version of your choice as well as access to the early prototype(s), beta test version(s), and the early release.We made $60 the maximum perk level price because we figured that’s how much a brand new game costs nowadays.  If you want to contribute more than that, the $60 Level 7 perk (and only Level 7) allows you to purchase extra copies (your choice which version) as an add-on perk for $25 when you checkout.  There are 4 add-ons available (“Friend A copy”, “Friend B copy”, “Friend C copy”, and “Friend D copy”).  This is just a convenience to make it easy to buy up to four extra copies in one transaction without having to re-purchase a perk.  You get to choose the version in any case (an extra PC copy is also a choice in addition to Xbox, Playstation and Switch).If you simply want to financially contribute without any attached perks, that’s an Indiegogo standard option available when you back any project.  You’ll see that option at the top of the list when you click “back it”.Where The Indiegogo Money Will GoIt depends on how much is raised, but the next big item on our purchase list is to help us produce quality 3D cinematics efficiently.  In the short term we plan to purchase the following technologies that work with our chosen iClone/Unreal Engine pipeline:

Faceware:  $1,200 facial facial motion capture software 

Xsens Link:  $12,000 motion capture body suit 
This will first help with promos and trailers, but eventually for in-game cinematics as well.  $12,000 is a lot of money, but it more than pays for itself compared to what you’d spend getting a professional animator to do the same thing without it.  These kinds of technologies are a must-have for small teams that need to produce high quality animations and cinematics quickly.  It’s quite amazing, but video game development technology has progressed to the point where ONE PERSON can make a game like Bright Memory in 1 year.  See for yourself:We are using pretty much the same technology stack as the developer of Bright Memory.  This doesn’t mean if the campaign doesn’t get to $12,000 we’re closing down shop or giving up.  All the money we raise through crowdfunding, pre-orders, and regular investment is in addition to what we’ve already invested on our own money and will continue to invest.  We are already on the path to make Key of David and we have no intention of stopping.  However, the additional support we receive in these early stages is critical in building momentum, creating brand awareness, and helping to cover setup costs.This all helps us get to our goal faster.The Game:The game's working title is "Key of David".  The game is intended to be a story-driven action adventure shooter game.  Its main characters are four angels: Michael, Sophie, Gabriel, and Dinah.  These main characters find themselves at the center of events as the "Day of the Lord" (the apocalypse) unfolds.  The setting is present day for the most part, but there will be some retelling of critical biblical events, some millenial kingdom flash forwards, and some gameplay in what you might call “heaven” and “hell”.The end times will be told from pre-millenialist perspective with no pre-tribulation rapture and a literal Two Witnesses.  We have considered the idea of having multiple storylines or endings based on differing prophetic interpretations if it works and time/budget permits.Telling the story from the perspective of angels makes the storytelling a bit easier.  It's easier to fictionalize the events surrounding angels as opposed to “filling in the blanks” with more well-known bible characters.  Angels in the bible are common and at the same time mysterious, so they're easier to work with artistically.  We can fictionalize the story of our angels and use that as the thematic glue that ties together the more well-known characters and stories.  Angels also serve as God's messengers and "holy warriors" so it gives the most leeway in terms of making a Christian story centered around action. This game is being made for everyone, not just a Christian audience.  We are committed to taking any player from anywhere in the world on a journey that gives them insight into God's plan for mankind by indirectly relating Christian messages and themes through the stories of these four angels.There's more game pitch at our website, and more that isn't even printed.  The idea is evolving as we go.  If you have specific questions just ask.  If you have ideas, let us know.  We are certainly interested in feedback and creative ideas at this stage where we're still fleshing out the story and finalizing the artistic look.Early concept art collage:A short demo of some of our 3d assets: ChallengesGetting a following that believes in the idea and engages with us is the biggest and first challenge.In a word:  MARKETINGThis problem isn’t unique to us, but what we are trying to market is somewhat unique.  While our initial ad experiments have shown people are interested in Christian games for adults, etc. there aren’t a lot of products out there in that category.  Essentially, we are starting from scratch in the sense of building supporters vs. acquiring a chunk of an existing market.We are patient though and we’ve already learned quite a bit since we went public with the website in early August 2020.  A lot of what we’ve learned is you need to market as early as possible and visuals (gifs, screenshots, short videos) are primary.  So we’re working very hard to get art and gameplay samples in front of our audience as fast as we can.  It’s challenging balancing the marketing with the game development, but not impossible.  Others have done it and succeeded.RisksThe biggest risk is our game not meeting our expectations in terms of size and quality.  We’re confident that our game will be made, even if it’s significantly smaller than what we have planned.We want to finance a game that has a lot of cinematics in order to bring our bible and apocalypse stories to life.  This means finding investors and likely publishers to help take the game into professional territory.  If our vision becomes a reality, this means a budget in the millions just based on the scale of cinematics alone.  Our risk is that this doesn’t go as planned and instead we have a smaller game with say 5 hours of game content compared to 60, and less immersive cinematics that are few and far between.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you have read all this so far, a sincere thanks!Check out our FAQ, comments, and update sections here at Indiegogo.  Also, check out our website www.trutharcade.com for more info and to join our email list.  Joining our email list is SUPER helpful for us measuring our support!When we post new videos we’ll be sure to post it in the updates section here on our campaign.  There's a definitive list of videos on our website.You can also help by using Indiegogo's sharing tools to post this campaign on your own social media accounts.  If you want to connect or engage with us on our own social media, accounts we have:

Facebookhttps://www.facebook.com/Truth-Arcade-599237460...


Youtubehttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1KVKnnV5wtqa-...


Twitterhttps://twitter.com/TruthArcade


Discord Invitehttps://discord.gg/yA5UtxR


Bloggerhttp://blog.trutharcade.com/ 
Please like, subscribe, follow or chat with us when you get the chance.  Every little show of support adds up.

story:
The Dark Triad: Dragon’s Death is a 3D-isometric, turn-based, story driven computer CRPG by Autoloot Games Ltd.

The Dark Triad: Dragon’s Death is a 3D-isometric, turn-based computer RPG with an amazing epic history and a fresh dynamic turn-based combat, developed by Autoloot Games Ltd. Autoloot is an indie studio formed by veteran industry game developers from Ubisoft, Gameloft, and Funcom that have participated in the development of games such as Age of Conan, Warhammer Online, Ghost Recon, Splinter Cell, Heroes of Sparta 2 and Prince of Persia, among many others.

 

 

  • A deep history with unexpected twists and many secrets to uncover. 
  •  Brutal and bloody turn-based combat. A brand new system where you define the degree of action and strategy and the speed of battles.
  •  Choose from 5 different cool classes. 
  • A brand new skills and specialty system. Customize your own builds.
  • Hundreds of quests and side quests, with intriguing dialogues. 
  •  A vast map for you to enjoy for dozens of hours. 
  •  An incredible host of enemies for you to slash and crush. 
  •  Pets and Sacred Guardians to assist you in the heat of the battle. 
  •  Fully detailed characters and environments in 3D. 
  •  Items system with thousands of combinations and unique artifacts. 
  •  Epic Achievements.
  •  Play extra-difficulty levels and challenge yourself against beastly elite bosses and enemies.

 

 

We’ve spent 11 long months creating our own proprietary 3D-isometric editor; a model and animations importer; a static, light-mapping, and shadow casting system; a 3D particle and billboards system; and we already have hundreds of tri-dimensional models between NPCs, props, architecture, and environment, plus our own propietary dialogue and scripting tool. We have almost all the technology into place to put our focus on developing content exclusively. This means we have now the time to work hard on the combat logic, the AI, adding and fleshing out the dialogues, side quests, and creating vast lands and secrets for you to explore and discover. We want to surprise you. We'll pay homage to the best CRPGs, but we also want to take the risk to do it our own way.

 

 

The Dark Triad will allow you to chose among 5 different classes. The stats and skills system is being coded at the moment, and in the coming months it will need to be constantly adjusted and thouroughly tested to create a compelling combat system of gameplay. We want combat to pose a challenge and have a remarkable strategic component, even though you can always adjust its difficulty on-the-go to play in an easier or more difficult mode (though it will be always turn-based).

The stats and skills system has been made from scratch. You’ll find a really fresh and original mechanic blended with classic concepts, and this will hopefully cater to turn-based fans by providing some good fun and a challenge! We’ve already written 40% of the dialogues and lore, and the next step will be implementing and associating the dialogues with the characters' actions and choices, skills, stats, items, etc to add the maximum of of gameplay options.

We want you to feel that NPCs and characters are alive, that they have their own agendas, and that they remember what you told or did to them and act accordingly depending on their persona.

 

 

King Jonah disappeared after Vlarmor and the the Dark Wizards besieged Khandor, capital city of the Gilgegard Empire. The evil Dark Triad's power has spread everywhere, and people are getting killed in a macabre survival-of-the-fittest game. To add to their misery, villagers are falling sick after consuming food poisoned with adamantium. 

Also, Akhazal, the Last Dragon, has been seized by the Dark Wizards for nefarious purposes.

A coalition of orcs and goblins are trying to enter Gilgegard through the mountains' Deep Paths with the help of human outcasts, and King Odenar from the Kheravar Empire remains silent about which side he will join...

Meanwhile, the Wisdom Alliance, assembled in a secret place in the Old Human Empire, has agreed to send the best warrior from each race to find King Jonah, allegedly hidden deep in the catacombs of his castle. A grumpy dwarf, a swift halfling, an unflinching elf, and a human ex-knight who deserted the royal guard will try to sneak into Vlarmor’s Castle with the help of a mysterious ranger to find King Jonah and the Last Dragon.

 

Where are the two remaining White Wizards, who were tasked with protecting the king? Has Danath, King Jonah’s future wife, also been killed? Are the the Dark Wizards using Vlarmor for their own obscure plans? Who are the Dark Ones? Why  was the soldier so determined to help find King Jonah after deserting from the Royal Gryphon Knights? And who’s Khain?

 

 

 

The Birth of the Isolated Lands: God and Races

 
Since the dawn of time, humans have tried to answer essential questions of life: the purpose of death, struggle, and suffering.
Tales of gods who gave shape to the world as we know it have been passed down from generation to generation. The forces that set the world in  motion are attributed to the god Ageios, He set the world spinning around the sun to feed it with the star's sacred rays. The creation of diverse peoples, plants, and animals was the deed of the goddess Pleia. She possessed a kindly side that fostered humans, elves, dwarves, and haflings, but also a cruel one that created the or cs,  goblins, and the Dark Ones who would plunge the world into an agonizing war that would last millennia.
 

In Search of the Truth: Denir the Wise

The first humans never understood why the incarnated Evil, with all its horrid deeds, had to exist. Those first humans still remained pure, as their consciences were originally well-protected against any temptation, conceit, or malice. But the Dark forces kept eroding, first almost unnoticeably, all good things they built with so much suffering and struggle. This civilization, which dwelt in what is still known as the Human Empire, reached its pinnacle in the Second Era of Damos, and was led by Denir the Wise. The Royal King was fond of culture, philosophy, and arts. After no physician could prevent his wife from dying of an incurable sickness, he set out in pursuit of knowledge that could set peace to his troubled thoughts and feelings about the meaning of life.

 

Denir's Death in the Cannon of the Void

 He left all his riches behind and set off on a long pilgrimage through the Isolated Lands to look for an ancestral knowledge that could quench his unbearable sorrow. Years passed and Denir grew old. He could only find scattered traces of what seemed to be the commandments of an ancient brotherhood that had long since been extinct. A shredded map he unearthed in some ancient ruins in Gilgegard pointed towards the frozen mountains of Kheravar. Even though the years took their toll on his body, he defied his waning life and forced himself to climb up through sharp edges and ridged ladders, through snow storms and the most inhospitable places, until he reached the Cannon of the Void. Denir reached the top of the Cannon on the brink of death, but he gathered up his last energy to shout these ominous words:“Why?! Why, no matter how hard I tried, could I not find the remedy to the grief that consumed my soul?! "
He then fell asleep, never to wake up... at least not in this life.

 

Theories on Eternal Recurrence in the Isolated Lands

Eternal Recurrence is a phenomenon that has been studied by the most prominent scholars of Gilgegard. In this, the elves' theories share some ideas with those of humans. The first ones to incorporate these ideas into their religious practices were the Asemites, a tribe that dwelt in the North of Kheravar, at the Duirdan Plains . The remnants of their death rituals clearly show that they were convinced of the transmigration of the human soul. They followed a strict rule: it was forbidden to incinerate the deceased body, as they discovered through astral methods that the soul took four to eight days to leave the body and join the universal forces, at which point it would incarnate a new body if it hadn't been able to attain enlightenment. This has yet to be demonstrated by human scholars. All modern trials on this matter have been a complete failure, even though the elves claim to have discovered some truth in such rituals.

Relationship Between Good and Evil and Eternal Recurrence

Nobody is totally good; nobody is totally evil. Each being is a mix of both in varying degrees, regardless of whether or not one is aware of this. The criminal that is hanged because has killed a local tax collector is as guilty as his executioners; the warrior that severs his enemy's head is as guilty as the latter, who chose to be warrior and thus exposed himself to such a fate. The different religions that spread across the Isolated Lands have this belief of good and evil. The White Triad, for example, came as good personified in their avatars Grand Master Teoil and the White Wizards. But even if they were demigods, they were incarnated in flesh and had to gain control of tendencies and temptations of the body, so one could say bad is within them as well. The Dark Triad, in its original form, is naught but twisted good. But why is one born into poverty and another surrounded by abundant richness? Do the deeds of our past life determine our next incarnation? Are the things that we accomplish in this life judged on a  scale that will determine the starting point and tendencies of the next?

 

How Old Are the White Wizards?

Nobody knows how old the three White Wizards are. Always cloaked in white robes and holding wooden staves with gnarled tops, sporting long, soft white beards, and moving gracefully, with hooded cloaks on their backs, their bodies defy the passage of time and seem to remain unchanged. Only a few light wrinkles under their wide-open eyes can be spotted after intense scrutiny. There are written records that talk about some White Wizards when King Athon was ruling the Old Human Empire. Are they the same ones that live among us, trying to spread their message of peace in our troubled lands?

 

 

 

Elves in Agaroth

 
The elves first dwelt in Agaroth. These once-barren lands turned fertile thanks to a clever invention of the first elven settlers, who devised a complex system of irrigation channels to take the water from the Murky Sea into the mainland. Thus the first oases were born, subsequently giving rise to the first bits of trading activity that extended to Gilgegard in the east, which was part of the Human Empire.

 

 

 

Combat in TDT:DD is turn-based. When your party engages in a fight, you can attack or be attacked by the enemy. Who attacks first is determined by the perception rate and the range of vision of your party. When the combat starts, one side attacks, and the other waits for its turn. When it’s your enemies’ turn, you party members can counterattack automatically and perform pre-planned actions that carry over from former turns. You can wreak havoc among your enemies if you plan your turns carefully!

The Chaos Factor

Strategy is very important, and so is action. We’ve devised a system that will allow you to play the way you want. One mechanism we provide is the Chaos Factor. Chaos is a kind of spiritual energy, and you’ll decide the risk to take to try to harness it. You can prepare a skill for latter turns, thus enhancing its effect, but this will at the same time increase the chance that something goes wrong when performing that skill due to the Chaos Factor.

An example:

The chaos factor for Sinister Tattoo is5%, so there is a 5% chance of failure when performing this ability. If you give a boost to this ability, the chaos factor can raise to 15% or more. The chaos factor of the skills can also be influenced by the game zone, events in the story, etc.

 

Let’s be more specific:

The aforementioned ability allows the Elite Thief to create clones of himself along the battlefield, confusing the enemy or creating chaos when they attack the clones instead. This ability has some specializations that grant buffs, debuffs and many more effects depending on the branch you choose.

This ability has a 5% chance of failing. When this happens, the clones only will last for 1 turn. Also, if an enemy attacks one of the clones, the enemy willreceive extra movements and damage if the chaos factor was in effect. This 5% chance is permanent but is a small amount… it’s up to you to decide whether to enhance the skill and raise the chaos factor to 15% or stay into that 5% security zone. In the case of the Conjurer of Bones, you can increase the risk to summon a more powerful Ghoul Ent or a Walking Cabbage.

 

Stats

There are 3 different types of stats: physical, mental, and spiritual. We want to create a logical synergy between the different classes. For example, a Black Warrior can reach the strength cap, but not for power or concentration. Stats are as diverse as armor, perception rate, magical damage, regeneration rate, and many others, which allow you make numerous unique builds.

Each time the player levels up, they will get points to increase their party members’ stats or their special class abilities.

Each level will grant you between 7-15 points to spend on stats, and 7-15 more points for abilities. There is a 30-level cap, so the way you assign these points will go a long way in determining how you play the game.

 

 

Abilities

Abilities allow you adapt combat to your playstyle. With them, you can create an almost unlimited amount of different builds. Each ability is unique and powerful, but to take it to the maximum you will need to learn about how to best combine them with the abilities of your party members to optimize the outcome of your attacks.

Specializations include the abilities to heal your allies, curse your enemies, or enhance your character.

 

 

Let’s take an example, the Conjurer of Bones' “Invoke Stick Insect:”

This ability summons a minion from the Underworld that will throw spears at your enemies. Here are its specializations:

1 – Petrify: each point used here will increase the chances to paralyze a target for two turns.

2. Damage Increase: each point will increase the damage done by the summoned creature.

3. Camouflage: increases the chance to grant invisibility to the summoned creature for 10 turns.

4- Insect Cloning: increases the chance that a new minion respawns where the deceased minion died without the need to use the ability to summon a new one again.

Each skill is different and defined by class. As you can see in the example, an ability combined with its specializations is not only about summoning a creature but many subtler effects. Each ability, especially if boosted for latter turns,can change the fate of a battle.

[THESE ARE THE BASICS FOR COMBAT. WE’LL KEEP ADDING MORE INFO AND CLEARING UP CONCEPTS IN COMING UPDATES]

 

Autoloot Games Ltd., founded by Miguel A.L.M. and Abel Bascuñana, is a computer gaming company based in the UK that aims to bring back the magic of old-school RPGs.

We’ve been playing RPGs for more than 20 years and prior to funding our own company, we’ve worked together on other professional game projects (see images below). Almost a year ago, thanks to our combined experience, we set out together to accomplish our dream of making a classic RPG in a 3D environment.


David Lopez- 3D artist: Professional projects: Ghost Recon, Splinter Cell (Ubisoft), Heroes of Sparta 2 (Gameloft)

David Lucena- Coder: Professional projects: Prince of Persia, Rayman (Gameloft mobile), Elite Forces 77 (Abylight)

Abel Bascuñana- Writer & Game Designer: Professional projects: Age of Conan (Funcom), Warhammer Online (GOA), Dragon City (Social Point), Social Empires (Social Point)

Rafater- Graphic Artist: TaG (C&C Intl.), Dark Gods (Norma Editorial), The Sexiest Art of Rafater (Ed. Babylon), Black Age, Labyrinth Madness, Kololoko

Jose Manuel Alcaraz- Lead Programmer: Spermatozoon (XboxLive), Tower Defender propietary engine, 3D platform engine, Voxel Engine, 2.5D Animation Editor, etc. (Charcostudios)

Miguel AL Morillo- Combat System & AI Designer: Black Age, Labyrinth Madness, Kololoko

Carlos Mangas- Coder: RE (Role-Playing Engine)

Mathieu Morenas- 3D support.

Allie Thek- Chief Editor: MacTribe Magazine, Figment LLC, Dig Publishing, The Celebrity Cafe.

 

 

We’ve opened an Indiegogo and Verkami campaign for all of you that want to help us support the game development for the next two months until we can succeed in our Kickstarter campaign. These funds will help us to pay our 5 team members and stay afloat during this time. We don’t have any publisher behind us and before approaching any one we will try to go crowdfunding so we can remain independent game developers (unless it’s a known rpg publisher that could guarantee us IP rights and the max creative freedom).

 @BrianFargo (inXile Founder): "This game deserves a look at." 

 

For more details about our funding needs, please visiit http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1604283933/the-dark-triad-dragons-death

This civilization, which dwelt in what is still known as the Human Empire, reached its pinnacle in the Second Era of Damos, and was led by Denir the Wise. The Royal King was fond of culture, philosophy, and arts. After no physician could prevent his wife from dying of an incurable sickness, he set out in pursuit of knowledge that could set peace to his troubled thoughts and feelings about the meaning of life.
 

Denir's Death in the Cannon of the Void
 He left all his riches behind and set off on a long pilgrimage through the Isolated Lands to look for an ancestral knowledge that could quench his unbearable sorrow. Years passed and Denir grew old. He could only find scattered traces of what seemed to be the commandments of an ancient brotherhood that had long since been extinct. A shredded map he unearthed in some ancient ruins in Gilgegard pointed towards the frozen mountains of Kheravar. Even though the years took their toll on his body, he defied his waning life and forced himself to climb up through sharp edges and ridged ladders, through snow storms and the most inhospitable places, until he reached the Cannon of the Void. Denir reached the top of the Cannon on the brink of death, but he gathered up his last energy to shout these ominous words:“Why?! Why, no matter how hard I tried, could I not find the remedy to the grief that consumed my soul?! "
He then fell asleep, never to wake up... at least not in this life.

 
Theories on Eternal Recurrence in the Isolated Lands
Eternal Recurrence is a phenomenon that has been studied by the most prominent scholars of Gilgegard. In this, the elves' theories share some ideas with those of humans. The first ones to incorporate these ideas into their religious practices were the Asemites, a tribe that dwelt in the North of Kheravar, at the Duirdan Plains . The remnants of their death rituals clearly show that they were convinced of the transmigration of the human soul. They followed a strict rule: it was forbidden to incinerate the deceased body, as they discovered through astral methods that the soul took four to eight days to leave the body and join the universal forces, at which point it would incarnate a new body if it hadn't been able to attain enlightenment. This has yet to be demonstrated by human scholars. All modern trials on this matter have been a complete failure, even though the elves claim to have discovered some truth in such rituals.

Relationship Between Good and Evil and Eternal Recurrence
Nobody is totally good; nobody is totally evil. Each being is a mix of both in varying degrees, regardless of whether or not one is aware of this. The criminal that is hanged because has killed a local tax collector is as guilty as his executioners; the warrior that severs his enemy's head is as guilty as the latter, who chose to be warrior and thus exposed himself to such a fate. The different religions that spread across the Isolated Lands have this belief of good and evil. The White Triad, for example, came as good personified in their avatars Grand Master Teoil and the White Wizards. But even if they were demigods, they were incarnated in flesh and had to gain control of tendencies and temptations of the body, so one could say bad is within them as well. The Dark Triad, in its original form, is naught but twisted good. But why is one born into poverty and another surrounded by abundant richness? Do the deeds of our past life determine our next incarnation? Are the things that we accomplish in this life judged on a  scale that will determine the starting point and tendencies of the next?

 
How Old Are the White Wizards?

Nobody knows how old the three White Wizards are. Always cloaked in white robes and holding wooden staves with gnarled tops, sporting long, soft white beards, and moving gracefully, with hooded cloaks on their backs, their bodies defy the passage of time and seem to remain unchanged. Only a few light wrinkles under their wide-open eyes can be spotted after intense scrutiny. There are written records that talk about some White Wizards when King Athon was ruling the Old Human Empire. Are they the same ones that live among us, trying to spread their message of peace in our troubled lands?
 

 
 
Elves in Agaroth
 
The elves first dwelt in Agaroth. These once-barren lands turned fertile thanks to a clever invention of the first elven settlers, who devised a complex system of irrigation channels to take the water from the Murky Sea into the mainland. Thus the first oases were born, subsequently giving rise to the first bits of trading activity that extended to Gilgegard in the east, which was part of the Human Empire.
 
 

 
Combat in TDT:DD is turn-based. When your party engages in a fight, you can attack or be attacked by the enemy. Who attacks first is determined by the perception rate and the range of vision of your party. When the combat starts, one side attacks, and the other waits for its turn. When it’s your enemies’ turn, you party members can counterattack automatically and perform pre-planned actions that carry over from former turns. You can wreak havoc among your enemies if you plan your turns carefully!
The Chaos Factor
Strategy is very important, and so is action. We’ve devised a system that will allow you to play the way you want. One mechanism we provide is the Chaos Factor. Chaos is a kind of spiritual energy, and you’ll decide the risk to take to try to harness it. You can prepare a skill for latter turns, thus enhancing its effect, but this will at the same time increase the chance that something goes wrong when performing that skill due to the Chaos Factor.
An example:
The chaos factor for Sinister Tattoo is5%, so there is a 5% chance of failure when performing this ability. If you give a boost to this ability, the chaos factor can raise to 15% or more. The chaos factor of the skills can also be influenced by the game zone, events in the story, etc.
 

Let’s be more specific:
The aforementioned ability allows the Elite Thief to create clones of himself along the battlefield, confusing the enemy or creating chaos when they attack the clones instead. This ability has some specializations that grant buffs, debuffs and many more effects depending on the branch you choose.
This ability has a 5% chance of failing. When this happens, the clones only will last for 1 turn. Also, if an enemy attacks one of the clones, the enemy willreceive extra movements and damage if the chaos factor was in effect. This 5% chance is permanent but is a small amount… it’s up to you to decide whether to enhance the skill and raise the chaos factor to 15% or stay into that 5% security zone. In the case of the Conjurer of Bones, you can increase the risk to summon a more powerful Ghoul Ent or a Walking Cabbage.
 

Stats
There are 3 different types of stats: physical, mental, and spiritual. We want to create a logical synergy between the different classes. For example, a Black Warrior can reach the strength cap, but not for power or concentration. Stats are as diverse as armor, perception rate, magical damage, regeneration rate, and many others, which allow you make numerous unique builds.
Each time the player levels up, they will get points to increase their party members’ stats or their special class abilities.
Each level will grant you between 7-15 points to spend on stats, and 7-15 more points for abilities. There is a 30-level cap, so the way you assign these points will go a long way in determining how you play the game.
 

 
Abilities
Abilities allow you adapt combat to your playstyle. With them, you can create an almost unlimited amount of different builds. Each ability is unique and powerful, but to take it to the maximum you will need to learn about how to best combine them with the abilities of your party members to optimize the outcome of your attacks.
Specializations include the abilities to heal your allies, curse your enemies, or enhance your character.
 

 
Let’s take an example, the Conjurer of Bones' “Invoke Stick Insect:”
This ability summons a minion from the Underworld that will throw spears at your enemies. Here are its specializations:
1 – Petrify: each point used here will increase the chances to paralyze a target for two turns.
2. Damage Increase: each point will increase the damage done by the summoned creature.
3. Camouflage: increases the chance to grant invisibility to the summoned creature for 10 turns.
4- Insect Cloning: increases the chance that a new minion respawns where the deceased minion died without the need to use the ability to summon a new one again.
Each skill is different and defined by class. As you can see in the example, an ability combined with its specializations is not only about summoning a creature but many subtler effects. Each ability, especially if boosted for latter turns,can change the fate of a battle.
[THESE ARE THE BASICS FOR COMBAT. WE’LL KEEP ADDING MORE INFO AND CLEARING UP CONCEPTS IN COMING UPDATES]
 


Autoloot Games Ltd., founded by Miguel A.L.M. and Abel Bascuñana, is a computer gaming company based in the UK that aims to bring back the magic of old-school RPGs.
We’ve been playing RPGs for more than 20 years and prior to funding our own company, we’ve worked together on other professional game projects (see images below). Almost a year ago, thanks to our combined experience, we set out together to accomplish our dream of making a classic RPG in a 3D environment.


David Lopez- 3D artist: Professional projects: Ghost Recon, Splinter Cell (Ubisoft), Heroes of Sparta 2 (Gameloft)

David Lucena- Coder: Professional projects: Prince of Persia, Rayman (Gameloft mobile), Elite Forces 77 (Abylight)

Abel Bascuñana- Writer & Game Designer: Professional projects: Age of Conan (Funcom), Warhammer Online (GOA), Dragon City (Social Point), Social Empires (Social Point)

Rafater- Graphic Artist: TaG (C&C Intl.), Dark Gods (Norma Editorial), The Sexiest Art of Rafater (Ed. Babylon), Black Age, Labyrinth Madness, Kololoko

Jose Manuel Alcaraz- Lead Programmer: Spermatozoon (XboxLive), Tower Defender propietary engine, 3D platform engine, Voxel Engine, 2.5D Animation Editor, etc. (Charcostudios)

Miguel AL Morillo- Combat System & AI Designer: Black Age, Labyrinth Madness, Kololoko

Carlos Mangas- Coder: RE (Role-Playing Engine)

Mathieu Morenas- 3D support.
Allie Thek- Chief Editor: MacTribe Magazine, Figment LLC, Dig Publishing, The Celebrity Cafe.
 


 
We’ve opened an Indiegogo and Verkami campaign for all of you that want to help us support the game development for the next two months until we can succeed in our Kickstarter campaign. These funds will help us to pay our 5 team members and stay afloat during this time. We don’t have any publisher behind us and before approaching any one we will try to go crowdfunding so we can remain independent game developers (unless it’s a known rpg publisher that could guarantee us IP rights and the max creative freedom).
 @BrianFargo (inXile Founder): "This game deserves a look at." 
 
For more details about our funding needs, please visiit http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1604283933/the-dark-triad-dragons-death

story:
The Dread Gazebo Needs +5 to CHA

My name is Jerry LeNeave, I'm a journalist and freelance writer in the tabletop RPG industry. I've been running The Dread Gazebo for 4 years now, and although I don't plan on stopping anytime soon, I need to bring the site's quality up to par. The problem is, I won't be able to do it without some help.

Aside from the blog, you may know me from my work with Obsidian Portal as their Content Director, and the lead host and producer of their Haste Podcast - both of which have won gold and silver ENnie Awards on multiple occasions. I've also worked a lot with Kobold Press and SVD Press in the past, as you can see I have a pretty good track record for creating things that people enjoy.

Raising funds for the site is so crucial because it's going to allow for us to stay secure, current, and also to take our content to the next level. More importantly, this will open doors for new types of content like a web show about games, high quality convention coverage, live streams, and more. Please read on to see if you'd like to help out and what's in it for you.


How We're Improving The Site

Whether you're familiar with The Dread Gazebo or not, just visiting it once should be enough to see that we're dedicated to creating quality, readable, unique, and aesthetically pleasing gaming journalism for over 4 years now. However, our setup is becoming dated - I'm recording videos on an cell phone that's taped to a duct-tape bolstered tripod in the best lighting conditions we can muster. Said lighting ranges from "harsh overbright lamp" to "yellowed incandescent" to "not quite enough, please tell me what I'm supposed to be looking at".

With visuals and video content becoming more and more prevalent and desired in today's media, the sub-par videos just aren't cutting it anymore. Neither is having a downed website for weeks at a time due to security holes from an outdated (and thus exploitable) blog theme. Not to mention the possibility of having it display as a jumbled mess depending on what device/browser you're using.

To accomplish fixing all of these issues at minimum we're going to need an actual camera that's not a webcam or a cell phone, a tripod without a 6 CON score, and a subscription to our theme provider's services for updates and security patches. Real lighting would be nice too, but let's tackle the basics first.

Why I Need Help

Being able to purchase updated equipment and software to help produce content for the blog has been a struggle lately. I work two jobs, own a home, I'm putting 2 kids through school, and my student loans are bearing down on me. My better half has just finished her degree and is currently looking for work and we share a single car. So, as you could imagine, disposable income isn't something that I have much of right now.

This is where your contributions can help make all the difference here, these aren't expenses I can cover myself right now. The running and upkeep of the blog has always been an out-of-pocket thing for me, a labor of passion. However, it's getting to the point where simply keeping up with the basics of running the site are called into question. 

Almost all of the gaming materials you see reviewed on the blog are provided as promotional product for review. All because I am in the good graces of many publishers and game developers and am lucky enough to get these sort of things for free in an exchange for candid press coverage. It's a pretty sweet gig, I'm not going to lie. Unfortunately, board games and RPGS are not redeemable for the supplies needed to actually run the site.

What this all boils down to is that I really just want to be able to keep bringing the best stuff possible to as many people as I can. Exclusive interviews, original content, reviews, unboxings, and everything else in between. I want to continue sharing my love for gaming, but I don't want to half-ass it with with poor quality videos or a website that's unreadable or simply broken. 

    What's The $500  Going Toward?

    My goal amount is modest, and it's going to go directly toward basic supplies to achieve securing and creating top-notch content for The Dread Gazebo. Here's the run down of what exactly is to be purchased:

    • A "Developer" level subscription to Elegant Themes ($89) for an always updated, secure, responsive blog theme that works across all devices. [Reached!]
    • A 60" tripod that's not duct taped together like my current one ($20).I'll never make a video as unstable as my Gamma World Unboxing ever again, I promise! [Reached!]
    • A decent camera capable of 1080p High Def video at a minimum of 30fps, preferably 60fps ($300). [Reached!]
    • Any Stretch Goals if possible (see below)
    • Any remaining funds will cover taxes, shipping (on the to-be purchased goods), and IndieGoGo/PayPal's cut.

    What's In It For You?

    Aside from the gratification of knowing you are helping to keep bringing great content to the gaming community, there are also some fun rewards for everyone who helps out like exclusive D&D / system neutral fantasy content for use in your tabletop games, signal boosts, recognition, and maybe even some official Dread Gazebo stickers. I know most of the rewards are intangibles, but physical goods and shipping would really cut into the whole purpose of this project.

    I hope you'll find the descriptions in the backer levels succinct, but if you have any questions feel free to comment, shoot me an email, tweet, or however else you'd like to reach me, and I'll get back to you ASAP. Also be sure to check the updates section for any developments.

    If for some reason you feel like helping out but none of the reward tiers interest you or you simply don't want any of the perks you can just donate directly using PayPal.


    Stretch Goals!

    I am totally blown away by everyone's support, thank you all so much!  Here are our current stretch goals:

    Stretch 3 (Final): Windows Movie Maker No More! - [Reached!]

    Reason: Legit video editing software (Sony Movie Studio 13 Suite)

    Reward: Adventure Module: A King With No Crown. A dungeon crawl for use with 5th edition D&D (see FAQ regarding licensing)

    This third and final stretch goal is going to take my previously award winning system neutral dungeon, A King With No Crown, and turn it into a full fledged adventure for characters level 5-7. It won't be crammed onto a single page, but it will be crammed with flavor! Full of unique (new) monsters, artifacts, and challenges for use in your 5th edition D&D game(s). Use it as a one shot or wedge it into an existing campaign as a deadly dungeon crawl. 

    Please see the updates section of the campaign regarding this goal.



    Stretch 2: High Dev Live Streams! [Reached!]

    Reason: 1080p webcam for live streams.

    Reward: PDF of 8 new character backgrounds for use with D&D 5e. (see FAQ regarding licensing)

    I've always been a big producer of original content for fantasy RPGs. D&D is usually my flavor but I also like to roll system neutral. That being said, this next stretch goal is going to be an exclusive PDF full of 8 new character backgrounds for use in your 5th edition D&D games, along with guidelines on how to put them to use in other systems. This will be available to everyone who has backed at the $5 level or higher. (ETA: Q1 2015) [Cover Mockup]

    This is a test bed for me to try and gauge interest to see how much people desire my writing and original content for games. If the goal is reached, this extra money will go toward upgrading my crappy 720p webcam to a decent 1080p one for use in live streams, like the one I just did for the 5e Player's Handbook!



    Stretch 1: Even Better Videos! - [Reached!]

    Reason: Proper lighting equipment for video production.

    Reward: Web Show

    Awesome! This means we'll be able to bring you great coverage from upcoming conventions like Winter Fantasy, and get started on our web show. Thank you all very much, expect further details on the web show to come after the campaign ends!


    Risks & Challenges

    I've been doing this for a while now, and I'm very confident in my abilities both technically and creatively to provide great content and to deliver on my promises. However, I am only human, and there are times when content such as a blog post or video may become delayed a few days due to having to prioritize family or work obligations over those of the hobby.

    You should also know that although I'm new to IndieGoGo I've been supporting independent projects on Kickstarter for a few years now. I have also orchestrated a very successful Kickstarter for Obsidian Portal, as well as advised on and promoted several industry friends' (successful) crowdfunding projects as well.

    Please Share!

    If you can't pitch in that's totally understandable. Believe me, not having enough disposable income to do certain things is something I'm very familiar with - hence, this campaign.

    If you could just spread the word for me about the project here however you can, it would be greatly appreciated. Social media, word of mouth, blogs, podcasts, etc. it all helps!

    Thanks for stopping by and considering helping out The Dread Gazebo!

    FAQ

    Q: Aren't you going to Gencon this year? If you can afford to do that, why are you running this fundraiser?

    A: I am going to gencon this year, for just one night, and it's all on the dime of my gracious employer Obsidian Portal. My wife and I also both have press badges which gets us into the show for free, it's only going to take the cost of a tank of gas in our 4 cylinder Honda to get there and back.

    Q: The Obsidian Portal Kickstarter made good money, obviously you're rolling in dough and are just a big fat liar.

    A: All of the funds from the Obsidian Portal Kickstarter went directly to funding the website's revamp and the talented developers behind it. I was simply performing my job duties as Community Manager in helping run it and received no extra pay.

    Q: How are you going to produce 5th edition D&D material without even knowing what the licensing model will be in place for 3rd party publishers yet?

    A: I have already spoke with a few folks from WotC regarding this project and everything is in the clear. The PDFs will not be released before licensing is finalized, and so plans to make them fully compliant without breaking any rules are already in the works.
