story:
This campaign is over. Still want to support or buy Legends of Pixelia?

Check out Legends of Pixelia on itch.io: LoP @ itch.io




Welcome to Legends of Pixelia's IndieGoGo page! I am glad you made it this far.

So what is this all about? Legends of Pixelia is an action role-playing game that combines retro pixelart with modern gameplay mechanics. Tired of left-clicking through hordes of brainless one-hit-KO enemies? Random dungeons, precise controls via gamepad (or keyboard) and a strong fighting game AI provide challenging encounters. Plug in some gamepads to enjoy local multiplayer coop or balanced PvP combats (1 -- 4 players).


   "There are some gameplay elements that old school beat ‘em ups had yet to refine in the early days, and many modern players now lean towards more actionable experiences. The upcoming Legends of Pixelia looks to combine the best of both worlds."
Luke Siuty
 
   "Legends of Pixelia is an excellent pixel art action RPG with gameplay reminiscent of The Binding of Isaac, but with more tactical combat, persistent upgrades and local multiplayer."
Calum Fraser
 

Target platforms: Windows, Mac OS X, Linux.
Possible platforms: OUYA, PlayStation, PlayStation Mobile, Xbox.
(I may port the game to the possible platforms, but the development of the PC version comes first. No guarantee here...)


The following paragraphs give more info about the current state of the project, about the developer and all IndieGoGo related stuff. Not interested in reading, just wanna play? No problem - grab a version of the demo suitable for your operating system in the next section.

Don't forget to vote for Legends of Pixelia on Steam Greenlight:

• Open Greenlight in your Steam client
• Open Greenlight in your browser


You can download the demo version here (Win/ Mac/ Linux):
• Download @ Indie DB
• Download or Unity Webplayer @ Game Jolt

Did you enjoy the demo? Do you have great ideas on how to improve it? Well, go ahead and tell me about it.


Hi, my name is Florian Siemer, people call me Sima most of the time. I live, study and work in Berlin (Germany).
My one-man game studio is called SimaGames.


I like retro games, platformers and RPGs, especially when they are gameplay focused and when they offer full gamepad support.


Educational path: I finished an apprenticeship in IT, the bachelor’s studies and I’m now close to the end of my master’s studies in media and computing with a focus on game technology and interactive systems.


Sebastian Stern is in charge of the music used in Legends of Pixelia.

Basti spents every free minute at his computer producing music or soundscapes. Generally he focuses on epic orchestral Scoring or normal electronic music like Drum’n Bass or TripHop. He started making music on his Guitar more then 10 years ago, but today he mostly works digital.


In case of the Legends of Pixelia soundtrack, Sebastian tried to capture that old school 8-bit vibe and combined it with more modern techniques of electronic music production. So creating the soundtrack for a retro style game was a new experience for him. He enjoys producing the music for Legends of Pixelia and both of us hope you like it.


All dungeon maps and all dungeon rooms are procedurally generated to offer a fresh experience on every run. Unlike in most roguelikes, you keep your progress in Legends of Pixelia even after death. So if you managed to beat dungeon 1 at least once, you will always be able to continue or restart your journey at dungeon 2 and so on.

At the current state of development there are two dungeons in Legends of Pixelia:

(1) The Crypt

An unholy place full of undeads. The Crypt has three stages, each one ending in a boss fight.

(2) Winged Cave

A cave inhabited mostly by flying enemies. As well as The Crypt, the Winged Cave has three stages and three bosses.

More dungeons will be added over the process of development. I'd love to release the final version of Legends of Pixelia with six or more dungeons and the typical "normal, nightmare, hell" or "new game+, new game++" mechanics that you know from other action RPGs. :-)


Your cute little pixelated heroes! I like the feeling of constant progress, that's why I decided to let the heroes in Legends of Pixelia be real ones: Your characters can level up, choose stat points, change equipment and they are saved and can be played over multiple gaming sessions.

You won't even lose progress when dying (just some EXP). Too easy for you? You have the option to create hardcore heroes - those will stay dead once they die.

At the current state of development there are three hero classes in Legends of Pixelia:

Knight
Noble fighter, fast attacks, easy combos
(X): Sky Slash
(B): Sword Blast
(Y): Shield Dash
-
Barbarian
Powerful fighter, strong skills, slow attacks
(X): Shockwave
(B): Throw Axe
(Y): Whirlwind
-
Paladin
Blessed fighter, ranged magic, crowd control
(X): Force Nova
(B): Spirit
(Y): Holy Cross

More hero classes will be added to the game over the process of development. Since four is the maximum number of players in multiplayer, at least four different hero classes would be nice for the final version of Legends of Pixelia to add some variety.


There are multiple ways of how to increase your hero's power in Legends of Pixelia. One of them is leveling up your hero and choosing stat points. There is a choice of 5 different stat “packages”:
• Melee: Increases your (X) skill damage and 2x your hit points
• Ranged: +(B) skill damage, +all damage, +heal per room
• Special: +(Y) skill damage, +all damage, +defense
• Offensive: +3x all damage
• Defensive: +hit points, +defense, +heal per room

Every time you put 5 stat points into the same package, you gain access to a passive skill:


Another way to build the stats of your hero is by choosing the right equipment and by upgrading your items. Every dungeon stage has a treasure room with a giant treasure chest inside of it:


When opening a big treasure chest, your hero has the choice to either pick one of two randomly generated items or to pick gold:


The blacksmith can upgrade your already equipped items in exchange for gold and item durability:


I can't wait to see how you folks out there build your hero. It will be interesting to see if some crazy theorycrafters will start playing around with the stats, trying to break the game's balance. :-)


A PvP match consists of multiple rounds. A round starts with all players alive, each one in a corner of a randomly generated room. The last surviving player or team gains one point and wins the round. The first player or team that has 5 points wins the match. The duration of a match with equally skilled players should be around 10 to 20 minutes.

There are three different PvP modes in Legends of Pixelia at the current state of development:

2 vs 2:


1 vs 1:


Death Match, 4 players FFA:


All matches in Versus mode are played with a set of preset characters, called champions. Champions have fixed stats and are balanced in power to provide a fair PvP experience, suitable for e-sports tournaments.


Legends of Pixelia started as a student project in April 2014. I continued the development in my spare time and on weekends and it worked well -- the game mechanics are up an running.

Since SimaGames is a one-man game studio, $2500 should be enough to pay my bills for 2 -- 3 months. Legends of Pixelia needs more content like new enemies, bosses, dungeons and hero classes. A few months of full time work on the project should suffice to create a proper version that is worth being sold early access for.

I could really use these coins...


Distribution:


Stretch goals?
I decided not to mention fix stretch goals here. Instead I will give you, the community, the option to vote for them. There will be a poll on what to do with the money for every $1500 above the funding goal. You are not just "some backers", you become part of Legends of Pixelia by backing it! :-)








The Sentinel will be a versatile hero in Legends of Pixelia. His ability to destroy enemy shots in combination with his jump skill, that allows him to get over a small abyss, is a great way to counter ranged foes and to support your team in multiplayer. Your thrown spear flies non-linear: Trick your enemies!


Your number one choice for full offensive ranged combat. The Mage is able to cast devastating fire spells that provide high damage with big AoE. His lack in defense is no problem for you, right? Just evade hostile attacks and let your meteors and fire balls smash your enemies to pieces!




There are early bird and team versions of some of the perks. Check them out on the right of this page.

Delivery (ETA):
Beta Access: April 2015
Premium Hero Classes: Mai 2015
Soundtrack, Wallpapers: September 2015
Full Game: September 2015


Legends of Pixelia is a niche game in this world that's dominated by casual mobile games and first-person shooters. Support variety in video games! Every dollar will help to finish Legends of Pixelia. Thanks for your support!

How to help without spending money?
• Vote for Legends of Pixelia on Steam Greenlight:

• Open Greenlight in your Steam client
• Open Greenlight in your browser

• Share the IndieGoGo campaign:
Tell your social media network about Legends of Pixelia. The more people know about it, the more people are able to help. You can use the sharing tools located on the left of this page. :-)

• Give feedback:
Tell me what you think about Legends of Pixelia. Did you enjoy the demo? Do you have great ideas on how to improve it? Well, go ahead and tell me about it.


This is a flexible campaign and you will get your perk rewards regardless of the success or failure of this campaign.

A failure means that I have to develop Legends of Pixelia on the weekends only and therefore the start of the early access and the release of the game will be delayed by an indeterminable amount of time.
story_txt:
This campaign is over. Still want to support or buy Legends of Pixelia?
Check out Legends of Pixelia on itch.io: LoP @ itch.io

Welcome to Legends of Pixelia's IndieGoGo page! I am glad you made it this far.So what is this all about? Legends of Pixelia is an action role-playing game that combines retro  
pixelart with modern gameplay mechanics. Tired of left-clicking through 
 hordes of brainless one-hit-KO enemies? Random dungeons, precise  
controls via gamepad (or keyboard) and a strong fighting game AI provide
  challenging encounters. Plug in some gamepads to enjoy local multiplayer coop or balanced PvP combats (1 -- 4 players).





  
"There are some gameplay elements that old school beat ‘em ups had yet to refine in the early days, and many modern players now lean towards more actionable experiences. The upcoming Legends of Pixelia looks to combine the best of both worlds."
Luke Siuty 




  
"Legends of Pixelia is an excellent pixel art action RPG with gameplay reminiscent of The Binding of Isaac, but with more tactical combat, persistent upgrades and local multiplayer."
Calum Fraser 




Target platforms: Windows, Mac OS X, Linux.Possible platforms: OUYA, PlayStation, PlayStation Mobile, Xbox.(I may port the game to the possible platforms, but the development of the PC version comes first. No guarantee here...)The following paragraphs give more info about the current state of the project, about the developer and all IndieGoGo related stuff. Not interested in reading, just wanna play? No problem - grab a version of the demo suitable for your operating system in the next section.Don't forget to vote for Legends of Pixelia on Steam Greenlight:


• Open Greenlight in your Steam client
• Open Greenlight in your browser


You can download the demo version here (Win/ Mac/ Linux):
• Download @ Indie DB• Download or Unity Webplayer @ Game Jolt
Did you enjoy the demo? Do you have great ideas on how to improve it? Well, go ahead and tell me about it.



Hi, my name is Florian Siemer, people call me Sima most of the time. I live, study and work in Berlin (Germany). My one-man game studio is called SimaGames.I like retro games, platformers and RPGs, especially when they are gameplay focused and when they offer full gamepad support.Educational path: I finished an apprenticeship in IT, the bachelor’s 
studies and I’m now close to the end of my master’s studies in media and
 computing with a focus on game technology and interactive systems.


Sebastian Stern is in charge of the music used in Legends of Pixelia. Basti spents every free minute at his computer producing music or soundscapes. Generally he focuses on epic orchestral Scoring or normal electronic music like Drum’n Bass or TripHop. He started making music on his Guitar more then 10 years ago, but today he mostly works digital. In case of the Legends of Pixelia soundtrack, Sebastian tried to capture that old school 8-bit vibe and combined it with more modern techniques of electronic music production. So creating the soundtrack for a retro style game was a new experience for him. He enjoys producing the music for Legends of Pixelia and both of us hope you like it.

All dungeon maps and all dungeon rooms are procedurally generated to offer a fresh experience on every run. Unlike in most roguelikes, you keep your progress in Legends of Pixelia even after death. So if you managed to beat dungeon 1 at least once, you will always be able to continue or restart your journey at dungeon 2 and so on.At the current state of development there are two dungeons in Legends of Pixelia:

(1) The Crypt

An unholy place full of undeads. The Crypt has three stages, each one ending in a boss fight.

(2) Winged Cave

A cave inhabited mostly by flying enemies. As well as The Crypt, the Winged Cave has three stages and three bosses.More dungeons will be added over the process of development. I'd love to release the final version of Legends of Pixelia with six or more dungeons and the typical "normal, nightmare, hell" or "new game+, new game++" mechanics that you know from other action RPGs. :-) 

Your cute little pixelated heroes! I like the feeling of constant progress, that's why I decided to let the heroes in Legends of Pixelia be real ones: Your characters can level up, choose stat points, change equipment and they are saved and can be played over multiple gaming sessions. You won't even lose progress when dying (just some EXP). Too easy for you? You have the option to create hardcore heroes - those will stay dead once they die.At the current state of development there are three hero classes in Legends of Pixelia:






Knight
Noble fighter, fast attacks, easy combos
(X): Sky Slash
(B): Sword Blast
(Y): Shield Dash
-





Barbarian
Powerful fighter, strong skills, slow attacks
(X): Shockwave
(B): Throw Axe
(Y): Whirlwind
-





Paladin
Blessed fighter, ranged magic, crowd control
(X): Force Nova
(B): Spirit
(Y): Holy Cross
    



More hero classes will be added to the game over the process of development. Since four is the maximum number of players in multiplayer, at least four different hero classes would be nice for the final version of Legends of Pixelia to add some variety.

There are multiple ways of how to increase your hero's power in Legends of Pixelia. One of them is leveling up your hero and choosing stat points. There is a choice of 5 different stat “packages”:
• Melee: Increases your (X) skill damage and 2x your hit points
• Ranged: +(B) skill damage, +all damage, +heal per room
• Special: +(Y) skill damage, +all damage, +defense
• Offensive: +3x all damage
• Defensive: +hit points, +defense, +heal per roomEvery time you put 5 stat points into the same package, you gain access to a passive skill:Another way to build the stats of your hero is by choosing the right equipment and by upgrading your items. Every dungeon stage has a treasure room with a giant treasure chest inside of it:When opening a big treasure chest, your hero has the choice to 
either pick one of two randomly generated items or to pick gold: The blacksmith can upgrade your already equipped items in exchange for gold and item durability:I can't wait to see how you folks out there build your hero. It will be interesting to see if some crazy theorycrafters will start playing around with the stats, trying to break the game's balance. :-) 

A PvP match consists of multiple rounds. A round starts with all players
 alive, each one in a corner of a randomly generated room. The last 
surviving player or team gains one point and wins the round. The first 
player or team that has 5 points wins the match. The duration of a match
 with equally skilled players should be around 10 to 20 minutes.There are three different PvP modes in Legends of Pixelia at the current state of development:
2 vs 2:

1 vs 1:

Death Match, 4 players FFA:

All matches in Versus mode are played with a set of preset characters, called champions. Champions have 
fixed stats and are balanced in power to provide a fair PvP experience, 
suitable for e-sports tournaments.

Legends of Pixelia started as a student project in April 2014. I continued the development in my spare time and on weekends and it worked well -- the game mechanics are up an running.Since SimaGames is a one-man game studio, $2500 should be enough to pay my bills for 2 -- 3 months. Legends of Pixelia needs more content like new enemies, bosses, dungeons and hero classes. A few months of full time work on the project should suffice to create a proper version that is worth being sold early access for.I could really use these coins...Distribution:Stretch goals?I decided not to mention fix stretch goals here. Instead I will give you, the community, the option to vote for them. There will be a poll on what to do with the money for every $1500 above the funding goal. You are not just "some backers", you become part of Legends of Pixelia by backing it! :-) 








The Sentinel will be a versatile hero in Legends of Pixelia. His ability to destroy enemy shots in combination with his jump skill, that allows him to get over a small abyss, is a great way to counter ranged foes and to support your team in multiplayer. Your thrown spear flies non-linear: Trick your enemies!



Your number one choice for full offensive ranged combat. The Mage is able to cast devastating fire spells that provide high damage with big AoE. His lack in defense is no problem for you, right? Just evade hostile attacks and let your meteors and fire balls smash your enemies to pieces!






There are early bird and team versions of some of the perks. Check them out on the right of this page.
Delivery (ETA):Beta Access: April 2015Premium Hero Classes: Mai 2015Soundtrack, Wallpapers: September 2015Full Game: September 2015

Legends of Pixelia is a niche game in this world that's dominated by casual mobile games and first-person shooters. Support variety in video games! Every dollar will help to finish Legends of Pixelia. Thanks for your support!How to help without spending money?• Vote for Legends of Pixelia on Steam Greenlight:


• Open Greenlight in your Steam client
• Open Greenlight in your browser
• Share the IndieGoGo campaign:Tell your social media network about Legends of Pixelia. The more people know about it, the more people are able to help. You can use the sharing tools located on the left of this page. :-) • Give feedback:Tell me what you think about Legends of Pixelia. Did you enjoy the demo? Do you have great ideas on how to improve it? Well, go ahead and tell me about it.

This is a flexible campaign and you will get your perk rewards regardless of the success or failure of this campaign. A failure means that I have to develop Legends of Pixelia on the weekends only and therefore the start of the early access and the release of the game will be delayed by an indeterminable amount of time.

story:
Wrap-up 21 Feb 2012 - Thank you to all the supporters for this project!  We more than met the goal of the fundraiser, and work is underway to get this adventure produced.  Those of you who didn't sign on as supporters but who are interested in keeping track of the project are invited to follow further developments on the developer's blog:  http://rthorm.wordpress.com


Update 6 Feb 2012 - Just, wow...Stephen Peto quickly turned my sketch into the beginning of a wonderful map.  There's still a lot of detail to be added, but just look at that



I was asked about upgrades...  I'm not positive, but I think the easiest way to upgrade a contribution is to make an additional, non-specific donation in the amount of the difference, and choose the "No Perk, just a contribution!" option.  Then let me know so I make sure you are at the right level when the perks are sent out.  I think that will be the easiest way to take care of it.


Update 5 Feb 2012 - Yet another update; itâ€™s been a busy weekend, and things are moving along as we get to the final stretch. Iâ€™ve also sent a couple of very (very!) rough maps of the whole area to the contributors for their comments.

Hereâ€™s a first draft of a map of the frontier port town by Stephen Peto. Check it outâ€¦


  ...earlier -There was an announcement out to the DragonQuest Players' Association which has gotten word to a few more people, and that's nudged contributions to the brink of reaching $1000.  If you aren't already familiar with the DQPA, you should check out the site for lots of DragonQuest resources and links.  And if you are a DQ player who isn't a part of DQPA, you should join (it's free).


Update 4 Feb 2012 - This was mentioned in one of the updates, but I thought it would be good to include it here, as well:  There is now a BONUS PERK for all contributors, regardless of level: a reformatted copy of The Water Works. Itâ€™s still incomplete, but it was a useful testbed to use for working out the fonts and layout, and adding a couple pieces of interior art to try to come close to the â€˜SPI style.â€™ I hope youâ€™ll also give me feedback on how well you think this is looking; Iâ€™m going to use this formatting for the Wilderness of Aâ€”-, as well.

If youâ€™re a contributor and youâ€™re interested in reviewing this draft, drop me a line, and Iâ€™ll forward a copy to you. Also, if you want a copy of the Quick Character Generation system I mentioned in the last update, I can send that out, as well.


Update 27 Dec 2011 - The playtest version of the Quick Character Generation system is now available.  A version of this will be included with the adventure as a method for creating characters to use with the adventure. Feedback and playtest comments are very much welcomed. 


Update 23 Dec 2011 - To build some of the backstory for the adventure, I'm going to try out an online session of the metagame Microscope.  Current contributors are going to be invited to participate in this game.  It's a chance to try out playing Microscope (which I haven't been able to play yet) as well as building a rich and varied setting for the adventure.


Update 1 Dec 2011 - The campaign has just kicked off, and here's the first update: The guy I contacted about doing the interior art is very interested in participating, and is offering very affordable rates for his work.  A couple of samples of his work are included in the pitch below. Final details about working with him, and will depend on the funding we are able to raise.

DragonQuest History

The DragonQuest role-playing game was first published by Simulations Publications Inc. (SPI), a wargame/boardgame publisher, in 1980. The game won the Origins award for Best Role-Playing Game, and it looked like it might become a serious competitor as a fantasy role-playing game, but SPI went bankrupt in 1982. There were only a handful of commercial adventures ever produced for the game. (http://grognard.com/info1/dqmanifest.html#Adventures)

DragonQuest has a base of fans throughout the world who continue to play the game.

This project will lead to the production of a new adventure for DragonQuest (though GMs who play other RPGs can certainly adapt it to their preferred systems).

Our Story

The project designer has already produced one independent supplement for the game, as well as one previous adventure that was released a number of years ago. This project is a labor of love, not something that would likely be commercially viable. There is little awareness of DragonQuest, the game is long out-of-print, and the audience is small, but hopefully still dedicated.

Contributors can sign up to be playtesters or can choose other perks being offered to help support the development of the project, as well as to have a voice in the direction of the adventure.  Even the name of the adventure is open at this point, so if you'd like to be involved in this project, join in!

To engage with the DragonQuest community, and to make this something that will be useful to groups playing the game, there will be regular status updates and discussion of the project posted here and at the project page (https://rthorm.wordpress.com/the-wilderness-of-a/).

What We Need & What You Get

Supporters who contribute at least $25 will get an electronic copy of the finished adventure, and will have it at least 6 months before the adventure is released in other formats.  Eventually, the adventure will probably be available through a sales site like DriveThruRPG, but contributors will be able to have it well before then.

There are also opportunities to get a hardcopy of the adventure.  These will almost certainly be very limited editions.  Copies of "Poor Brendan's Almanac," a supplement for DragonQuest that has never before been available in print, will also be available as a special premium for contributors.  All hardcopy printed premiums will be 8 1/2" x 11" size Print-On-Demand saddle-stiched books with full-color covers and black-and-white interiors with illustrations.  (Non-US contributors will have to pay an additional international postage premium for shipping. International postage premium should hopefully only be a maximum of $10.)

There isn't much needed in the way of resources or material to create an adventure for a role-playing game.  The main thing that is needed is time, and having these funds will allow me to spend some time on this project.

Special Perks

There are a lot of opportunities for special perks for people who are really interested in supporting this idea and in helping to customize it.  If you really want to see new rules for a new Skill or a new College of Magic, there are opportunities to sponsor those to be included in the finished adventure.  The names for the different levels of perks (Mercenary, Adventurer, and Hero) correspond to the three levels for characters in the game.

Custom perks are also possible, if there's a different level of interaction and contribution you want to have with this project, just get in touch, and we'll discuss what you have in mind.  



Funding Goals

I'm going with the flexible funding model, because this project will go ahead, whether or not the goal is met.  I appreciate the support of those who have already said they would help to fund this project, and I want to reward those who do participate with the opportunity to have this adventure before it is released more widely.

If the basic goal is met, this will be at least a 16-page adventure (plus maps, charts, etc.); if it surpasses the basic goal and reaches $1500, the adventure will be at least a 32-page adventure. If the goal is not reached, the adventure will still be produced, but in a more limited fashion.

Because we're using flexible funding for this project, work will be going on during the fundraiser, and the project completion target is the end of March 2012.

Two additional incentives to encourage you to contribute:

First, if we reach the initial goal by December 15, I will allocate time to this immediately so that a draft playtest version will be available by December 25 (assuming that a lot of old players might be gathering during the holidays).

Second, if we raise at least $2000, I will also commit to producing a sequel adventure to The Water Works by the end of 2012.  This adventure was another one of the proposed adventure ideas that was discussed for this project, and there are already some sketch ideas for this.  No additional contributions are required, and everyone who contributes to this project will also receive a copy of The Earth Works if that bonus is reached.

Art

There is also an opportunity to have a custom art component. If support reaches $3000, I will have a custom piece of cover art commissioned from Timothy Truman (the artist who did the cover art for Enchanted Wood; Iï¿½ve been in brief contact with him, and it looks like it would be possible to commission him for a piece). That might also end up being a separate crowd funding project, rather than rolling it into the adventure fundraiser.


I was going to see about contacting John Garcia (who did many of the interior drawings for the DQ rulebook), but unfortunately he passed away a few years ago.  But I may have found someone else who does some black and white work that is reminiscent of Garcia.


***   That artist is Nate Marcel, who is offering very reasonable rates for some interior art.  I like his enthusiasm about this project, too.  The black and white illustrations here are some samples of his work.  You can see some other examples in a gallery of B+W work and on his blog.


If the fundraiser reaches its basic goal, I will allocate around 20% of the funds for art.  At the rates Nate is offering, that would get probably 4 interior spot illustrations.



The Impact

Yes, as someone commented in the early discussion about this project, it's a lot to pay for an adventure, especially for one for a long out-of-print role-playing game.  If all you want is to buy a new adventure, there are lots of other options available to you.  This is as much to provide some support for the game and to show that there is still a community of players who play the game.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you only want to contribute a small amount, your name will still be listed among the contributors acknowledgments (unless you prefer to remain anonymous).

It will also be hugely helpful that everyone spread the word about this project. DragonQuest has always been a niche game, and the fan base of potential supporters is really small. Sharing information about this project with others will help us reach the people who will be interested in knowing about this and supporting it.

story:
My Journey!

In 2010 I set out on a journey to qualify for the London Olympic games as a swimmer for my native country of Portugal. I dropped everything going on in my life, career, house, friends and moved to Arizona to train full time.

Along the way I picked up Crossfit to better prepare me to reach my goal.

This year I entered the Crossfit Open as a fun experience to be part of a team with Urban Warfit, the gym where I train at.

Today I find myself as an individual qualifier for the Southwest Region Crossfit Games, in a position to fight for a spot at this year's Crossfit Games in California.

(You can read a more detailed account of my journey in a recent article published by Crossfit games written by Emily Warren: http://games.crossfit.com/article/faster-land-a...

Why this Campaign?

No "self discovery" journey is without trials and tribulations, and mine is no exception. I have encountered physical, psychological and financial challenges along the way.

The goal of this campaign is two fold really. It serves to assist to a degree some of the financial challenges that I am coming across (by your donations), but also the psychological by letting me know that people believe in the importance of my journey.

The donations will help fund my trip to Colorado for the competition, as well as the preparation leading up to the competition (altitude training, equipment, etc).

I named the suggested donations as traditional Crossfit movements, in the spirit of Crossfit. I will be documenting the journey in Colorado (blog, pictures and video) and sharing as a thank you for anyone who contributes.

(Any donation helps and is appreciated, you don't need to follow the suggested ones.)

A huge "Obrigada" for helping me in my Journey!

My Journey!
In 2010 I set out on a journey to qualify for the London Olympic games as a swimmer for my native country of Portugal. I dropped everything going on in my life, career, house, friends and moved to Arizona to train full time.
Along the way I picked up Crossfit to better prepare me to reach my goal.
This year I entered the Crossfit Open as a fun experience to be part of a team with Urban Warfit, the gym where I train at.
Today I find myself as an individual qualifier for the Southwest Region Crossfit Games, in a position to fight for a spot at this year's Crossfit Games in California.
(You can read a more detailed account of my journey in a recent article published by Crossfit games written by Emily Warren: http://games.crossfit.com/article/faster-land-a...


Why this Campaign?
No "self discovery" journey is without trials and tribulations, and mine is no exception. I have encountered physical, psychological and financial challenges along the way.
The goal of this campaign is two fold really. It serves to assist to a degree some of the financial challenges that I am coming across (by your donations), but also the psychological by letting me know that people believe in the importance of my journey.
The donations will help fund my trip to Colorado for the competition, as well as the preparation leading up to the competition (altitude training, equipment, etc).
I named the suggested donations as traditional Crossfit movements, in the spirit of Crossfit. I will be documenting the journey in Colorado (blog, pictures and video) and sharing as a thank you for anyone who contributes.
(Any donation helps and is appreciated, you don't need to follow the suggested ones.)
A huge "Obrigada" for helping me in my Journey!

story:
The Story

BetBudz is the brainchild of Gino Khoury and Daniel Stroll. We created BetBudz out of our own desire to make wagers against friends for games we already played consistently.

When hanging out together, we were already making friendly wagers - whether deciding the better 8-ball pool player, or the superior QuizUp Trivia king. We needed a way to make things more exciting. Gino felt he was the best, so we asked him to put his money where his mouth was -- ten minutes later, he was buying lunch for his buddies!

The truth is, mobile gaming is fun, but increasing the stakes against your friends is even more fun! And that’s why we created BetBudz, to make your gaming experience even better.

How it Works

We designed BetBudz to be super simple to use. Open the app, select a friend, challenge them to a game, and set the wager, be it real money or Bitz.

From your account, you can add more money, cash out your Bitz, or simply check on the progress of games. 

Ending the Game

At the end of your game, BetBudz asks both participants who won. If both participants came to the same conclusion, the money or bitz are simply transferred to the winner. In the case of a conflict, one of our game resolution service representatives will take a look at the results and decide on the winner. 

Buddy Bitz

Wagering is fun, but it doesn’t always need to be for real money. Sometimes the wager itself is what’s important. That’s why we created our own in game currency – Buddy Bitz.

Bitz can be used to play games against your buddy’s. But the best part is that Bitz can be accumulated and converted into prizes! So play all you want at no risk, and then earn rewards for all your gaming work! 


How we Get Paid

BetBudz takes a percentage of every winning bet, much like other 3rd party applications rendering a service. Think PayPal - Every transaction that takes place over our app is charged a convenience fee. So the game is 100% free to download and use, we make our money only off of winning bets. 

Where We Are in the Process and Why We Need Your Help

Our app is designed and is in the process of being developed. We should have a functional beta version in the next month.

Why we’ve turned to the crowdfunding community is because our app requires more permits than the average app, and to get up and running we need help with funding.


Wagering on Games of Skill

Many people ask us "is this considered gambling"? The simple answer is no. BetBudz allows users only to wager on games of skill, not games of chance.


Risks and Challenges

The following risks and challenges currently exist:

Integrating with games: 
We are working with our development team to ensure every mobile game available is playable on our platform.

Matching up new users: 
Part of why we are launching on Indiegogo is to gauge interest and ensure we have a healthy user base on launch!

Making sure everything is a level playing field/you’re playing your own skill level: 
We are working with our development team on an algorithm to ensure when meeting new buddies, they are at the same skill level as you.


Other Ways You Can Help

Outside of contributing to our campaign financially, there are plenty of way you can help us out!

  • Like our Facebook page and share our page!
  • Follow us on Twitter and help us promote the campaign from there!
  • Share this campaign page to your network using Indiegogo's campaign share features!

story:
What is Transfiguration

Transfiguration is adventure mobile game. Story of the game is inspired by fantasy/new weird literature. Main features of the game are realistic real-time combat system on mobile devices and classic story driven game play.

Game itself is 60% done, you can see first teaser where are shown various location, enemies and some game mechanism.

Gameplay

You will fight against various enemies led by half ghoul half vampire Ghramp.

Ghramp
Ghramp is trying to get superpower experimenting with extraction of ghoul and zombies blood. He is building army of transformed soldiers , ghoul and using transformation to create some other enemies you'll need to fight with.

Game is clearly real-time action game with some RPG features, driven by strong story.

 Game characters, which are done so far.

To support story of the game, I'm building comics sheets, which will appear during the game play.


In Transform Factory


In Hospital

My Goals

I was working hard to come to phase described above, but there is still lot of work to do. So i want to add more content, work more on level design and i want to invest into soundtrack, which I'm missing completely so far. I want to more focus on testing and optimization as well.

Here are my planned targets with your help:

  • Goal 1: EUR 2.500: Add more game content at least 3 hours of playing to finish the game. Android Os optimization. Add more test iterations.
